src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/lib/artifacts/jsonld/document/gen/main.js.ittf



   1 module wizzi-demo.plugin.lib.artifacts.jsonld.document.gen.main
   2     kind jsfile
   3     # Example of language artifact that targets
   4     # the JSON-LG 1.0 (2014) specification.
   5     #
   6     # This is a code write based artifact generator.
   7     # It generates a json document.
   8     #
   9     var md = module.exports = {}
  10     var myname = 'wizzi-demo.advanced.plugins.lib.artifacts.jsonld.jsonlg.main';
  11     set md.gen
  12         function gen
  13             { model
  14             { ctx
  15             callback
  16             # check the model is a wizzi model of type 'jsonld'
  17             if model.wzElement !== 'jsonld'
  18                 return
  19                     _ callback
  20                         _ ctx.error
  21                             @ myname + " error: the model paramater should be an 'jsonld' wizzi model"
  22                             @ model
  23             _ ctx.w("Not implemented yet.")
  24             _ callback(null, ctx)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/lib/examples/first.flow.ittf



   1 flow
   2     # Primitive types | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/primitives/
   3     # type | object type | maybe type
   4     # boolean | Boolean | ?boolean
   5     # string | String | ?string
   6     # number | Number | ?number
   7     # null
   8     # void
   9     # symbol
  10     # mixed | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/mixed/
  11     # any | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/any/
  12     # function method(x: number, y: string, z: boolean) {}
  13     function method
  14         number x
  15         string y
  16         boolean z
  17     # function acceptsMaybeString(value: ?string) {}
  18     function acceptsMaybeString
  19         ?string value
  20     # { propertyName?: string }
  21     {
  22         string propertyName?
  23     # function acceptsObject(value: { foo?: string }) {}
  24     function acceptsObject
  25         { value
  26             string foo?
  27     # function acceptsOptionalString(value?: string) {}
  28     function acceptsOptionalString
  29         string value?
  30     # function acceptsOptionalString(value: string = "foo") {}
  31     function acceptsOptionalString
  32         string value
  33             default "foo"
  34     # Literal types | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/literals/
  35     # function acceptsTwo(value: 2) {}
  36     function acceptsTwo
  37         lit value 2
  38     # function getColor(name: "success" | "warning" | "danger") {}
  39     function getColor
  40         lit name "success" | "warning" | "danger"
  41     # Function types | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/functions/
  42     # function concat(a: string, b: string): string {}
  43     function concat
  44         string a
  45         string b
  46         : string
  47     #
  48     # Object types | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/objects/
  49     # var obj1: {
  50     # foo: number,
  51     # bar: boolean,
  52     # baz: string,
  53     # } = {
  54     # foo: 1,
  55     # bar: true,
  56     # baz: 'three',
  57     # };
  58     #
  59     var obj1
  60         {t
  61             number foo
  62             boolean bar
  63             string baz
  64             boolean foo?
  65         {
  66             @ foo 1
  67             @ bar true
  68             @ baz 'three'
  69     # var foo: number  = obj.foo; // Works!
  70     var foo: number  = obj.foo
  71     # or
  72     var foo: number
  73         + obj.foo
  74     # Exact object types | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/objects/#toc-exact-object-types
  75     # var foo: {| foo: string |} = { foo: "Hello", bar: "World!" }; // Error!
  76     var foo
  77         {t
  78             |
  79                 string foo
  80                 boolean baz
  81         {
  82             @ foo "Hello"
  83             @ baz true
  84     # Object as maps | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/objects/#toc-objects-as-maps
  85     # var o: { [string]: number } = {};
  86     var o
  87         {t
  88             number
  89                 [ string  $$ this is an indexer
  90         {
  91     # var obj: { [user_id: number]: string } = {};
  92     var obj
  93         {t
  94             string
  95                 [
  96                     number user_id $$ $$ this is a named indexer
  97         {
  98     # Array Type
  99     # let arr: Array<number> = [1, 2, 3];
 100     let arr
 101         -[ number
 102             @ 1
 103             @ 2
 104             @ 3
 105     # `-[` is ArrayType
 106     # number is the ArrayItemType
 107     # the `@` tag (jsPropertyOrvalue) as first child means a `[` initializer
 108     # let arr1: ?number[] = null;
 109     let arr1
 110         -[? number = null
 111     # `-[?` is NullableArrayType
 112     # let arr1: (?number)[] = [null];
 113     # the `=` tag as first child means an inline initializer
 114     let arr1
 115         [ number?
 116             = null
 117     # const readonlyArray: $ReadOnlyArray<number> = [1, 2, 3]
 118     const readonlyArray
 119         [ro number
 120             @ 1
 121             @ 2
 122             @ 3
 123     # const readonlyArray: $ReadOnlyArray<{x: number}> = [{x: 1}];
 124     const readonlyArray
 125         -[ro
 126             -{
 127                 -@ x number
 128             {
 129                 @ x 1
 130     # const someOperation = (arr: Array<number | string>) => {
 131     const someOperation
 132         =>
 133             param arr
 134                 -[ number | string
 135     # const someOperation = (arr: $ReadOnlyArray<number | string>) => {
 136     const someOperation
 137         =>
 138             param arr
 139                 -[ro number | string
 140     # Generic type | https://flow.org/en/docs/types/generics/
 141     # function identity<T>(value: T): T {}
 142     function identity<T>
 143         T value
 144         : T
 145     # type IdentityWrapper = {
 146     # func<T>(T): T
 147     # }
 148     type IdentityWrapper
 149         @ func
 150             function <T>
 151                 param T
 152                 : T

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/lib/wizzi/schemas/flow.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema jsonld
   2     # Example wizzi schema used by this package demos.
   3     # It is an experimental implementation of a
   4     # vocabulary, taxonomy, onthology and direct graph schema.
   5     # Is inspired by
   6     # . RDF11 [https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/]
   7     # . OWL2 [https://www.w3.org/TR/owl2-primer/]
   8     # . JSON-LD [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld-syntax/]
   9     export-to json
  10     e comment
  11         tag #
  12     e jsonlditem
  13         is-abstract
  14         r comment/s
  15         r jsonlditem/s
  16     e nodeObject : jsonlditem
  17         tag +
  18         # A node object.
  19         # The `wzName` is the `JSON-LD @id` property.
  20         a language
  21             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
  22         a container
  23             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
  24         a reverse
  25             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
  26         m wzInitialize
  27             set this.__jsonld
  28                 {
  29             set this.__wizzi
  30                 {
  31             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  32                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
  33                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
  34                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
  35                 if item.wzElement === 'graph'
  36                     set this.graph = item
  37                     set this.__jsonld['@graph'] = item.__jsonld
  38             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.wzName)
  39                 set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.wzName
  40                 set this.__wizzi.__id = this.wzName
  41             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  42                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
  43                     if !item.__key
  44                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
  45                     else
  46                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  47                         var ss = item.__key.split(':')
  48                         if ss.length > 1
  49                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1]] = item.__jsonld
  50                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1] + '_ns'] = ss[0]
  51                         else
  52                             set this.__wizzi[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  53                 elif item.wzElement === 'type'
  54                     set this.type = item
  55                     set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
  56                     set this.__wizzi.__type = item.__localName
  57                     set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__prefix
  58                     # TODO
  59                     # set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__ns
  60                 elif item.wzElement === 'context' || item.wzElement === 'graph'
  61                     # done already
  62                 else
  63                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `nodeObject` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
  64             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
  65             set this.__jsonProps
  66                 {
  67                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
  68                     @ __wizzi this.__wizzi
  69         m isType
  70             param type
  71             return this.type ? this.type.isType(type) : false
  72         m nodesOfType
  73             param type
  74             param gotten
  75             if this.graph
  76                 if !gotten
  77                     set gotten = []
  78                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  79                     return gotten
  80                 else
  81                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  82             elif this.isType(type)
  83                 if !gotten
  84                     return [this]
  85                 else
  86                     _ gotten.push(this.__wizzi)
  87             else
  88                 if !gotten
  89                     return []
  90     e jsonld : nodeObject
  91         is-root
  92         # Can be a `document` or a container of many `documents`.
  93         # As a `document` can be a top `node` element or the container of
  94         # an array of top `node` elements.
  95         m wzInitialize
  96             var isArrayOfDocuments = true
  97             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  98                 if item.wzElement !== 'document'
  99                     set isArrayOfDocuments = false
 100             if isArrayOfDocuments
 101                 set this.__jsonld
 102                     [
 103                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 104                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 105                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)

 107                     {

 110                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);

 112     e document : nodeObject
 113         tag ld-doc
 114         # Can be a top `node` element or the container of
 115         # an array of top `node` elements.
 116         # Must be child of the `jsonld` element.
 117         # Allows multiple documents in a single ittf source document
 118         m wzInitialize
 119             var isArrayOfNodes = true
 120             foreach item in this.jsonlditems

 122                     set isArrayOfNodes = false
 123             if isArrayOfNodes
 124                 set this.__jsonld
 125                     [
 126                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 127                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 128                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 129                 set this.__jsonProps
 130                     {
 131                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 132             else
 133                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 134             return
 135     e term : jsonlditem
 136         tag @
 137         # The `@` tag has nothing to do with the JSON-LD reserved word prefix.
 138         # Core wizzi schemas often use tha `@` tag symbol to indicate object properties (key-values).
 139         # A `term` element is a key-value pair (property) in a `nodeObject` or `context` element.
 140         # The key is a short-hand string that expands to an IRI or a blank node identifier.
 141         # If the `term` element has children elements the `wzName` is the key and
 142         # the child or children are the value. If it has no children the `wzName` is
 143         # splitted in a key and a value pair separated by the first blank char.
 144         # In a `context` element keys define the term,
 145         # and values are the IRIs associated with the term.
 146         # In a `nodeObject` keys may expand to an absolute IRI using the active context,
 147         # and values must be one of the following elements:
 148         # `valueItem`, or
 149         # `nodeObject`, or
 150         # `valueObject`, or
 151         # list or set `array`, or
 152         # an array of zero or more of the possibilities above, or
 153         # `languageMap`, or
 154         # `indexMap`
 155         a id
 156             # The `JSON-LD @id` property.
 157             # When the parent is a `nodeObject` the 'id' attribute
 158             # means: 'This value is an identifier that is an IRI'
 159         a reverse
 160             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
 161         a language
 162             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
 163         a container
 164             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
 165         m wzInitialize
 166             var nv = verify.parseNameValue(this.wzName)
 167             # log 'nv.name(), nv.value()', nv.name(), '/', nv.value()
 168             if this.jsonlditems.length === 0
 169                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 170                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.id)
 171                     set this.__jsonld
 172                         {
 173                             @ ['@id'] this.id
 174                 else
 175                     set this.__jsonld = nv.value()
 176                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 177                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 178                         set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 179                     else
 180                         set this.__jsonld
 181                             {
 182                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 183                                 @ ['@language'] this.language
 184                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 185                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 186                         set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 187                     else
 188                         set this.__jsonld
 189                             {
 190                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 191                                 @ ['@reverse'] this.reverse
 192                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 193                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 194                         set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 195                     else
 196                         set this.__jsonld
 197                             {
 198                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 199                                 @ ['@container'] this.container
 200             else
 201                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 202                 set this.__jsonld = {}
 203                 if verify.isNotEmpty(nv.value())
 204                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = nv.value()
 205                 else
 206                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.id
 207                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 208                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 209                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 210                     set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 211                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 212                     set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 213                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 214                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 215                     if item.wzElement === 'type'
 216                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
 217                         set this.__type = item.__localName
 218                         set this.__type_ns = item.__prefix
 219                         # TODO
 220                         # set this.__type_ns = item.__ns
 221                     elif item.wzElement === 'valueObject'
 222                         set this.__jsonld['@value'] = item.__jsonld
 223                     elif item.wzElement === 'context'
 224                         set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 225                     elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 226                         if !item.__key
 227                             _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 228                         else
 229                             set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 230                     elif item.wzElement === 'array'
 231                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 232                     elif item.wzElement === 'list'
 233                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 234                     elif item.wzElement === 'set'
 235                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 236                     elif item.wzElement === 'nodeObject'
 237                         if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 238                             _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 239                         else
 240                             set this.__jsonld
 241                                 [
 242                                     @ item.__jsonld
 243                     else
 244                         _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `term` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 245             set this.__jsonProps
 246                 {
 247                     @ __key this.__key
 248                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 249     e context : jsonlditem
 250         # Defines a local context in a node object.
 251         # The `wzName` can be null, an absolute IRI or a relative IRI.
 252         # If the `wzName` is null it contains a context definition.
 253         # Its parent must either be a `nodeObject` or a `document` element or
 254         # the `jsonld` element root.
 255         # Its keys must either be terms, compact IRIs, absolute IRIs,
 256         # or the attributes `language`, `base`, and `vocab`.
 257         # `nodeObject` elements contained in a `context` element must be
 258         # either an expanded term node with allowed attributes: id (the wzName), reverse, type, language, container
 259         a language
 260             # must have the lexical form described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 261         a base
 262             # must be an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null
 263         a vocab
 264             # must be a absolute IRI, a compact IRI, a blank node identifier, a term, or null
 265         m wzInitialize
 266             set this.__jsonld
 267                 {
 268             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 269                 set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 270             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.base)
 271                 set this.__jsonld['@base'] = this.base
 272             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.vocab)
 273                 set this.__jsonld['@vocab'] = this.vocab
 274             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 275                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 276                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
 277                     if !item.__key
 278                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 279                     else
 280                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 281                 else
 282                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `context` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 283             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
 284             set this.__jsonProps
 285                 {
 286                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 287     e graph : nodeObject

 294                     set isArrayOfNodes = false

 307         m nodesOfType

 316     e type : jsonlditem
 317         # Must be either an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, a compact IRI (including blank node identifiers),
 318         # a term defined in the active context expanding into an absolute IRI, or an array of any of these
 319         m wzInitialize
 320             if this.jsonlditems.length > 0
 321                 set this.__jsonld = []
 322                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 323                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 324                     if item.wzElement === 'array'
 325                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 326                     else

 328             else
 329                 set this.__jsonld = this.wzName

 333                     set this.__localName = ss[1]

 338         m isType
 339             param type
 340             if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 341                 foreach value in this.__jsonld
 342                     if value === type
 343                         return true
 344             else
 345                 return this.__jsonld === type
 346     e valueObject : jsonlditem
 347         tag value
 348         # Is used to explicitly associate a type or a language with a value
 349         # to create a typed value or a language-tagged string.
 350         # May contain a `type`, a `language` or an `index` attribute, or a `context` element
 351         # but must not contain both a `type` and a `language` key at the same time.
 352         # A value object must not contain any other keys that expand to an absolute IRI or keyword.
 353         # The `wzName` contains the `@value` content. It must be either a string, a number,
 354         # true, false or null.
 355         # The value associated with the `type` element/attribute must be a term, a compact IRI,
 356         # an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null.
 357         # The value associated with the `language` attribute must have the lexical form
 358         # described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 359         a language
 360             # The `JSON-LD @language key`
 361             # The value must have the lexical form described
 362             # in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null.
 363         a index
 364             # The `JSON-LD @index key`
 365             # The value associated with the `index` attribute must be a string.
 366         m wzInitialize
 367             set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 368             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 369                 if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 370                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 371                 else
 372                     set this.__jsonld
 373                         {
 374                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 375                             @ ['@language'] this.language
 376             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.index)

 378                     set this.__jsonld['@index'] = this.index

 381                         {
 382                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 383                             @ ['@index'] this.index

 391                             {
 392                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld

 396                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld

 399                             {
 400                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld

 404             set this.__jsonProps

 407     e set : jsonlditem

 443         tag [

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/root/t/artifact-generation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve an ArtifactGenerator by its name
   4         # Generators are searched in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getArtifactGenerator
   7         string generationName
   8         +
   9         var generator = this.artifactGenerators[generationName] || null
  10         if generator == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set generator = require('./lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getArtifactGenerator'
  23                             @ 'Error loading artifact generator: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.artifactGenerators[generationName] = generator
  25         return generator

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/root/t/schema-definition.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziSchema definition in JSON format
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getSchemaDefinition
   7         string schemaName
   8         var definition = this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] || null
   9         if definition == null
  10             var schemaJsonUri
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-schema.g.json'
  14             if this.file.exists(schemaJsonUri)
  15                 try
  16                     set definition = this.file.readJSON(schemaJsonUri)
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getSchemaDefinition'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi schema definition: ' + schemaJsonUri + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] = definition
  24         return definition

   6         extension ittf
   7         $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/t/demo_module.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     $params name
   3     kind jsfile
   4     import path
   5     import util
   6     import wizzi
   7     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   8     var inspect = require('object-inspect')
   9     var ${name}
  10         function
  11             _ heading1
  12                 @ 'DEMO ${name}'
  13             $hook
  14     function heading1
  15         param text
  16         log ''
  17         log '****************************************'
  18         log '** ' + text
  19         log '****************************************'
  20         log ''
  21     set module.exports = ${name}
  22     if typeof require != 'undefined' && require.main === module
  23         _ ${name}

   2     $params result|notUsed

   6         if err
   7             throw
   8                 new Error
   9                     _ JSON.stringify
  10                         @ err
  11                         @ null
  12                         @ 2
  13         $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/ittf__copy/generate.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob demo-plugin
   2     $
   3         console.log( '__dirname',  __dirname);)
   4         var ittf_root             = path.join(__dirname, 'root');
   5         var ittf_lib              = path.join(__dirname, 'lib');
   6         var dest_folder           = path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '..', 'local');
   7     line ittf-root
   8         cwd-folder ${ittf_root}
   9         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  10         wfjob/any_js()
  11             ignore ${ittf_root}/**/*__copy.*/**/*.js.ittf
  12         $include wfjob/any_json
  13     line ittf-lib
  14         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib}
  15         dest-folder ${dest_folder}/lib
  16         wfjob/any_js()
  17             ignore ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.js.ittf
  18         artifact any_ittf_inside___copy
  19             src ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.ittf
  20             extension ittf
  21     production
  22         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  23         line-ref ittf-root
  24         line-ref ittf-lib

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/source/generate.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var path = require('path')
   4     var async = require('async')
   5     var wizzi = require('wizzi')
   6     function exec
   7         param gen_callback
   8         # begin params
   9         var $name = 'wizzi-demo - jsonld plugin generation'
  10         var $schemaNames
  11             [
  12                 @ 'jsonld'
  13         var $destFolder
  14             _ path.resolve
  15                 @ __dirname
  16                 @ '..'
  17                 @ 'local'
  18         # end params
  19         _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
  20             {
  21                 @ user 'stefi'
  22                 @ role 'admin'
  23                 @ storeKind 'filesystem'
  24                 { config
  25                     @ wfBaseFolder __dirname
  26                     [ plugins
  27                         @ 'wizzi-core'
  28                         @ 'wizzi-js'
  29                         @ 'wizzi-web'
  30                 { job
  31                     @ name $name
  32                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  33                         _ path.join
  34                             @ __dirname
  35                             @ 'ittf'
  36                             @ 'generate.wfjob.ittf'
  37                     @ productionOptions
  38                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  39                             {
  40                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  41                                 @ basedir __dirname
  42                                 @ verbose 2
  43                     { globalContext
  44             f_cb_no_err( result)
  45                 if err
  46                     if gen_callback
  47                         return
  48                             _ gen_callback
  49                                 _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  50                     else
  51                         return
  52                             _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  53                 _ async.map
  54                     @ $schemaNames
  55                     function async_item
  56                         param schemaName
  57                         param callback
  58                         log 'Generating schema ' + schemaName
  59                         _ wizzi.generateWizziModelTypes
  60                             {
  61                                 { configOptions
  62                                 { wfschema
  63                                     @ name schemaName
  64                                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  65                                         _ path.join
  66                                             @ __dirname
  67                                             @ 'ittf'
  68                                             @ 'lib'
  69                                             @ 'wizzi'
  70                                             @ 'schemas'
  71                                             @ schemaName + '.wfschema.ittf'
  72                                     @ outputPackageFolder $destFolder
  73                             function
  74                                 param err
  75                                 param result
  76                                 if err
  77                                     return
  78                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  79                                 _ callback(result)
  80                     f_cb_no_err( result)
  81                         if err
  82                             if gen_callback
  83                                 return
  84                                     _ gen_callback
  85                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  86                             else
  87                                 return
  88                                     _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  89                         else
  90                             if gen_callback
  91                                 return
  92                                     _ gen_callback
  93                                         @ null
  94                                         @ result
  95     set module.exports
  96         function
  97             param callback
  98             _ exec(callback)
  99     if require.main === module
 100         _ exec

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/flow/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var build = require('./source/generate')
   4     function exec
   5         param callback
   6         _ build
   7             @ callback
   8     set module.exports
   9         function
  10             param callback
  11             _ exec(callback)
  12     if require.main === module
  13         _ exec

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/artifacts/localPlugin/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     +
   4     var util = require('util')
   5     var path = require('path')
   6     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   7     +
   8     var md = module.exports = {}
   9     set md.name = 'local'
  10     +
  11     #
  12         # FactoryPlugin class
  13         #
  14         # Uses the current folder as the root location of model factories, transformers,
  15         # artifacts and schema definitions.
  16         #
  17         # To make the plugin work your folder structure must be:
  18         # | this file
  19         # | - lib
  20         # |     - artifacts
  21         # |     - wizzi
  22         # |         - models
  23         #
  24     class FactoryPlugin
  25         ctor
  26             { wizziPackage
  27                 { file
  28             { provides
  29             set this.file = wizziPackage.file
  30             set this.provides = provides
  31             set this.modelFactories = {}
  32             set this.modelTransformers = {}
  33             set this.artifactGenerators = {}
  34             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}
  35         m initialize
  36             { options
  37             callback
  38             # TODO
  39             return
  40                 _ callback(null)
  41         m getName
  42             return 'local'
  43         m getFilename
  44             return __filename
  45         m getProvides
  46             return this.provides
  47         $include plugin/model-factory
  48         $include plugin/model-transformation
  49         $include plugin/artifact-generation
  50         $include plugin/schema-definition
  51     +
  52     # The plugin interface
  53     set module.exports
  54         {
  55             { provides
  56                 [ schemas
  57                     @ 'sample_0_1'
  58                 [ artifactGenerators
  59                 [ modelTransformers
  60             @ createFactoryPlugin
  61                 function createFactoryPlugin
  62                     { wizziPackage
  63                     { options
  64                     callback
  65                     var plugin
  66                         new FactoryPlugin
  67                             @ wizziPackage
  68                             @ this.provides
  69                     _ plugin.initialize
  70                         @ options
  71                         f_cb( notUsed )
  72                             return
  73                                 _ callback
  74                                     @ null
  75                                     @ plugin
  76     +

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_0/step_1__copy/ittf/lib/step_1.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     class Animal
   4         m sayHello
   5             log this.cry, ', I am ', this.name
   6     class Horse
   7         super Animal
   8         ctor
   9             param name
  10             set this.name = name
  11             set this.cry = 'Hiii'
  12     var horse = new Horse('Varenne')
  13     _ horse.sayHello

   3     # from a single ittf document of type `js`

   6         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   7     line one
   8         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
   9         # Generates a single javascript module
  10         # The `js` wizzi schema is described here: TODO
  11         artifact step_0 javascript module
  12             src step_1.js.ittf
  13             schema js
  14             generator js/module
  15             extension js
  16     production
  17         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  18         line-ref one

   7         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');

  15             generator js/module

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_1/step_1__copy/ittf/lib/wizzi/schemas/model1.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema model1
   2     #
   3     # The 'model1' schema defines a simple tree structure.
   4     # It has 2 elements:
   5     # . 'model1', the root.
   6     # . 'item', the node.
   7     # Both may contain children 'item' elements.
   8     # Every element has a name (the ittf node value).
   9     # 'item' elements have an 'order' attribute of type integer.
  10     #
  11     # In the generated javascript classes each element will have the properties:
  12     # . wzParent
  13     # . wzElement (the name of the schema element: 'model1' or 'item')
  14     # . wzTag (the ittf node name, in this case it will be equal to the wzElement property)
  15     # . wzName (the ittf node value)
  16     # . wzSourceLine (the file, row, col position of the element in the source ittf document)
  17     #
  18     # The 'item' element will have also the property
  19     # . order
  20     #
  21     e model1
  22         is-root
  23         r item/s
  24     e item
  25         a order
  26             type integer
  27         r item/s
  28     e dummy : item
  29         # ${wfjobGlobalContextCheck}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_1/step_1__copy/model_types.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob model_types
   2     $
   3         var ittf_wfschema_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib', 'wizzi', 'schemas');
   4         var dest_folder           = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   5     line one
   6         cwd-folder ${ittf_wfschema_folder}
   7         # Generates the artifacts for a new wizzi model type, 'model1',
   8         # implemented by the plugin 'plugin1'.
   9         artifact artifacts for model type 'model1'
  10             is-wf-model-type
  11             src model1.wfschema.ittf
  12             dest-path plugin1
  13     production
  14         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  15         line-ref one

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_1__copy/ittf/lib/basic.withmodel.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     function sayHello
   4         param name
   5         log 'Hello ' + name
   6     $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
   7         _ sayHello
   8             @ '${item.__id}'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_1__copy/ittf/models/wf.demo.ittf



   1 demo wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory kernel components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi
  10             type wf:Package
  11             @ org:description The core package of the wizzi factory.
  12         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-utils
  13             type wf:Package
  14             @ org:description Utility library for wizzi factory
  15         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-mtree
  16             type wf:Package
  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.
  18         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-repo
  19             type wf:Package
  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_1__copy/js_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Generates a js module
  13         # The synthax rules for js ittf documents are here: TODO
  14         artifact basic no model js module
  15             src basic.nomodel.js.ittf
  16             schema js
  17             generator js/module
  18             extension js
  19     line two
  20         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  21         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  22         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  23         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  24         # declares the element:
  25         # export-to json
  26         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  27             src wf.demo.ittf
  28             schema demo
  29             generator json/export
  30             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  31             extension json
  32         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  33         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  34         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  35         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  36         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  37             src wf.demo.ittf
  38             schema ittf
  39             generator ittf/document
  40             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  41             extension ittf
  42     line three
  43         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  44         # Generates a js module
  45         # Using the model wf.demo.ittf as model context
  46         # The synthax rules for js ittf documents are here: TODO
  47         artifact basic with model js document
  48             src basic.withmodel.js.ittf
  49             schema js
  50             generator js/module
  51             extension js
  52             model-ref wf
  53                 export-name wf
  54     production
  55         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  56         line-ref one
  57         line-ref two
  58         line-ref three

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_2__copy/ittf/lib/t/copy.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     p
   3         span author  
   4         b Stefano Bassoli
   5     p
   6         span license  
   7         b MIT

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_2__copy/ittf/lib/basic.nomodel.html.ittf



   1 html
   2     head
   3         title
   4     body
   5         h1 The wizzi factory
   6         p A Software factory
   7         h3 github hosting
   8             a https://github.com/wizzifactory
   9                 href https://github.com/wizzifactory
  10         $include copy

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_2__copy/ittf/lib/basic.withmodel.html.ittf



   1 html
   2     head
   3         title
   4     body
   5         h1 The wizzi factory
   6         p A Software factory
   7         h3 github hosting
   8             a https://github.com/wizzifactory
   9                 href https://github.com/wizzifactory
  10         h4 packages
  11         table
  12             thead
  13                 tr
  14                     th description
  15                     th url
  16             $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
  17                 tr
  18                     td ${item.description}
  19                     td
  20                         a ${item.__id}
  21                             href ${item.__id}
  22         $include copy

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_2__copy/ittf/models/wf.demo.ittf



   1 demo wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi
  10             type wf:Package
  11             @ org:description The core package of the wizzi factory.
  12         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-utils
  13             type wf:Package
  14             @ org:description Utility library for wizzi factory
  15         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-mtree
  16             type wf:Package
  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.
  18         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-repo
  19             type wf:Package
  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_2__copy/html_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Generates a html document
  13         # The synthax rules for html ittf documents are here: TODO
  14         artifact basic no model html document
  15             src basic.nomodel.html.ittf
  16             schema html
  17             generator html/document
  18             extension html
  19     line two
  20         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  21         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  22         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  23         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  24         # declares the element:
  25         # export-to json
  26         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  27             src wf.demo.ittf
  28             schema demo
  29             generator json/export
  30             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  31             extension json
  32         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  33         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  34         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  35         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  36         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  37             src wf.demo.ittf
  38             schema ittf
  39             generator ittf/document
  40             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  41             extension ittf
  42     line three
  43         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  44         # Generates a html document
  45         # Using the model wf.demo.ittf as model context
  46         # The synthax rules for html ittf documents are here: TODO
  47         artifact basic with model html document
  48             src basic.withmodel.html.ittf
  49             schema html
  50             generator html/document
  51             extension html
  52             model-ref wf
  53                 export-name wf
  54     production
  55         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  56         line-ref one
  57         line-ref two
  58         line-ref three

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_3__copy/ittf/lib/t/copy.ittf



   1 $group
   2     author 'Stefano Bassoli'
   3     license 'MIT'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_3__copy/ittf/lib/basic.nomodel.ittf



   1 noschema
   2     item The wizzi factory
   3         kind Software factory
   4         github
   5             url https://github.com/wizzifactory
   6         $include copy

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_3__copy/ittf/lib/basic.withmodel.ittf



   1 noschema
   2     item The wizzi factory
   3         kind Software factory
   4         github
   5             url https://github.com/wizzifactory
   6         $include copy
   7         packages
   8             $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
   9                 package
  10                     url '${item.__id}'
  11                     description '${item.description}'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_3__copy/ittf/models/wf.demo.ittf



   1 demo wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi
  10             type wf:Package
  11             @ org:description The core package of the wizzi factory.
  12         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-utils
  13             type wf:Package
  14             @ org:description Utility library for wizzi factory
  15         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-mtree
  16             type wf:Package
  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.
  18         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-repo
  19             type wf:Package
  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_3__copy/ittf_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  13         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  14         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  15         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  16         artifact basic no model ittf document
  17             src basic.nomodel.ittf
  18             schema ittf
  19             generator ittf/document
  20             extension ittf
  21     line two
  22         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  23         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  24         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  25         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  26         # declares the element:
  27         # export-to json
  28         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  29             src wf.demo.ittf
  30             schema demo
  31             generator json/export
  32             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  33             extension json
  34         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  35         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  36         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  37         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  38         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  39             src wf.demo.ittf
  40             schema ittf
  41             generator ittf/document
  42             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  43             extension ittf
  44     line three
  45         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  46         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  47         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  48         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  49         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  50         # Using the model sample.docs.ittf as model context
  51         artifact basic with model ittf document
  52             src basic.withmodel.ittf
  53             schema ittf
  54             generator ittf/document
  55             extension ittf
  56             model-ref wf
  57                 export-name wf
  58     production
  59         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  60         line-ref one
  61         line-ref two
  62         line-ref three

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_4__copy/ittf/lib/t/copy.xml.ittf



   1 $group
   2     author Stefano Bassoli
   3     license MIT

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_4__copy/ittf/lib/basic.nomodel.xml.ittf



   1 xml
   2     item
   3         @ kind Software factory
   4         title The wizzi factory
   5         github
   6             @ url https://github.com/wizzifactory
   7         $include copy

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_4__copy/ittf/lib/basic.withmodel.xml.ittf



   1 xml
   2     item
   3         @ kind Software factory
   4         title The wizzi factory
   5         github
   6             @ url https://github.com/wizzifactory
   7         $include copy
   8         packages
   9             $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
  10                 package
  11                     @ url ${item.__id}
  12                     description ${item.description}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_4__copy/ittf/models/wf.demo.ittf



   1 demo wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi
  10             type wf:Package
  11             @ org:description The core package of the wizzi factory.
  12         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-utils
  13             type wf:Package
  14             @ org:description Utility library for wizzi factory
  15         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-mtree
  16             type wf:Package
  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.
  18         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-repo
  19             type wf:Package
  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_4__copy/xml_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Generates a xml document (pseudo schema xml)
  13         # The synthax rules for xml ittf documents are here: TODO
  14         artifact basic no model xml document
  15             src basic.nomodel.xml.ittf
  16             schema xml
  17             generator xml/document
  18             extension xml
  19     line two
  20         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  21         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  22         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  23         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  24         # declares the element:
  25         # export-to json
  26         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  27             src wf.demo.ittf
  28             schema demo
  29             generator json/export
  30             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  31             extension json
  32         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  33         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  34         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  35         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  36         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  37             src wf.demo.ittf
  38             schema ittf
  39             generator ittf/document
  40             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  41             extension ittf
  42     line three
  43         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  44         # Generates a xml document (pseudo schema xml)
  45         # Using the model wf.demo.ittf as model context
  46         # The synthax rules for xml ittf documents are here: TODO
  47         artifact basic with model xml document
  48             src basic.withmodel.xml.ittf
  49             schema xml
  50             generator xml/document
  51             extension xml
  52             model-ref wf
  53                 export-name wf
  54     production
  55         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  56         line-ref one
  57         line-ref two
  58         line-ref three

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_5__copy/ittf/lib/t/copy.json.ittf



   1 $group
   2     author 'Stefano Bassoli'
   3     license 'MIT'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_5__copy/ittf/lib/basic.nomodel.json.ittf



   1 {
   2     item 'The wizzi factory'
   3     kind 'Software factory'
   4     { github
   5         url 'https://github.com/wizzifactory'
   6     $include copy

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_5__copy/ittf/lib/basic.withmodel.json.ittf



   1 {
   2     item 'The wizzi factory'
   3     kind 'Software factory'
   4     { github
   5         url 'https://github.com/wizzifactory'
   6     [ packages
   7         $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
   8             {
   9                 url '${item.__id}'
  10                 description '${item.description}'
  11     $include copy

   3     context

   6         @ org http://schema.org/

  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.

  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_5__copy/json_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Generates a json document (pseudo schema json)
  13         # The synthax rules for json ittf documents are here: TODO
  14         artifact basic no model json document
  15             src basic.nomodel.json.ittf
  16             schema json
  17             generator json/document
  18             extension json
  19     line two
  20         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  21         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  22         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  23         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  24         # declares the element:
  25         # export-to json
  26         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  27             src wf.demo.ittf
  28             schema demo
  29             generator json/export
  30             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  31             extension json
  32         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  33         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  34         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  35         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  36         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  37             src wf.demo.ittf
  38             schema ittf
  39             generator ittf/document
  40             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  41             extension ittf
  42     line three
  43         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  44         # Generates a json document (pseudo schema json)
  45         # Using the model wf.demo.ittf as model context
  46         # The synthax rules for json ittf documents are here: TODO
  47         artifact basic with model json document
  48             src basic.withmodel.json.ittf
  49             schema json
  50             generator json/document
  51             extension json
  52             model-ref wf
  53                 export-name wf
  54     production
  55         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  56         line-ref one
  57         line-ref two
  58         line-ref three

   1 $group
   2     The author is Stefano Bassoli.
   3     It is released under the permissive MIT license.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_6__copy/ittf/lib/basic.nomodel.text.ittf



   1 text
   2     MIT License
   3     br
   4     The wizzi factory is a Software factory
   5     stored in github at url https://github.com/wizzifactory.
   6     br
   7     $include copy
   8     br
   9     Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
  10     of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
  11     in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
  12     to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
  13     copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
  14     furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

  24     OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN
  25     THE SOFTWARE.
  26     br
  27     Testing span and bspan
  28     This line
  29     bspan continue on this line after a space
  30     span and this without spacing.
  31     \bspan i have to be escaped to form a line
  32     \span and i too
  33     \br and i too

   1 text

   5     stored in github at url https://github.com/wizzifactory.
   6     br
   7     $include copy
   8     br
   9     The packages of the wizzi factory are
  10     $foreach item in wf.nodesOfType('wf:Package')
  11         . ${item.description}
  12             - url: ${item.__id}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_6__copy/ittf/models/wf.demo.ittf



   1 demo wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi
  10             type wf:Package
  11             @ org:description The core package of the wizzi factory.
  12         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-utils
  13             type wf:Package
  14             @ org:description Utility library for wizzi factory
  15         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-mtree
  16             type wf:Package
  17             @ org:description Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents.
  18         + https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-repo
  19             type wf:Package
  20             @ org:description Repository manager for the wizzi factory.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_2/step_6__copy/text_schema.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob basic
   2     $
   3         var models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   4         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   5         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${models_folder}
   7     model wf
   8         src wf.demo.ittf
   9         schema demo
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  12         # Generates a text document (pseudo schema text)
  13         # The synthax rules for text ittf documents are here: TODO
  14         artifact basic no model text document
  15             src basic.nomodel.text.ittf
  16             schema text
  17             generator text/document
  18             extension text
  19     line two
  20         cwd-folder ${models_folder}
  21         # Generates the json reprentation of a wizzi model
  22         # from a `demo` wizzi model (schema `demo`)
  23         # We can do this because the `demo` wizzi schema
  24         # declares the element:
  25         # export-to json
  26         artifact json dump of model wf.demo.ittf
  27             src wf.demo.ittf
  28             schema demo
  29             generator json/export
  30             dest-path wf.demo.export.json
  31             extension json
  32         # Regenerates the ittf of the loaded mTree (schema ittf).
  33         # This make sense when we have to preprocess, compose from various
  34         # documents or compose programmatically, an ittf document,
  35         # before loading it in a wizzi model.
  36         artifact ittf document of model wf.demo.ittf
  37             src wf.demo.ittf
  38             schema ittf
  39             generator ittf/document
  40             dest-path wf.demo.export.ittf
  41             extension ittf
  42     line three
  43         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  44         # Generates a text document (pseudo schema text)
  45         # Using the model wf.demo.ittf as model context
  46         # The synthax rules for text ittf documents are here: TODO
  47         artifact basic with model text document
  48             src basic.withmodel.text.ittf
  49             schema text
  50             generator text/document
  51             extension text
  52             model-ref wf
  53                 export-name wf
  54     production
  55         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  56         line-ref one
  57         line-ref two
  58         line-ref three

   7     $include exec_steps

  11             name "Student"

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/level_3/step_1__copy/artifacts_collection.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob model_types
   2     $
   3         var ittf_datalayer_folder = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'datalayer');
   4         var ittf_models_folder    = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'models');
   5         var dest_folder           = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');
   6     models-base-folder ${ittf_models_folder}
   7     model dbschema
   8         src dbschema.json.ittf
   9         schema json
  10     line one
  11         cwd-folder ${ittf_datalayer_folder}
  12         # Generates a javascript artifact for each item in the
  13         # `tables` collection of the json model `schema.json.ittf`
  14         artifact javascript table artifacts for dbschema tables
  15             src table.js.ittf
  16             schema js
  17             generator js/module
  18             dest-path {table}Datalayer.js.ittf
  19             extension js
  20             model-ref dbschema
  21                 model-coll tables
  22                     item-name table
  23                     path-template-value
  24                         attribute name
  25                         token table
  26     production
  27         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  28         line-ref one

   4         var dest_folder           = path.join(__dirname, 'outputs');

   6         cwd-folder ${ittf_jobs_folder}
   7         artifact sub wizzi job 1
   8             is-wf-job
   9             src job1.wfjob.ittf
  10             dest-path job1
  11         artifact sub wizzi job 2
  12             is-wf-job
  13             src job2.wfjob.ittf
  14             dest-path job2
  15     production
  16         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  17         line-ref one

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/localPlugin/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     +
   4     var util = require('util')
   5     var path = require('path')
   6     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   7     +
   8     var md = module.exports = {}
   9     set md.name = 'local'
  10     +
  11     #
  12         # FactoryPlugin class
  13         #
  14         # Uses the current folder as the root location of model factories, transformers,
  15         # artifacts and schema definitions.
  16         #
  17         # To make the plugin work your folder structure must be:
  18         # | this file
  19         # | - lib
  20         # |     - artifacts
  21         # |     - wizzi
  22         # |         - models
  23         #
  24     class FactoryPlugin
  25         ctor
  26             { wizziPackage
  27                 { file
  28             { provides
  29             set this.file = wizziPackage.file
  30             set this.provides = provides
  31             set this.modelFactories = {}
  32             set this.modelTransformers = {}
  33             set this.artifactGenerators = {}
  34             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}
  35         m initialize
  36             { options
  37             callback
  38             # TODO
  39             return
  40                 _ callback(null)
  41         m getName
  42             return 'local'
  43         m getFilename
  44             return __filename
  45         m getProvides
  46             return this.provides
  47         $include plugin/model-factory
  48         $include plugin/model-transformation
  49         $include plugin/artifact-generation
  50         $include plugin/schema-definition
  51     +
  52     # The plugin interface
  53     set module.exports
  54         {
  55             { provides
  56                 [ schemas
  57                     @ 'sample_0_1'
  58                 [ artifactGenerators
  59                 [ modelTransformers
  60             @ createFactoryPlugin
  61                 function createFactoryPlugin
  62                     { wizziPackage
  63                     { options
  64                     callback
  65                     var plugin
  66                         new FactoryPlugin
  67                             @ wizziPackage
  68                             @ this.provides
  69                     _ plugin.initialize
  70                         @ options
  71                         f_cb( notUsed )
  72                             return
  73                                 _ callback
  74                                     @ null
  75                                     @ plugin
  76     +

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/t/exec_job.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params name, ittfDocumentName, step
   3     _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
   4         {
   5             @ user 'stefi'
   6             @ role 'admin'
   7             @ storeKind 'filesystem'
   8             @ config
   9                 {
  10                     @ wfBaseFolder __dirname
  11                     @ pluginsBaseFolder
  12                         _ path.resolve
  13                             @ __dirname
  14                             @ '..'
  15                     @ plugins
  16                         [
  17                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  18                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  19                             @ 'wizzi-web'
  20                             @ './localPlugin/index'
  21             @ job
  22                 {
  23                     @ name '${name}'
  24                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  25                         _ path.join
  26                             @ __dirname
  27                             @ 'step_${step}'
  28                             @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  29                     @ productionOptions
  30                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  31                             {
  32                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  33                                 @ basedir __dirname
  34                                 @ verbose 2
  35                     @ globalContext
  36                         {
  37                             @ wfjobGlobalContextCheck 'If you can see mee the wfjob global context works fine.'
  38         f_cb_test( result)
  39             _ printValue
  40                 @ 'Result'
  41                 @ 'Wizzi job ${name} SUCCESSFULLY executed\n' + JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)
  42                 @ 'dashes'
  43             $hook

   2     $
   3         var name = 'wizzi jobs';
   4         var levels = ['0', '1', '2', '3'];
   5         // var levels = ['3'];
   6     $include exec_levels

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     $include readme_vars
   3     h2 Wizzi jobs
   4     p The task runner of the wizzi factory.
   5     h3 Reference
   6     p
   7         a Concept
   8             href ${url_concepts}#concept-8
   9         span   |  
  10         a Docs
  11             href ${url_docs}/jobs.html
  12         span   |  
  13         a Demo ittf source
  14             href ${url_demo_ittf_source}/advanced/essentials/filesystem/jobs
  15     h3 Demo samples level-0
  16     table
  17         demo_step( 1)
  18             p How to generate a javascript module from a single ittf document of schema `js`
  19         demo_step( 2)
  20             p How to generate a set of javascript modules from a set of ittf documents of schema `js`.
  21             p The `src` attribute of the `artifact` elements contains a `glob` pattern.
  22     h3 Demo samples level-1
  23     table
  24         demo_step( 1)
  25             p How to execute a wizzi job to generate the artifacts for a new wizzi model schema from a wizzi model of schema `wfschema`.
  26         demo_step( 2)
  27             p How to executes a wizzi job that contains the request to execute other wizzi jobs.
  28     h3 Demo samples level-2
  29     table
  30         demo_step( 1)
  31             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate modules of the language schema `js`.
  32         demo_step( 2)
  33             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate documents of the language schema `html`.
  34         demo_step( 3)
  35             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate documents of the builtin (noschema) `ittf`.
  36         demo_step( 4)
  37             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate documents of the builtin schema `xml`.
  38         demo_step( 5)
  39             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate documents of the builtin schema `json`.
  40         demo_step( 6)
  41             p How to execute a wizzi job that loads and generate documents of the builtin schema `text`.
  42     h3 Demo samples level-3
  43     table
  44         demo_step( 1)
  45             p How to generate a collection of artifacts from a collection property of a wizzi model.
  46     h3 Wizzi factory generations
  47     p All the packages of the wizzi factory are generated by wizzi jobs.
  48     p Have a look to the
  49         a `wizzi-demo` package generation job
  50             href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/blob/master/packages/ittf-sources/v5/apps/wizzi-demo/src/generate.wfjob.ittf

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_0/step_3__copy/basic.html.ittf



   1 html
   2     head
   3         title
   4     body
   5         h1 The wizzi factory
   6         p A Software factory
   7         h3 github hosting
   8             a https://github.com/wizzifactory
   9                 href https://github.com/wizzifactory
  10         h4 packages
  11         table
  12             thead
  13                 tr
  14                     th description
  15                     th url
  16             $$ data is a property of the mTreeBuildupContext object
  17             $$ passed to the loadModel method.
  18             $foreach item in data.packages
  19                 tr
  20                     td ${item.description}
  21                     td
  22                         a ${item.name}
  23                             href ${item.uri}
  24         $include copy
