src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_0/step_1_go.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzimodel,  0,  1 )
   2     #
   3         # Wizzi model
   4         p How to load an `html` wizzi model from a single ittf document.
   5         #
   6     +
   7     loadModel( 1,  basic.html.ittf,  print:model dashes)
   8         if step_callback
   9             return
  10                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_0/step_2_go.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzimodel,  0,  2 )
   2     #
   3         # Wizzi model
   4         # How to load a wizzi model from a main ittf document that mixes fragments.
   5     +
   6     loadModel( 1,  basic.html.ittf,  print:model dashes)
   7         if step_callback
   8             return
   9                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_0/step_3_go.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzimodel,  0,  3 )
   2     #
   3         # Wizzi model
   4         # How to load a wizzi model passing an mTree build up context object
   5         # to the loader and passing values to the factory globalContext.
   6     +
   7     set globalContext
   8         {
   9             @ copy 'The wizzi team'
  10     +
  11     set mTreeBuildupContext
  12         {
  13             [ packages
  14                 {
  15                     @ name 'wizzi-utils'
  16                     @ description ''
  17                     @ uri ''
  18                 {
  19                     @ name 'wizzi-mtree'
  20                     @ description ''
  21                     @ uri ''
  22     loadModel( 3,  basic.html.ittf,  print:model dashes)
  23         if step_callback
  24             return
  25                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_1/step_1__copy/models/wf.json.ittf



   1 {
   2     [ packages
   3         {
   4             name 'wizzi'
   5             title 'The core package of the wizzi factory'
   6         {
   7             name 'wizzi-utils'
   8             title 'Utility library for wizzi factory'
   9         {
  10             name 'wizzi-mtree'
  11             title 'Loader for wizzi indented text tree format (ittf) documents'
  12         {
  13             name 'wizzi-repo'
  14             title 'Repository manager for the wizzi factory'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_1/step_1__copy/models/wf.jsonld.ittf



   1 jsonld wf_overview
   2     # Sample json-ld description of the wizzi factory components
   3     context
   4         @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
   5         @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
   6         @ org http://schema.org/
   7         @ wf http://wizzifactory.com/0.1/
   8     graph
   9         $foreach p in data.packages
  10             + https://github.com/wizzifactory/${p.name}
  11                 type wf:Package
  12                 @ org:description ${p.title}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/level_1/step_1__copy/t/copy.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     p

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     $include readme_vars
   3     h2 Wizzi models
   4     p The modeling object of the wizzi factory.
   5     h3 Reference
   6     p
   7         a Concept
   8             href ${url_concepts}#concept-4
   9         span   |  
  10         a Docs
  11             href ${url_docs}/models.html
  12         span   |  
  13         a Demo ittf source
  14             href ${url_demo_ittf_source}/advanced/essentials/filesystem/models
  15     demo_level( 0)
  16         demo_step( 1)
  17             p How to load a wizzi model from a single ittf document.
  18         demo_step( 2)
  19             p How to load a wizzi model from a main ittf document that mixes fragments.
  20         demo_step( 3)
  21             p How to load a wizzi model passing an mTree build up context object to the loader and passing values to the factory globalContext.
  22     demo_level( 1)
  23         demo_step( 1)
  24             p How to load a wizzi model described by a model definition object. Shows how mTree build up context objects can be in turn wizzi models that must be loaded.

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/lib/artifacts/jsonld/document/gen/main.js.ittf



   1 module wizzi-demo.plugin.lib.artifacts.jsonld.document.gen.main
   2     kind jsfile
   3     # Example of language artifact that targets
   4     # the JSON-LG 1.0 (2014) specification.
   5     #
   6     # This is a code write based artifact generator.
   7     # It generates a json document.
   8     #
   9     var md = module.exports = {}
  10     var myname = 'wizzi-demo.advanced.plugins.lib.artifacts.jsonld.jsonlg.main';
  11     set md.gen
  12         function gen
  13             { model
  14             { ctx
  15             callback
  16             # check the model is a wizzi model of type 'jsonld'
  17             if model.wzElement !== 'jsonld'
  18                 return
  19                     _ callback
  20                         _ ctx.error
  21                             @ myname + " error: the model paramater should be an 'jsonld' wizzi model"
  22                             @ model
  23             _ ctx.w("Not implemented yet.")
  24             _ callback(null, ctx)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/lib/wizzi/schemas/jsonld.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema jsonld
   2     # Example wizzi schema used by this package demos.
   3     # It is an experimental implementation of a
   4     # vocabulary, taxonomy, onthology and direct graph schema.
   5     # Is inspired by
   6     # . RDF11 [https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/]
   7     # . OWL2 [https://www.w3.org/TR/owl2-primer/]
   8     # . JSON-LD [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld-syntax/]
   9     export-to json
  10     e comment
  11         tag #
  12     e jsonlditem
  13         is-abstract
  14         r comment/s
  15         r jsonlditem/s
  16     e nodeObject : jsonlditem
  17         tag +
  18         # A node object.
  19         # The `wzName` is the `JSON-LD @id` property.
  20         a language
  21             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
  22         a container
  23             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
  24         a reverse
  25             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
  26         m wzInitialize
  27             set this.__jsonld
  28                 {
  29             set this.__wizzi
  30                 {
  31             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  32                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
  33                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
  34                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
  35                 if item.wzElement === 'graph'
  36                     set this.graph = item
  37                     set this.__jsonld['@graph'] = item.__jsonld
  38             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.wzName)
  39                 set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.wzName
  40                 set this.__wizzi.__id = this.wzName
  41             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  42                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
  43                     if !item.__key
  44                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
  45                     else
  46                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  47                         var ss = item.__key.split(':')
  48                         if ss.length > 1
  49                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1]] = item.__jsonld
  50                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1] + '_ns'] = ss[0]
  51                         else
  52                             set this.__wizzi[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  53                 elif item.wzElement === 'type'
  54                     set this.type = item
  55                     set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
  56                     set this.__wizzi.__type = item.__localName
  57                     set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__prefix
  58                     # TODO
  59                     # set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__ns
  60                 elif item.wzElement === 'context' || item.wzElement === 'graph'
  61                     # done already
  62                 else
  63                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `nodeObject` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
  64             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
  65             set this.__jsonProps
  66                 {
  67                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
  68                     @ __wizzi this.__wizzi
  69         m isType
  70             param type
  71             return this.type ? this.type.isType(type) : false
  72         m nodesOfType
  73             param type
  74             param gotten
  75             if this.graph
  76                 if !gotten
  77                     set gotten = []
  78                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  79                     return gotten
  80                 else
  81                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  82             elif this.isType(type)
  83                 if !gotten
  84                     return [this]
  85                 else
  86                     _ gotten.push(this.__wizzi)
  87             else
  88                 if !gotten
  89                     return []
  90     e jsonld : nodeObject
  91         is-root
  92         # Can be a `document` or a container of many `documents`.
  93         # As a `document` can be a top `node` element or the container of
  94         # an array of top `node` elements.
  95         m wzInitialize
  96             var isArrayOfDocuments = true
  97             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  98                 if item.wzElement !== 'document'
  99                     set isArrayOfDocuments = false
 100             if isArrayOfDocuments
 101                 set this.__jsonld
 102                     [
 103                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 104                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 105                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 106                 set this.__jsonProps
 107                     {

 109             else
 110                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 111             return
 112     e document : nodeObject
 113         tag ld-doc
 114         # Can be a top `node` element or the container of
 115         # an array of top `node` elements.
 116         # Must be child of the `jsonld` element.
 117         # Allows multiple documents in a single ittf source document
 118         m wzInitialize
 119             var isArrayOfNodes = true
 120             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 121                 if item.wzElement !== 'nodeObject'
 122                     set isArrayOfNodes = false
 123             if isArrayOfNodes
 124                 set this.__jsonld
 125                     [
 126                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 127                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 128                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 129                 set this.__jsonProps
 130                     {
 131                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 132             else
 133                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 134             return
 135     e term : jsonlditem
 136         tag @
 137         # The `@` tag has nothing to do with the JSON-LD reserved word prefix.
 138         # Core wizzi schemas often use tha `@` tag symbol to indicate object properties (key-values).
 139         # A `term` element is a key-value pair (property) in a `nodeObject` or `context` element.
 140         # The key is a short-hand string that expands to an IRI or a blank node identifier.
 141         # If the `term` element has children elements the `wzName` is the key and
 142         # the child or children are the value. If it has no children the `wzName` is
 143         # splitted in a key and a value pair separated by the first blank char.
 144         # In a `context` element keys define the term,
 145         # and values are the IRIs associated with the term.
 146         # In a `nodeObject` keys may expand to an absolute IRI using the active context,
 147         # and values must be one of the following elements:
 148         # `valueItem`, or
 149         # `nodeObject`, or
 150         # `valueObject`, or
 151         # list or set `array`, or
 152         # an array of zero or more of the possibilities above, or
 153         # `languageMap`, or
 154         # `indexMap`
 155         a id
 156             # The `JSON-LD @id` property.
 157             # When the parent is a `nodeObject` the 'id' attribute
 158             # means: 'This value is an identifier that is an IRI'
 159         a reverse
 160             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
 161         a language
 162             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
 163         a container
 164             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
 165         m wzInitialize
 166             var nv = verify.parseNameValue(this.wzName)
 167             # log 'nv.name(), nv.value()', nv.name(), '/', nv.value()
 168             if this.jsonlditems.length === 0
 169                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 170                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.id)
 171                     set this.__jsonld
 172                         {
 173                             @ ['@id'] this.id
 174                 else
 175                     set this.__jsonld = nv.value()
 176                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 177                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 178                         set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 179                     else
 180                         set this.__jsonld
 181                             {
 182                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 183                                 @ ['@language'] this.language
 184                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 185                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 186                         set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 187                     else
 188                         set this.__jsonld
 189                             {
 190                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 191                                 @ ['@reverse'] this.reverse
 192                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 193                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 194                         set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 195                     else
 196                         set this.__jsonld
 197                             {
 198                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 199                                 @ ['@container'] this.container
 200             else
 201                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 202                 set this.__jsonld = {}
 203                 if verify.isNotEmpty(nv.value())
 204                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = nv.value()
 205                 else
 206                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.id
 207                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 208                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 209                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 210                     set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 211                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 212                     set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 213                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 214                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 215                     if item.wzElement === 'type'
 216                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
 217                         set this.__type = item.__localName
 218                         set this.__type_ns = item.__prefix
 219                         # TODO
 220                         # set this.__type_ns = item.__ns
 221                     elif item.wzElement === 'valueObject'
 222                         set this.__jsonld['@value'] = item.__jsonld
 223                     elif item.wzElement === 'context'
 224                         set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 225                     elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 226                         if !item.__key
 227                             _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 228                         else
 229                             set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 230                     elif item.wzElement === 'array'
 231                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 232                     elif item.wzElement === 'list'
 233                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 234                     elif item.wzElement === 'set'
 235                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 236                     elif item.wzElement === 'nodeObject'
 237                         if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 238                             _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 239                         else
 240                             set this.__jsonld
 241                                 [
 242                                     @ item.__jsonld
 243                     else
 244                         _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `term` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 245             set this.__jsonProps
 246                 {
 247                     @ __key this.__key
 248                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 249     e context : jsonlditem
 250         # Defines a local context in a node object.
 251         # The `wzName` can be null, an absolute IRI or a relative IRI.
 252         # If the `wzName` is null it contains a context definition.
 253         # Its parent must either be a `nodeObject` or a `document` element or
 254         # the `jsonld` element root.
 255         # Its keys must either be terms, compact IRIs, absolute IRIs,
 256         # or the attributes `language`, `base`, and `vocab`.
 257         # `nodeObject` elements contained in a `context` element must be
 258         # either an expanded term node with allowed attributes: id (the wzName), reverse, type, language, container
 259         a language
 260             # must have the lexical form described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 261         a base
 262             # must be an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null
 263         a vocab
 264             # must be a absolute IRI, a compact IRI, a blank node identifier, a term, or null
 265         m wzInitialize
 266             set this.__jsonld
 267                 {
 268             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 269                 set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 270             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.base)
 271                 set this.__jsonld['@base'] = this.base
 272             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.vocab)
 273                 set this.__jsonld['@vocab'] = this.vocab
 274             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 275                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 276                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
 277                     if !item.__key
 278                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 279                     else
 280                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 281                 else
 282                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `context` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 283             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
 284             set this.__jsonProps
 285                 {
 286                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 287     e graph : nodeObject
 288         # Must be either a node object or an array of zero or more node objects.
 289         m wzInitialize
 290             var isArrayOfNodes = true
 291             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 292                 # log 'graph.item.wzElement', item.wzElement
 293                 if item.wzElement !== 'nodeObject'
 294                     set isArrayOfNodes = false
 295             if isArrayOfNodes
 296                 set this.__jsonld
 297                     [
 298                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 299                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 300                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 301                 set this.__jsonProps
 302                     {
 303                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 304             else
 305                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 306             return
 307         m nodesOfType
 308             param type
 309             param gotten
 310             if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 311                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 312                     if item.wzElement === 'nodeObject'
 313                         _ item.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
 314             elif this['@type'] === type
 315                 _ gotten.push(this.__jsonld)
 316     e type : jsonlditem
 317         # Must be either an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, a compact IRI (including blank node identifiers),
 318         # a term defined in the active context expanding into an absolute IRI, or an array of any of these
 319         m wzInitialize
 320             if this.jsonlditems.length > 0
 321                 set this.__jsonld = []
 322                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 323                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 324                     if item.wzElement === 'array'
 325                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 326                     else
 327                         _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `type` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 328             else
 329                 set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 330                 var ss = this.wzName.split(':')
 331                 if ss.length > 1
 332                     set this.__prefix = ss[0]
 333                     set this.__localName = ss[1]
 334                     # TODO
 335                     # set this.__ns = ...
 336                 else
 337                     set this.__localName = this.wzName
 338         m isType
 339             param type
 340             if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 341                 foreach value in this.__jsonld
 342                     if value === type
 343                         return true
 344             else
 345                 return this.__jsonld === type
 346     e valueObject : jsonlditem
 347         tag value
 348         # Is used to explicitly associate a type or a language with a value
 349         # to create a typed value or a language-tagged string.
 350         # May contain a `type`, a `language` or an `index` attribute, or a `context` element
 351         # but must not contain both a `type` and a `language` key at the same time.
 352         # A value object must not contain any other keys that expand to an absolute IRI or keyword.
 353         # The `wzName` contains the `@value` content. It must be either a string, a number,
 354         # true, false or null.
 355         # The value associated with the `type` element/attribute must be a term, a compact IRI,
 356         # an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null.
 357         # The value associated with the `language` attribute must have the lexical form
 358         # described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 359         a language
 360             # The `JSON-LD @language key`
 361             # The value must have the lexical form described
 362             # in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null.
 363         a index
 364             # The `JSON-LD @index key`
 365             # The value associated with the `index` attribute must be a string.
 366         m wzInitialize
 367             set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 368             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 369                 if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 370                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 371                 else
 372                     set this.__jsonld
 373                         {
 374                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 375                             @ ['@language'] this.language
 376             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.index)
 377                 if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 378                     set this.__jsonld['@index'] = this.index
 379                 else
 380                     set this.__jsonld
 381                         {
 382                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 383                             @ ['@index'] this.index
 384             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 385                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 386                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 387                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 388                         set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 389                     else
 390                         set this.__jsonld
 391                             {
 392                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 393                                 @ ['@context'] item.__jsonld
 394                 elif item.wzElement === 'type'
 395                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 396                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
 397                     else
 398                         set this.__jsonld
 399                             {
 400                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 401                                 @ ['@type'] item.__jsonld
 402                 else
 403                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `valueObject` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 404             set this.__jsonProps
 405                 {
 406                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 407     e set : jsonlditem
 408         # Can can contain the `context` element and an array of
 409         # zero or more of `nodeObject`, `valueObject` and `valueItem` elements.
 410         m wzInitialize
 411             set this.__jsonld = {}
 412             var items = []
 413             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 414                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 415                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 416                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 417                 elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 418                     _ items.push(item.__key)
 419                 else
 420                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `set` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 421             set this.__jsonld['@set'] = items
 422     e list : jsonlditem
 423         # Can contain the `index` attribute, the `context` element and an array of
 424         # zero or more of `nodeObject`, `valueObject` and `valueItem` elements.
 425         a index
 426             # The `JSON-LD @index key`
 427             # The value associated with the `index` attribute must be a string.
 428         m wzInitialize
 429             set this.__jsonld = {}
 430             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.index)
 431                 set this.__jsonld['@index'] = this.index
 432             var items = []
 433             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 434                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 435                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 436                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 437                 elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 438                     _ items.push(item.__key)
 439                 else
 440                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `list` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 441             set this.__jsonld['@list'] = items
 442     e array : jsonlditem
 443         tag [
 444         # Can contains an array of `property` values.
 445         m wzInitialize
 446             set this.__jsonld = []
 447             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 448                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 449                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
 450                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__key)
 451                 else
 452                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `term` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 453     e valueItem : jsonlditem
 454         is-abstract
 455     e string : valueItem
 456         # The `wzName` contains the string (unquoted).
 457         m wzInitialize
 458             set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 459     e number : valueItem
 460         # The `wzName` contains the number.
 461         m wzInitialize
 462             set this.__jsonld = Number(this.wzName)
 463     e true : valueItem
 464         # No `wzName`.
 465         m wzInitialize
 466             set this.__jsonld = true
 467     e false : valueItem
 468         # No `wzName`.
 469         m wzInitialize
 470             set this.__jsonld = false
 471     e null : valueItem
 472         # No `wzName`.
 473         m wzInitialize
 474             set this.__jsonld = null

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/artifact-generation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve an ArtifactGenerator by its name
   4         # Generators are searched in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getArtifactGenerator
   7         string generationName
   8         +
   9         var generator = this.artifactGenerators[generationName] || null
  10         if generator == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set generator = require('./lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getArtifactGenerator'
  23                             @ 'Error loading artifact generator: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.artifactGenerators[generationName] = generator
  25         return generator

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/model-factory.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziModelFactory by its wizzischema name
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getModelFactory
   7         string schemaName
   8         var factory = this.modelFactories[schemaName] || null
   9         if factory == null
  10             var modulePath
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g.js'
  14             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  15                 try
  16                     set factory = require('./lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g')
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getModelFactory'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi model factory: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.modelFactories[schemaName] = factory
  24         return factory

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/model-transformation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # retrieve a ModelTransformer by its name
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getModelTransformer
   7         string transformerName
   8         +
   9         var transformer = this.modelTransformers[transformerName] || null
  10         if transformer == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set transformer = require('./lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getModelTransformer'
  23                             @ 'Error loading wizzi model transformer: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.modelTransformers[transformerName] = transformer
  25         return transformer

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/schema-definition.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziSchema definition in JSON format
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getSchemaDefinition
   7         string schemaName
   8         var definition = this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] || null
   9         if definition == null
  10             var schemaJsonUri
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-schema.g.json'
  14             if this.file.exists(schemaJsonUri)
  15                 try
  16                     set definition = this.file.readJSON(schemaJsonUri)
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getSchemaDefinition'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi schema definition: ' + schemaJsonUri + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] = definition
  24         return definition

  17             { provides

  20             set this.modelFactories = {}
  21             set this.modelTransformers = {}

  23             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}

  29                 _ callback(null)

  64                                     @ plugin

  19         log '****************************************'
  20         log ''

  22     if typeof require != 'undefined' && require.main === module
  23         _ ${name}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/generate.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob demo-plugin
   2     $
   3         console.log( '__dirname',  __dirname);)
   4         var ittf_root             = path.join(__dirname, 'root');
   5         var ittf_lib              = path.join(__dirname, 'lib');
   6         var dest_folder           = path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '..', 'local');
   7     line ittf-root
   8         cwd-folder ${ittf_root}
   9         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  10         wfjob/any_js()
  11             ignore ${ittf_root}/**/*__copy.*/**/*.js.ittf
  12         $include wfjob/any_json
  13     line ittf-lib
  14         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib}
  15         dest-folder ${dest_folder}/lib
  16         wfjob/any_js()
  17             ignore ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.js.ittf
  18         artifact any_ittf_inside___copy
  19             src ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.ittf
  20             extension ittf
  21     production
  22         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  23         line-ref ittf-root
  24         line-ref ittf-lib

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/jsonld/source/generate.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var path = require('path')
   4     var async = require('async')
   5     var wizzi = require('wizzi')
   6     function exec
   7         param gen_callback
   8         # begin params
   9         var $name = 'wizzi-demo - jsonld plugin generation'
  10         var $schemaNames
  11             [
  12                 @ 'jsonld'
  13         var $destFolder
  14             _ path.resolve
  15                 @ __dirname
  16                 @ '..'
  17                 @ 'local'
  18         # end params
  19         _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
  20             {
  21                 @ user 'stefi'
  22                 @ role 'admin'
  23                 @ storeKind 'filesystem'
  24                 { config
  25                     @ wfBaseFolder __dirname
  26                     [ plugins
  27                         @ 'wizzi-core'
  28                         @ 'wizzi-js'
  29                         @ 'wizzi-web'
  30                 { job
  31                     @ name $name
  32                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  33                         _ path.join
  34                             @ __dirname
  35                             @ 'ittf'
  36                             @ 'generate.wfjob.ittf'
  37                     @ productionOptions
  38                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  39                             {
  40                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  41                                 @ basedir __dirname
  42                                 @ verbose 2
  43                     { globalContext
  44             f_cb_no_err( result)
  45                 if err
  46                     if gen_callback
  47                         return
  48                             _ gen_callback
  49                                 _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  50                     else
  51                         return
  52                             _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  53                 _ async.map
  54                     @ $schemaNames
  55                     function async_item
  56                         param schemaName
  57                         param callback
  58                         log 'Generating schema ' + schemaName
  59                         _ wizzi.generateWizziModelTypes
  60                             {
  61                                 { configOptions
  62                                 { wfschema
  63                                     @ name schemaName
  64                                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  65                                         _ path.join
  66                                             @ __dirname
  67                                             @ 'ittf'
  68                                             @ 'lib'
  69                                             @ 'wizzi'
  70                                             @ 'schemas'
  71                                             @ schemaName + '.wfschema.ittf'
  72                                     @ outputPackageFolder $destFolder
  73                             function
  74                                 param err
  75                                 param result
  76                                 if err
  77                                     return
  78                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  79                                 _ callback(result)
  80                     f_cb_no_err( result)
  81                         if err
  82                             if gen_callback
  83                                 return
  84                                     _ gen_callback
  85                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  86                             else
  87                                 return
  88                                     _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  89                         else
  90                             if gen_callback
  91                                 return
  92                                     _ gen_callback
  93                                         @ null
  94                                         @ result
  95     set module.exports
  96         function
  97             param callback
  98             _ exec(callback)
  99     if require.main === module
 100         _ exec

   6             _ require('./jsonld')

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/plugins/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     h2 Local plugins for the filesystem store examples
   3     p These plugins are a copy of the plugins described in the \b
   4         a advanced - plugins
   5             href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/tree/master/packages/wizzi-demo/advanced/plugins
   6         span   section.
   7     p They are replicated here for ease of use and must be generated, before executing the demo examples, running the script:
   8     sh
   9         + npm run setup

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/local/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     +
   4     var util = require('util')
   5     var path = require('path')
   6     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   7     +
   8     var md = module.exports = {}
   9     set md.name = 'local'
  10     +
  11     #
  12         # FactoryPlugin class
  13     class FactoryPlugin
  14         ctor
  15             { wizziPackage
  16                 { file
  17             { provides
  18             set this.file = wizziPackage.file
  19             set this.provides = provides
  20             set this.modelFactories = {}
  21             set this.modelTransformers = {}
  22             set this.artifactGenerators = {}
  23             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}
  24         m initialize
  25             { options
  26             callback
  27             # TODO
  28             return
  29                 _ callback(null)
  30         m getName
  31             return 'local'
  32         m getFilename
  33             return __filename
  34         m getProvides
  35             return this.provides
  36         $include plugin/model-factory
  37         $include plugin/model-transformation
  38         $include plugin/artifact-generation
  39         $include plugin/schema-definition
  40     +
  41     set module.exports
  42         {
  43             { provides
  44                 [ schemas
  45                     @ 'sample_0_1'
  46                 [ artifactGenerators
  47                 [ modelTransformers
  48             @ createFactoryPlugin
  49                 function createFactoryPlugin
  50                     { wizziPackage
  51                     { options
  52                     callback
  53                     var plugin
  54                         new FactoryPlugin
  55                             @ wizziPackage
  56                             @ this.provides
  57                     _ plugin.initialize
  58                         @ options
  59                         f_cb( notUsed )
  60                             return
  61                                 _ callback
  62                                     @ null
  63                                     @ plugin
  64     +

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_1__copy/first.sample_0_1.ittf



   1 sample_0_1
   2     currency 
   3     item AlphaCPU 365
   4         id 3789
   5         category hw
   6         price 140
   7     item BetaCPU 528
   8         id 3891
   9         category hw
  10         price 270

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_1__copy/sample_0_1.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema sample_0_1
   2     # Wizzi schema: sample_0_1
   3     #
   4     # Our first schema has a `root` and a single `element`
   5     # that could represent a product record information.
   6     #
   7     # Example
   8     #
   9     # sample_0_1
  10     #
  11     # item AlphaCPU 365
  12     # id 3789
  13     # category hw
  14     # price 140
  15     #
  16     # item BetaCPU 528
  17     # id 3891
  18     # category hw
  19     # price 270
  20     #
  21     export-to json
  22         # This will add the method toJson() on every node object
  23         # of the wizzi model that will be generated
  24     e sample_0_1
  25         # This is the `root element`.
  26         # Its a good practice to give to the `root element`
  27         # the same name of the `schema`.
  28         is-root
  29             # In this case, this is redundant.
  30             # The first element declared in a schema is the root element,
  31             # if no other node is marked with the flag `is-root`.
  32         a currency
  33             # The currency `attribute` can be used to declare
  34             # the currency of price values. The default is dollar and
  35             # is restricted to dollars and euros.
  36             default
  37             restrict
  38                 enum
  39                     # dollar
  40                 enum 
  41                     # euro
  42         r productItem/s
  43             #
  44             # The `root element` may contain productItem elements.
  45             # The relation `one-to-many` is the default.
  46             # The cardinality always is: `one-to-zero-or-many`.
  47             # The other possible relation is `one-to-one` (must be declared).
  48             # Example:
  49             # r productItem
  50             # one-to-one
  51             # In the generated javascript class of the `root element` this
  52             # declaration will produce the collection property: productItems.
  53             #
  54     e productItem
  55         #
  56         # The product item `element`.
  57         # The `ittf node value` will contain the product name.
  58         # This must be said in the `element` comment in this way:
  59         # `The wzName is the product name.`
  60         # `wzName` is the name of the `ittf node value` property
  61         # in the generated javascript class that rapresent an `element`.
  62         #
  63         tag item
  64         # The default `ittf node tag` of an `element` is its name, but is can
  65         # be changed declaring a `tag` `attribute.
  66         # Example of a productItem:
  67         #
  68         # item AlphaCPU 365
  69         # id 3789
  70         # category hw
  71         # price 140
  72         #
  73         a id
  74             # The product id (of type integer).
  75             # The other types are: string (default), boolean, float, date.
  76             type integer
  77         a category
  78             # The product category, that is restricted to
  79             # hardware or software items.
  80             restrict
  81                 enum sw
  82                     # software product
  83                 enum hw
  84                     # hardware product
  85         a price
  86             # The item price (of type float). The currency is declared in
  87             # the `root node`.
  88             type float
  89         a dummy_for_testing context
  90             # This attribute is for testing the model load context and
  91             # the global context options.
  92             # In the generated wizzi model the following comment lines for this attribute
  93             # should be replaced by the values of the model and global context parameters.
  94             # This line comes from the model load context: ${modelLoadContextDummy}
  95             # This line comes from the global context: ${globalContextDummy}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_2__copy/t/common/comments.wizzischema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     e comment
   3         tag #
   4         r comment/s
   5     e commentable
   6         is-abstract
   7         r comment/s

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_2__copy/first.sample_0_2.ittf



   1 sample_0_2
   2     < alfa
   3         # An alfa node for ...
   4         @ id 1
   5         < beta
   6             @ size 5
   7             < gamma
   8                 @ id 3
   9                 < sigma
  10                     @ height 4
  11                     < tau
  12                         @ id 5
  13             < delta
  14                 @ id 6

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_2__copy/sample_0_2.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema sample_0_2
   2     # Wizzi schema: sample_0_2
   3     #
   4     # In the second schema we implement a very common pattern
   5     # used mainly in language schemas: a tree node structure
   6     # without depth limits. Each node may have comments,
   7     # free elements declared using the tag `<` and sub nodes and
   8     # free attributes declared using the tag `@`.
   9     #
  10     # Example
  11     #
  12     # sample_0_2
  13     #
  14     # < alfa
  15     # # An alfa node for ...
  16     # @ id 1
  17     # < beta
  18     # @ size 5
  19     # < gamma
  20     # @ id 3
  21     # < sigma
  22     # @ height 4
  23     # < tau
  24     # @ id 5
  25     # < delta
  26     # @ id 6
  27     #
  28     export-to json
  29         # This will add the method toJson() on every node object
  30         # of the wizzi model that will be generated
  31     e comment
  32         # The comment `element`.
  33         # The `wzName` will contain a comment line.
  34         tag #
  35     e attribute
  36         # The attribute `element`.
  37         # The attribute name is free.
  38         # The `wzName` will contain a name value pair separated by a blank character.
  39         tag @
  40     e node
  41         # The node `element`.
  42         # We declare a node `element` that may contain many
  43         # node elements in a relation `one-to-many` (default).
  44         # So any node may contain nodes without depth limits.
  45         tag <
  46         r comment/s
  47             # Node comment lines. Relation `one-to-many` (default)
  48         r attribute/s
  49             # Node attributes. Relation `one-to-many` (default)
  50         r node/s
  51             # Node sub nodes. Relation `one-to-many` (default)
  52     e sample_0_2 : node
  53         # The `root node` is derived from the node `element`.
  54         # So the root too may contain comments, attributes and sub nodes.
  55         is-root

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/t/dtype.wfschema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params type, format|@@null
   3     $
   4         var typeName = format ? format : type;
   5     e ${typeName} : datatype
   6         $hook
   7         $if type === 'string'
   8             $include verify_string
   9         $if type === 'object'
  10             $include verify_object
  11         $if type === 'array'
  12             $include verify_array
  13         $if type === 'integer' || type === 'number'
  14             $include verify_num
  15         m wminitialize
  16             set this.type = '${type}'
  17             $if format != null
  18                 set this.format = '${format}'
  19             $hook wminitialize

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/t/verify_array.wfschema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     a minItems
   3         # if missing minItems = 0
   4     a maxItems
   5         # if missing maxItems = unbounded
   6     a_flag( uniqueItems )

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/t/verify_num.wfschema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     a minimum
   3         # >=
   4     a maximum
   5         # <=
   6     a minimumExclusive
   7         # >
   8     a maximumExclusive
   9         # <
  10     a multipleOf
  11         # must be a positive number

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/t/verify_object.wfschema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     a maxProperties
   3     a minProperties

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/t/verify_string.wfschema.ittf



   1 $group
   2     a maxLength
   3     a minLength
   4     a pattern

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/first.sample_0_3.ittf



   1 sample_0_3
   2     schema User
   3         {
   4             integer id
   5             string name
   6             { contact_info
   7                 # The value of this property is an object
   8                 email email
   9                 string phone
  10     schema User
  11         {
  12             integer id
  13             string name
  14             type-ref ContactInfo
  15     schema ContactInfo
  16         {
  17             # The value of this property is an object
  18             email email
  19             string phone
  20     schema Color
  21         string
  22             enum
  23                 string black
  24                 string white
  25                 string red
  26                 string green
  27                 string blue
  28     schema dictionary
  29         {
  30             additionalProperties
  31                 {
  32                     integer code
  33                     string text
  34             example
  35                 {
  36                     { italy
  37                         @ code 039
  38                         @ text 'international phone prefix'
  39                     { france
  40                         @ code 033
  41                         @ text 'international phone prefix'
  42     schema Pet
  43         {
  44             string pet_type
  45                 required
  46             discriminator
  47                 property-name pet_type
  48     schema Dog
  49         # "Dog" is a value for the pet_type property (the discriminator value)
  50         allOf
  51             # Combines the main `Pet` schema with `Dog`-specific properties
  52             type-ref Pet
  53             {
  54                 # all other properties specific to a `Dog`
  55                 boolean bark
  56                 string breed
  57                     enum
  58                         string Dingo
  59                         string Husky
  60                         string Retriever
  61                         string Shepherd
  62     schema Cat
  63         # "Cat" is a value for the pet_type property (the discriminator value)
  64         allOf
  65             # Combines the main `Pet` schema with `Cat`-specific properties
  66             type-ref Pet
  67             {
  68                 boolean hunts
  69                 integer age
  70     schema BasicErrorModel
  71         {
  72             string message
  73                 required
  74             integer code
  75                 required
  76                 minimum 100
  77                 maximum 600
  78     schema ExtendedErrorModel
  79         # In this example above, the ExtendedErrorModel schema
  80         # includes its own properties and properties inherited
  81         # from BasicErrorModel.
  82         allOf
  83             # Combines the BasicErrorModel and the inline model
  84             type-ref BasicErrorModel
  85             {
  86                 string rootCause
  87                     required
  88     schema
  89         one-of
  90             type-ref simpleObject
  91             type-ref complexObject
  92     schema simpleObject
  93     schema complexObject
  94     # Discriminator
  95     # To help API consumers detect the object type,
  96     # you can add the discriminator/property-name keyword to model definitions.
  97     # This keyword points to the property that specifies the data type name:
  98     schema
  99         one-of
 100             type-ref simpleObject
 101             type-ref components/schemas/complexObject
 102         discriminator
 103             property-name objectType
 104     schema simpleObject
 105         {
 106             string objectType
 107                 required
 108     schema complexObject
 109         {
 110             string objectType
 111                 required
 112     # The discriminator is used with any-of or one-of keywords only.
 113     # It is important that all the models mentioned below
 114     # any-of or one-of contain the property that the discriminator specifies.
 115     # This means, for example, that in our code above,
 116     # both simpleObject and complexObject must have the objectType property.
 117     # This property is required in these schemas
 118     # The discriminator keyword can be used by various API consumers.
 119     # One possible example are code generation tools: they can use
 120     # discriminator to generate program statements that typecast
 121     # request data to appropriate object type based
 122     # on the discriminator property value.
 123     # Mapping Type Names
 124     # It is implied, that the property to which discriminator refers,
 125     # contains the name of the target schema.
 126     # In the example above, the objectType property should contain either
 127     # simpleObject, or complexObject string.
 128     # If the property values do not match the schema names,
 129     # you can map the values to the names.
 130     # To do this, use the discriminator/mapping keyword:
 131     schema
 132         one-of
 133             type-ref Object1
 134             type-ref Object2
 135             type-ref sysObject.json#/sysObject
 136         discriminator
 137             property-name objectType
 138             map obj1 Object1
 139             map obj2 Object2
 140             map system sysObject.json#/sysObject
 141     schema Object1
 142         {
 143             string objectType
 144                 required
 145     schema Object2
 146         {
 147             string objectType
 148                 required

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_3__copy/sample_0_3.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema sample_0_3
   2     # Wizzi schema: sample_0_3
   3     #
   4     # In the third sample we try to implement a schema
   5     # with some usefullness.
   6     # A schema that can be used for describing API schema objects in
   7     # requests, responses, operation parameters.
   8     #
   9     # This schema is inspired by
  10     # the OpenAPI Specification Version 3.0.0 [https://swagger.io/specification/]
  11     # a spec licensed under The Apache License, Version 2.0.
  12     #
  13     export-to json
  14     e comment
  15         # The comment `element`.
  16         # The `wzName` will contain a comment line.
  17         tag #
  18         r comment/s
  19             # Allow nesting of comment lines.
  20     e commentable
  21         # An abstract element that accepts children comment elements
  22         # and is the base element of any element of this schema.
  23         is-abstract
  24         r comment/s
  25     e sample_0_3 : commentable
  26         # The `root node`.
  27         # Contains a collection of named schema objects.
  28         is-root
  29         r schemaObject/s
  30             # List of named schema object.
  31     e schemaObject : commentable
  32         # From Swagger definition
  33         # `The Schema Object allows the definition of input and output data types.
  34         # These types can be objects, but also primitives and arrays.`
  35         #
  36         # The `wzName` contains the name of the schemaObject.
  37         tag schema
  38         r datatype
  39             # A schemaObject is composed by one datatype, typically
  40             # an object or an array.
  41             one-to-one
  42         r discriminator
  43             # When the schema datatype is a combinator
  44             # element (oneOf, allOf, anyOf )
  45             # The discriminator points to the property that specifies
  46             # the data type name.
  47             one-to-one
  48     e datatype : commentable
  49         # An abstract element from which all datatypes are derived.
  50         # Derived elements, when their parent element is an object
  51         # datatype, are object properties, and the `wzName` contains
  52         # the property name.
  53         # When a property is part of an enum element
  54         # the `wzName` contains a blank separated name value pair and
  55         # the value string must be converteable to the type.
  56         is-abstract
  57         a_flag( nullable )
  58         a_flag( required )
  59         a_flag( readOnly )
  60         a_flag( writeOnly )
  61         r enum
  62             # A single container element of a list of possible values of the
  63             # parameter or property. See the enum `element` declaration.
  64             one-to-one
  65         r example/s
  66             # A list of examples
  67     dtype( any )
  68         # The generic datatype. Allows any type.
  69     dtype( object )
  70         # The object datatype.
  71         # Children datatypes are properties.
  72         # If has no datatype children is shorthand syntax for an arbitrary-type.
  73         tag {
  74         r datatype/s
  75             # Object properties.
  76         r additionalProperties
  77             # Free form objects and dictionary objects.
  78             one-to-one
  79         r discriminator
  80             # Derived datatype discrimanator used to implement
  81             # object type inheritance.
  82             one-to-one
  83     dtype( array )
  84         # The array datatype.
  85         tag [
  86         r items
  87             # The container for the specification of the array items possible types.
  88             # See the items element declaration.
  89             one-to-one
  90     dtype( string )
  91     dtype( string,  date )
  92     dtype( string,  date-time )
  93     dtype( string,  password )
  94     dtype( string,  byte )
  95     dtype( string,  binary )
  96     dtype( string,  email )
  97     dtype( string,  uuid )
  98     dtype( string,  uri )
  99     dtype( string,  hostname )
 100     dtype( string,  ipv4 )
 101     dtype( string,  ipv6 )
 102     dtype( boolean  )
 103     dtype( integer )
 104     dtype( integer,  int32 )
 105     dtype( integer,  int64 )
 106     dtype( number )
 107     dtype( number,  float )
 108     dtype( number,  double )
 109     e value : datatype
 110         # A generic value element used in examples
 111         tag @
 112     e_tag( oneOf,  one-of,  datatype )
 113         # A datatype combinator element.
 114         # Validates the value against exactly one of the subdatatypes.
 115         r datatype/s
 116             # A collection of valid datatypes.
 117     e_tag( anyOf,  any-of,  datatype )
 118         # A datatype combinator element.
 119         # Validates the value against any (one or more) of the subdatatypes.
 120         r datatype/s
 121             # A collection of valid datatypes.
 122     e_tag( allOf,  all-of,  datatype )
 123         # A datatype combinator element.
 124         # Validates the value against all the subdatatypes.
 125         r datatype/s
 126             # A collection of valid datatypes.
 127     e_tag( typeRef,  type-ref,  datatype )
 128         # A datatype reference element.
 129         # The `wzName` must contain the name of the referenced type.
 130     e items : commentable
 131         # An element to describe the type of array items.
 132         # Its parent must be an array `element`.
 133         r datatype
 134             # A single datatype for all items can be declared.
 135             # For mixed type arrays the oneOf datataype element can be used
 136             # to specify many possible datatypes.
 137             one-to-one
 138     e enum : commentable
 139         # The enum `element` to specify possible values of a parameter or property.
 140         # Its `parent element` must be derived from datatype.
 141         r datatype/s
 142             # A collection of possible values.
 143     e additionalProperties : commentable
 144         # Specifies the type of values in the dictionary.
 145         # Datatypes can be primitives (strings, numbers or boolean values),
 146         # arrays or objects.
 147         r datatype/s
 148             # A collection of possible values.
 149         # Example of string-to-object dictionary
 150         # {
 151         # additionalProperties
 152         # {
 153         # integer code
 154         # string text
 155         # example
 156         # {
 157         # { italy
 158         # @ code 039
 159         # @ text international phone prefix
 160         # { france
 161         # @ code 033
 162         # @ text international phone prefix
 163     e discriminator : commentable
 164         # An object type discriminator element.
 165         # From Swagger API spec:
 166         # `To help API consumers detect the object type, you can add the
 167         # discriminator/propertyName keyword to model definitions.
 168         # This keyword points to the property that specifies the data type name.`
 169         a_tag( propertyName,  property-name )
 170             # The property that specifies the data type name.
 171         r map/s
 172             # The [optionals] discriminator mapping elements.
 173     e map : commentable
 174         # From Swagger API spec:
 175         # `It is implied, that the property to which discriminator refers,
 176         # contains the name of the target schema. In the example above,
 177         # the objectType property should contain either simpleObject,
 178         # or complexObject string.
 179         # If the property values do not match the schema names, you can map
 180         # the values to the names. To do this, use the discriminator/mapping
 181         # keyword`
 182         #
 183         # A discriminator type name mapping element.
 184         # The `wzName` will contain a blank separated name value pair:
 185         # - the name must be the value expected in the disciminator propertyName
 186         # - the value is the name of the schema object that must be selected
 187         # for that value.
 188     e example : commentable
 189         r datatype
 190             one-to-one

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/t__copy/a_flag.wfschema.ittf



   1 a ${name}
   2     $params name, tag|@@null
   3     $if tag
   4         tag ${tag}
   5     type boolean
   6     default false
   7     default-when-declared true

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/t__copy/a_tag_flag.wfschema.ittf



   1 a ${name}
   2     $params name, tag, defaultValue|false
   3     tag ${tag}
   4     type boolean
   5     default ${defaultValue}
   6     default-when-declared true

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/t__copy/a_tag.wfschema.ittf



   1 a ${name}
   2     $params name, tag|@@null, defaultValue|@@null
   3     tag ${tag}
   4     $if defaultValue
   5         default ${defaultValue}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/t__copy/e_tag.wfschema.ittf



   1 e ${name}
   2     $params name, tag|@@null, xsuper|@@null
   3     $if tag != null
   4         tag ${tag}
   5     $if xsuper != null
   6         super ${xsuper}

   5         var level = '0';
   6         var steps = ['1', '2', '3'];
   7     $include exec_steps

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_0/step_1_go.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzischema,  0,  1 )
   2     #
   3         # Wizzi schema
   4         # How to generate the artifacts for a new wizzi schema
   5         # A simple schema with a `root` and a single `element`
   6         # that could represent a product record information.
   7     +
   8     set globalContext
   9         {
  10             @ globalContextDummy 'If you see me the global context works fine.'
  11     set mTreeBuildupContext
  12         {
  13             @ modelLoadContextDummy 'If you see me the model load context works fine.'
  14     +
  15     exec_go( 1,  sample_0_1,  first )
  16         if step_callback
  17             _ step_callback
  18                 @ null

   7         {
   8             @ globalContextDummy 'If you see me the global context works fine.'
   9     set mTreeBuildupContext
  10         {
  11             @ modelLoadContextDummy 'If you see me the model load context works fine.'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_1/local/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     +
   4     var util = require('util')
   5     var path = require('path')
   6     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   7     +
   8     var md = module.exports = {}
   9     set md.name = 'local'
  10     +
  11     #
  12         # FactoryPlugin class
  13         #
  14         # Uses the current folder as the root location of model factories, transformers,
  15         # artifacts and schema definitions.
  16         #
  17         # To make the plugin work your folder structure must be:
  18         # . this file
  19         # \ lib
  20         # \ artifacts
  21         # \ wizzi
  22         # \ models
  23         #
  24     class FactoryPlugin
  25         ctor
  26             { wizziPackage
  27                 { file
  28             { provides
  29             set this.file = wizziPackage.file
  30             set this.provides = provides
  31             set this.modelFactories = {}
  32             set this.modelTransformers = {}
  33             set this.artifactGenerators = {}
  34             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}
  35         m initialize
  36             { options
  37             callback
  38             # TODO
  39             return
  40                 _ callback(null)
  41         m getName
  42             return 'local'
  43         m getFilename
  44             return __filename
  45         m getProvides
  46             return this.provides
  47         $include plugin/model-factory
  48         $include plugin/model-transformation
  49         $include plugin/artifact-generation
  50         $include plugin/schema-definition
  51     +
  52     # The plugin interface
  53     set module.exports
  54         {
  55             { provides
  56                 [ schemas
  57                     @ 'sample_0_1'
  58                 [ artifactGenerators
  59                 [ modelTransformers
  60             @ createFactoryPlugin
  61                 function createFactoryPlugin
  62                     { wizziPackage
  63                     { options
  64                     callback
  65                     var plugin
  66                         new FactoryPlugin
  67                             @ wizziPackage
  68                             @ this.provides
  69                     _ plugin.initialize
  70                         @ options
  71                         f_cb( notUsed )
  72                             return
  73                                 _ callback
  74                                     @ null
  75                                     @ plugin
  76     +

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_1/step_1__copy/first.xittf.ittf



   1 xittf
   2     alfa uno
   3         beta 2

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_1/step_1__copy/xittf.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema xittf
   2     unknown-element-replacer sem
   3     export-to json
   4     e statement
   5         # A statement line node, with unlimited depth.
   6         # Is the schema base node.
   7         # In itself works as a comment line.
   8         tag _$$
   9         r statement/s
  10     e xittf : statement
  11         is-root
  12     e sem : statement
  13         # Semantic element of the preprocessed wizzi schema.
  14         # Will be emitted as is.
  15         # Every unrecognized ittf node will become a
  16         # `sem` element.

   5         var level = '1';

   7     $include exec_steps

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/level_1/step_1_go.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzischema,  1,  1 )
   2     #
   3         # Wizzi schema
   4         # How to define a free element with an implicit type in a wizzi schema.
   5     +
   6     exec_go( 1,  xittf,  first )
   7         if step_callback
   8             _ step_callback
   9                 @ null

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/t/exec_go.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, schema, model
   3     # Create a filesystem factory without access control,
   4     # configured with the default wizzi plugins and
   5     # a local plugin.
   6     _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
   7         {
   8             @ plugins
   9                 {
  10                     @ items
  11                         [
  12                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  13                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  14                             @ 'wizzi-web'
  15                             @ './local/index'
  16                     @ pluginsBaseFolder
  17                         _ path.resolve
  18                             @ __dirname
  19             @ globalContext globalContext
  20         f_cb_throw( wf )
  21             # Now we can generate the wizzi model artifacts.
  22             # They will be written in the folder passed as second parameter,
  23             # that is the folder of our local plugin.
  24             # The wizzi model artifact "${schema}" is created after that the wizzi factory
  25             # has been configured with the local plugin. That is ok. The model factory
  26             # will be retrieved before use. There is no check for existence at plugin initialization time.
  27             _ wf.generateModelTypes
  28                 _ path.join
  29                     @ __dirname
  30                     @ 'step_${step}'
  31                     @ '${schema}.wfschema.ittf'
  32                 _ path.join
  33                     @ __dirname
  34                     @ 'local'
  35                 @ '${schema}'
  36                 @ mTreeBuildupContext
  37                 f_cb_throw( result )
  38                     _ printValue
  39                         @ 'Result'
  40                         @ 'Wizzi model of schema ${schema} generated. \n' + JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)
  41                         @ 'dashes'
  42                     _ wf.loadModel
  43                         _ path.join
  44                             @ __dirname
  45                             @ 'step_${step}'
  46                             @ '${model}.${schema}.ittf'
  47                         @ mTreeBuildupContext
  48                         f_cb_throw( wizziModel )
  49                             # And print the loaded model
  50                             _ printValue
  51                                 @ 'Result'
  52                                 @ 'Ittf document ${model}.${schema}.ittf loaded.'
  53                                 @ 'dashes'
  54                             if wizziModel.toJson
  55                                 _ printValue
  56                                     @ 'wizziModel.toJson()'
  57                                     _ stringify
  58                                         _ wizziModel.toJson
  59                                         @ null
  60                                         @ 4
  61                                     @ 'dashes'
  62                             else
  63                                 _ printValue
  64                                     @ 'wizziModel'
  65                                     _ stringify
  66                                         @ wizziModel
  67                                         @ null
  68                                         @ 4
  69                                     @ 'dashes'
  70                             $$ here the mixer of this fragment can append an artifact generation
  71                             $$ using the wizziModel variable as source model
  72                             $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/index.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzischemas)
   2     $
   3         var name = 'wizzischemas';
   4         var levels = ['0', '1'];
   5     $include exec_levels

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     $include readme_vars
   3     h2 Wizzi schemas
   4     h3 Reference
   5     p
   6         a Concept
   7             href ${url_concepts}#concept-5
   8         span   |  
   9         a Docs
  10             href ${url_docs}/models.html#concept-5
  11         span   |  
  12         a Demo ittf source
  13             href ${url_demo_ittf_source}/advanced/essentials/filesystem/schemas
  14     demo_level( 1)
  15         demo_step( 1)
  16             p How to generate the artifacts for a new wizzi schema.
  17             p A simple schema with a `root` and a single `element` that could represent a product record information.
  18         demo_step( 2)
  19             p How to generate the artifacts for a new wizzi schema that implements a very common pattern used mainly in language schemas: a tree node structure without depth limits. Each node may have comments, free elements declared using the tag `<` and sub nodes and free attributes declared using the tag `@`.
  20         demo_step( 3)
  21             p How to generate the artifacts for a new wizzi schema
  22             p that can be used for describing API schema objects in requests, responses, operation parameters.
  23             p This schema is inspired by the OpenAPI Specification Version 3.0.0 [https://swagger.io/specification/], a spec licensed under The Apache License, Version 2.0.
  24     demo_level( 2)
  25         demo_step( 1)
  26             p How to define a free element with an implicit type in a wizzi schema.
  27     h3 Wizzi schemas
  28     p The wizzi schemas of the wizzi-core plugin package can be taken for examples: \b
  29         a wfschema and wfjob schemas
  30             href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/tree/master/packages/ittf-sources/v5/plugins/wizzi-core/src/ittf/lib/wizzi/schemas
  31         span .

   1 demo_module( language_schema_js,  0,  5 )

   3         # DEMO: javascript module coded in 'js' wizzi language schema
   4     +
   5     $append imports
   6         var ObjectId = require('wizzi-repo').ObjectId
   7         var id1 = new ObjectId()
   8     +
   9     jsonLoadModelAndGenerateArtifact( 5,  module_1.js.ittf,  js,  module,  save;print:artifact dash )
  10     +
  11     function getJsonFsData
  12         return
  13             {
  14                 @ items
  15                     [
  16                         {
  17                             @ _id id1
  18                             @ parentId null
  19                             @ path "c:/my/wizzi/v5/apps/wizzi-demo/dist/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_5/module_1.js.ittf"
  20                 @ documents
  21                     [
  22                         {
  23                             @ _id id1
  24                             @ content "module\n    kind react\n    react MyComponent"
  25     +
  26     _ execute
  27         _ getJsonFsData
