src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_1__copy/ittf/lib/step_1.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     class Animal
   4         m sayHello
   5             log this.cry, ', I am ', this.name
   6     class Horse
   7         super Animal
   8         ctor
   9             param name
  10             set this.name = name
  11             set this.cry = 'Hiii'
  12     var horse = new Horse('Varenne')
  13     _ horse.sayHello

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_1__copy/step_1.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob mongodb_level_0_step_1
   2     # The step_1 wizzi job generates a sample javascript module
   3     # from a single ittf document of type `js`
   4     $
   5         var db__dirname = 'db://stefi/demo/wizzijob/level_0/step_1';
   6         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(db__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   7         var dest_folder      = path.join(db__dirname, 'outputs');
   8     line one
   9         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  10         # Generates a single javascript module
  11         # The `js` wizzi schema is described here: TODO
  12         artifact step_0 javascript module
  13             src step_1.js.ittf
  14             schema js
  15             generator js/module
  16             extension js
  17     production
  18         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  19         line-ref one

   4     wz-class Horse

   6         ctor
   7             param name
   8             set this.name = name
   9             set this.cry = 'Hiii'

   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     wz-class Animal
   4         m sayHello
   5             log this.cry, ', I am ', this.name

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_2__copy/step_2.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob mongodb_level_0_step_2
   2     # The step_2 wizzi job generates a set of javascript modules
   3     # from a set of ittf documents of type `js` in the same folder
   4     # The `src` attribute of the `artifact` elements contains a `glob` pattern.
   5     $
   6         var db__dirname = 'db://stefi/demo/wizzijob/level_0/step_2';
   7         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(db__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   8         var dest_folder      = path.join(db__dirname, 'outputs');
   9     line one
  10         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  11         # Generates a set of javascript modules
  12         # The `js` wizzi schema is described here: TODO
  13         artifact step_1 set of javascript modules
  14             src ./**/*.js.ittf
  15             schema js
  16             generator js/module
  17             extension js
  18     production
  19         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  20         line-ref one

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_1_exec.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzi_job_mongodb_level_0_step_1_exec )
   2     var testMongodbUri = 'mongodb://localhost:27017/test'
   3     var testMongodbBaseFolder = 'c:/wizzifactory/users'
   4     _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
   5         {
   6             @ user 'stefi'
   7             @ role 'admin'
   8             @ storeKind 'mongodb'
   9             @ config
  10                 {
  11                     @ wfBaseFolder testMongodbBaseFolder
  12                     @ storeUri testMongodbUri
  13                     @ storeBaseFolder testMongodbBaseFolder
  14                     @ plugins
  15                         [
  16                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  17                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  18                             @ 'wizzi-html'
  19                             @ 'wizzi-docs'
  20             @ job
  21                 {
  22                     @ name 'mongodb.level_0.step_1'
  23                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  24                         _ path.join
  25                             @ 'db://stefi/demo/wizzijob'
  26                             @ 'level_0'
  27                             @ 'step_1'
  28                             @ 'step_1.wfjob.ittf'
  29                     @ productionOptions
  30                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  31                             {
  32                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  33                                 @ basedir __dirname
  34                                 @ verbose 2
  35                     @ globalContext
  36                         {
  37         function
  38             param err
  39             if err
  40                 log "Error executing wizzi instance job", err
  41             log 'Wizzi instance job mongodb.level_0.step_1 SUCCESSFULLY executed'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_1_print.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzi_job_mongodb_level_0_step_1_print )
   2     var repo = require('wizzi-repo')
   3     # Test mongoDb config
   4     # mongodbUri 'mongodb://localhost:27017/test'
   5     # mongodbBaseFolder `c:/wizzifactory/users`
   6     # example
   7     # folder `wizzijob`
   8     # of project `demo`
   9     # of user `stefi`
  10     # has uri
  11     # `db://stefi/demo/wizzijob`
  12     # and maps to internal mongodb filesystem path
  13     # `c:/wizzifactory/users/stefi/demo/wizzijob`
  14     var testMongodbUri = 'mongodb://localhost:27017/test'
  15     var testMongodbBaseFolder = 'c:/wizzifactory/users'
  16     var demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder
  17         _ path.join
  18             @ testMongodbBaseFolder
  19             @ 'stefi'
  20             @ 'demo'
  21     _ heading2('print wizzijob results')
  22     _ repo.mongoDbDocumentManager
  23         @ testMongodbUri
  24         f_cb_throw( docman )
  25             _ docman.getFiles
  26                 _ path.join
  27                     @ demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder
  28                     @ 'wizzijob'
  29                     @ 'level_0'
  30                     @ 'step_1'
  31                     @ 'outputs'
  32                 {
  33                     @ deep true
  34                     @ documentContent true
  35                 f_cb_throw( files )
  36                     _ printArray
  37                         @ 'files'
  38                         @ files
  39                         [
  40                             @ 'fullPath'
  41                             @ 'content'
  42                     _ docman.close

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/level_0/step_1_upload.js.ittf



   1 demo_module( wizzi_job_mongodb_level_0_step_1_upload )
   2     var repo = require('wizzi-repo')
   3     # Test mongoDb config
   4     # mongodbUri 'mongodb://localhost:27017/test'
   5     # mongodbBaseFolder `c:/wizzifactory/users`
   6     # example
   7     # folder `wizzijob`
   8     # of project `demo`
   9     # of user `stefi`
  10     # has uri
  11     # `db://stefi/demo/wizzijob`
  12     # and maps to internal mongodb filesystem path
  13     # `c:/wizzifactory/users/stefi/demo/wizzijob`
  14     var testMongodbUri = 'mongodb://localhost:27017/test'
  15     var testMongodbBaseFolder = 'c:/wizzifactory/users'
  16     var demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder

  18             @ testMongodbBaseFolder
  19             @ 'stefi'
  20             @ 'demo'

  22         @ testMongodbUri
  23         f_cb_throw( docman )

  30                     @ demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder
  31                     @ 'wizzijob'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/t/exec.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params section, level, step
   3     _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
   4         {
   5             @ user 'stefi'
   6             @ role 'admin'
   7             @ storeKind 'mongodb'
   8             @ config
   9                 {
  10                     @ wfBaseFolder testMongodbBaseFolder
  11                     @ storeUri testMongodbUri
  12                     @ storeBaseFolder testMongodbBaseFolder
  13                     @ plugins
  14                         [
  15                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  16                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  17                             @ 'wizzi-html'
  18                             @ 'wizzi-docs'
  19             @ job
  20                 {
  21                     @ name 'mongodb.level_${level}.step_${step}'
  22                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  23                         _ path.join
  24                             @ 'db://stefi/demo/${section}'
  25                             @ 'level_${level}'
  26                             @ 'step_${step}'
  27                             @ 'step_${step}.wfjob.ittf'
  28                     @ productionOptions
  29                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  30                             {
  31                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  32                                 @ basedir __dirname
  33                                 @ verbose 2
  34                     @ globalContext
  35                         {
  36         function
  37             param err
  38             if err
  39                 log "Error executing wizzi job mongodb.level_${level}.step_${step}", err
  40                 return
  41             log 'Wizzi job mongodb.level_${level}.step_${step} SUCCESSFULLY executed'
  42             $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/t/heading_1.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     # Test mongoDb config

   4     # mongodbBaseFolder `c:/wizzifactory/users`

   6     # folder `wizzijob`
   7     # of project `demo`

  12     # `c:/wizzifactory/users/stefi/demo/wizzijob`

  17             @ testMongodbBaseFolder
  18             @ 'stefi'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/t/print.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params section, level, step
   3     _ heading2('print ${section} results')
   4     _ repo.mongoDbDocumentManager
   5         @ testMongodbUri
   6         f_cb_throw( docman )
   7             _ docman.getFiles
   8                 _ path.join
   9                     @ demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder
  10                     @ '${section}'
  11                     @ 'level_${level}'
  12                     @ 'step_${step}'
  13                     @ 'outputs'
  14                 {
  15                     @ deep true
  16                     @ documentContent true
  17                 f_cb_throw( files )
  18                     _ printArray
  19                         @ 'files'
  20                         @ files
  21                         [
  22                             @ 'fullPath'
  23                             @ 'content'
  24                     _ docman.close

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/jobs/t/upload.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params section, level, step
   3     _ repo.mongoDbDocumentManager
   4         @ testMongodbUri
   5         f_cb_throw( docman )
   6             _ heading2('uploadFolder section: ${section}, level ${level}, step ${step}')
   7             _ docman.uploadFolder
   8                 _ path.join
   9                     @ __dirname
  10                     @ 'step_${step}'
  11                 _ path.join
  12                     @ demoUploadMongodbBaseFolder
  13                     @ '${section}'
  14                     @ 'level_${level}'
  15                     @ 'step_${step}'
  16                 f_cb_throw( result )
  17                     _ printValue
  18                         @ 'result'
  19                         @ result
  20                     _ docman.close
  21                     $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/mongodb/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     h2 Examples using the mongofs store
   3     p Mongofs is a repo store implemented using the mongodb cloud database. It is implemented \b
   4         a here
   5             href https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/tree/master/packages/wizzi-repo/lib/mongodb
   6         span .
   7     p The mongodb database is not installed by the wizzi factory. You must pass a valid connection uri to the wizzi factory in the configuration parameter.
   8     js
   9         + //TODO

src/ittf/examples/advanced/essentials/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     import async
   4     var examples
   5         [
   6             _ require('./filesystem/jobs')
   7             $*
   8             _ require('./filesystem/models')
   9             _ require('./filesystem/jobs')
  10             _ require('./filesystem/schemas')
  11             *$
  12     function exec
  13         param callback
  14         _ async.mapSeries
  15             @ examples
  16             function
  17                 param example
  18                 param callback
  19                 _ example(callback)
  20             f_cb_test( results)
  21                 log 'Advanced-essentials examples results\n', results
  22                 if callback
  23                     _ callback
  24                         @ null
  25                         @ 'Advanced-essentials examples executed'
  26     set module.exports
  27         function
  28             param callback
  29             _ exec(callback)
  30     if require.main === module
  31         _ exec

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/examples/jsonld/step_1__copy/w3c.jsonld.ittf



   1 jsonld
   2     # Examples taken from [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld]
   3     ld-doc
   4         # EXAMPLE 2: Sample JSON-LD document using full IRIs instead of terms
   5         # This document is a node object, without @id. Property keys are full URIs.
   6         @ http://schema.org/name Manu Sporny
   7         @ http://schema.org/url
   8             # The 'id' keyword means 'This value is an identifier that is an IRI'
   9             id http://manu.sporny.org/
  10         @ http://schema.org/image
  11             id http://manu.sporny.org/images/manu.png
  12     ld-doc
  13         # [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#the-context] Example 5
  14         context
  15             @ name http://schema.org/name
  16                 # This means that 'name' is shorthand for 'http://schema.org/name'
  17             @ image http://schema.org/image
  18                 # 'image' is shorthand for 'http://schema.org/image'
  19                 type @id
  20                 # This means that a string value associated with 'image' should be interpreted as an identifier that is an IRI
  21             @ homepage http://schema.org/url
  22                 type @id
  23         @ name Manu Sporny
  24         @ homepage http://manu.sporny.org/
  25         @ image http://manu.sporny.org/images/manu.png
  26     ld-doc http://me.markus-lanthaler.com/
  27         # EXAMPLE 11: Identifying a node
  28         #
  29         # The `wzName` = http://me.markus-lanthaler.com/ is the JSON-LD node `@id` keyword.
  30         #
  31         # To be able to externally reference nodes in a graph,
  32         # it is important that nodes have an identifier.
  33         # IRIs are a fundamental concept of Linked Data,
  34         # for nodes to be truly linked, dereferencing the identifier should result
  35         # in a representation of that node.
  36         # This may allow an application to retrieve further information about a node.
  37         context
  38             @ name http://schema.org/name
  39         @ name Markus Lanthaler
  40     ld-doc http://example.org/places#BrewEats
  41         # [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#specifying-the-type] Example 12
  42         # The type of a particular node can be specified using the `type` attribute.
  43         # In Linked Data, types are uniquely identified with an IRI.
  44         type http://schema.org/Restaurant
  45     ld-doc http://example.org/places#BrewEats
  46         # [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#specifying-the-type] Example 13
  47         # A node can be assigned more than one type by using an array
  48         type
  49             [
  50                 @ http://schema.org/Restaurant
  51                 @ http://schema.org/Brewery
  52     ld-doc http://example.org/places#BrewEats
  53         # [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#specifying-the-type] Example 14
  54         context
  55             @ Restaurant http://schema.org/Restaurant
  56             @ Brewery http://schema.org/Brewery
  57         type
  58             [
  59                 @ Restaurant
  60                 @ Brewery
  61     ld-doc
  62         # Setting the document base in a document
  63         # [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#base-iri] Example 16
  64         # An empty `id` resolves to the document base IRI
  65         context
  66             base http://example.com/document.jsonld
  67         @ label Just a simple document
  68     ld-doc http://example.org/places#BrewEats
  69         # Using a common vocabulary prefix
  70         context
  71             vocab http://schema.org/
  72         type Restaurant
  73         @ name Brew Eats
  74     ld-doc http://example.org/places#BrewEats
  75         # EXAMPLE 18: Using the null keyword to ignore data
  76         context
  77             vocab http://schema.org/
  78             @ databaseId null
  79         type Restaurant
  80         @ name Brew Eats
  81         @ databaseId 23987520
  82     ld-doc
  83         @ EXAMPLE 19: Prefix expansion
  84         context
  85             @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
  86         type foaf:Person
  87         @ foaf:name Dave Longley
  88     ld-doc http://me.markus-lanthaler.com/
  89         # EXAMPLE 20: Using vocabularies
  90         context
  91             @ xsd http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#
  92             @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
  93             @ foaf:homepage
  94                 type @id
  95             @ picture foaf:depiction
  96                 type @id
  97         type foaf:Person
  98         @ foaf:name Markus Lanthaler
  99         @ foaf:homepage http://www.markus-lanthaler.com/
 100         @ picture http://twitter.com/account/profile_image/markuslanthaler
 101     ld-doc http://example.org/posts#TripToWestVirginia
 102         # EXAMPLE 23: Example demonstrating the context-sensitivity for @type
 103         # NOTE
 104         # In this wizzi model there is no context-sensitivity because
 105         # element are differents. `+` is a node element
 106         # `@` is a property element (a value).
 107         type http://schema.org/BlogPosting
 108             # This is a node type
 109         @ modified
 110             value 2010-05-29T14:17:39+02:00
 111             type http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime
 112                 # This is a value type
 113     ld-doc
 114         # EXAMPLE 25: Term definitions using compact and absolute IRIs
 115         context
 116             @ foaf http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/
 117             @ foaf:age
 118                 id http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/age
 119                 type xsd:integer
 120             @ http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/homepage
 121                 type @id
 122         @ foaf:name John Smith
 123         @ foaf:age 41
 124         @ http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/homepage
 125             [
 126                 @ http://personal.example.org/
 127                 @ http://work.example.com/jsmith/
 128     ld-doc
 129         # EXAMPLE 26: Embedding a node object as property value of another node object
 130         @ name Manu Sporny
 131         @ knows
 132             +
 133                 type Person
 134                 @ name Gregg Kellogg
 135     ld-doc
 136         # EXAMPLE 31: Setting the default language of a JSON-LD document
 137         context
 138             language ja
 139         @ name 
 140         @ occupation 
 141     ld-doc
 142         # EXAMPLE 32: Clearing default language
 143         context
 144             language ja
 145         @ name 
 146         @ details
 147             context
 148                 language null
 149             @ occupation Ninja
 150     ld-doc
 151         # EXAMPLE 33: Expanded term definition with language
 152         context
 153             @ ex http://example.com/vocab/
 154             language ja
 155             @ name ex:name
 156                 language null
 157             @ occupation ex:occupation
 158             @ occupation_en ex:occupation
 159                 language en
 160             @ occupation_cs ex:occupation
 161                 language cs
 162         @ name Yagy Muneyoshi
 163         @ occupation 
 164         @ occupation_en Ninja
 165         @ occupation_cs Ninda
 166     ld-doc
 167         # Language map expressing a property in three languages
 168         context
 169             @ ex http://example.com/vocab/
 170             @ occupation ex:occupation
 171                 container @language
 172         @ name Yagy Muneyoshi
 173         @ occupation
 174             @ ja 
 175             @ en Ninja
 176             @ cs Ninda
 177     ld-doc
 178         # EXAMPLE 35: Overriding default language using an expanded value
 179         context
 180             language ja
 181         @ name 
 182         @ occupation
 183             value Scientist
 184             language en
 185     ld-doc
 186         # EXAMPLE 36: Removing language information using an expanded value
 187         context
 188             language ja
 189         @ name
 190             value Frank
 191         @ occupation
 192             value Ninja
 193             language en
 194         @ speciality 
 195     ld-doc http://example.org/people#joebob
 196         # EXAMPLE 42: Multiple values with no inherent order
 197         @ nick
 198             [ set
 199                 @ joe
 200                 @ bob
 201                 @ jaybee
 202     ld-doc http://example.org/people#joebob
 203         # EXAMPLE 44: An ordered collection of values in JSON-LD
 204         context
 205             @ nick http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/nick
 206         @ nick
 207             list
 208                 @ joe
 209                 @ bob
 210                 @ jaybee
 211     ld-doc http://example.org/people#joebob
 212         # EXAMPLE 45: Specifying that a collection is ordered in the context
 213         context
 214             @ nick http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/nick
 215                 container @list
 216         @ nick
 217             [
 218                 @ "joe"
 219                 @ "bob"
 220                 @ "jaybee"
 221     ld-doc
 222         # EXAMPLE 49: Identifying and making statements about a graph
 223         context
 224             @ generatedAt http://www.w3.org/ns/prov#generatedAtTime
 225                 type http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#date
 226             @ Person http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person
 227             @ name http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name
 228             @ knows http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/knows
 229         @ generatedAt 2012-04-09
 230         graph http://example.org/graphs/73
 231             + http://manu.sporny.org/about#manu
 232                 type Person
 233                 @ name Manu Sporny
 234                 @ knows http://greggkellogg.net/foaf#me
 235             + http://greggkellogg.net/foaf#me
 236                 type Person
 237                 @ name Gregg Kellogg
 238                 @ knows http://manu.sporny.org/about#manu
 239     ld-doc _:n1
 240         # EXAMPLE 52: Specifying a local blank node identifier
 241         @ name Secret Agent 1
 242         @ knows
 243             +
 244                 @ name Secret Agent 2
 245                 @ knows
 246                     + _:n1
 247     ld-doc http://example.com/
 248         # EXAMPLE 54: Indexing data in JSON-LD
 249         context
 250             @ schema http://schema.org/
 251             @ name schema:name
 252             @ body schema:articleBody
 253             @ words schema:wordCount
 254             @ post schema:blogPost
 255                 container @index
 256         type schema:Blog
 257         @ name World Financial News
 258         @ post
 259             @ en
 260                 + http://example.com/posts/1/en
 261                     @ body World commodities were up today with heavy trading of crude oil...
 262                     @ words 1539
 263             @ de
 264                 + http://example.com/posts/1/de
 265                     @ body Die Werte an Warenbrsen stiegen im Sog eines starken Handels von Rohl..."
 266                     @ words 1204
 267     ld-doc
 268         # EXAMPLE 61: Flattened and compacted form for the previous example
 269         context
 270             @ name http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name
 271             @ knows http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/knows
 272         graph
 273             + _:b0
 274                 @ name Dave Longley
 275             + http://manu.sporny.org/about#manu
 276                 @ name Manu Sporny
 277             + http://me.markus-lanthaler.com/
 278                 @ name Markus Lanthaler
 279                 @ knows
 280                     [
 281                         @ http://manu.sporny.org/about#manu
 282                         @ _:b0

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/lib/artifacts/jsonld/document/gen/main.js.ittf



   1 module wizzi-demo.plugin.lib.artifacts.jsonld.document.gen.main
   2     kind jsfile
   3     # Example of language artifact that targets
   4     # the JSON-LG 1.0 (2014) specification.
   5     #
   6     # This is a code write based artifact generator.
   7     # It generates a json document.
   8     #
   9     var md = module.exports = {}
  10     var myname = 'wizzi-demo.advanced.plugins.lib.artifacts.jsonld.jsonlg.main';
  11     set md.gen
  12         function gen
  13             { model
  14             { ctx
  15             callback
  16             # check the model is a wizzi model of type 'jsonld'
  17             if model.wzElement !== 'jsonld'
  18                 return
  19                     _ callback
  20                         _ ctx.error
  21                             @ myname + " error: the model paramater should be an 'jsonld' wizzi model"
  22                             @ model
  23             _ ctx.w("Not implemented yet.")
  24             _ callback(null, ctx)

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/lib/wizzi/schemas/jsonld.wfschema.ittf



   1 wfschema jsonld
   2     # Example wizzi schema used by this package demos.
   3     # It is an experimental implementation of a
   4     # vocabulary, taxonomy, onthology and direct graph schema.
   5     # Is inspired by
   6     # . RDF11 [https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf11-concepts/]
   7     # . OWL2 [https://www.w3.org/TR/owl2-primer/]
   8     # . JSON-LD [https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld-syntax/]
   9     export-to json
  10     e comment
  11         tag #
  12     e jsonlditem
  13         is-abstract
  14         r comment/s
  15         r jsonlditem/s
  16     e nodeObject : jsonlditem
  17         tag +
  18         # A node object.
  19         # The `wzName` is the `JSON-LD @id` property.
  20         a language
  21             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
  22         a container
  23             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
  24         a reverse
  25             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
  26         m wzInitialize
  27             set this.__jsonld
  28                 {
  29             set this.__wizzi
  30                 {
  31             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  32                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
  33                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
  34                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
  35                 if item.wzElement === 'graph'
  36                     set this.graph = item
  37                     set this.__jsonld['@graph'] = item.__jsonld
  38             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.wzName)
  39                 set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.wzName
  40                 set this.__wizzi.__id = this.wzName
  41             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  42                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
  43                     if !item.__key
  44                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
  45                     else
  46                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  47                         var ss = item.__key.split(':')
  48                         if ss.length > 1
  49                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1]] = item.__jsonld
  50                             set this.__wizzi[ss[1] + '_ns'] = ss[0]
  51                         else
  52                             set this.__wizzi[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
  53                 elif item.wzElement === 'type'
  54                     set this.type = item
  55                     set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
  56                     set this.__wizzi.__type = item.__localName
  57                     set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__prefix
  58                     # TODO
  59                     # set this.__wizzi.__type_ns = item.__ns
  60                 elif item.wzElement === 'context' || item.wzElement === 'graph'
  61                     # done already
  62                 else
  63                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `nodeObject` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
  64             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
  65             set this.__jsonProps
  66                 {
  67                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
  68                     @ __wizzi this.__wizzi
  69         m isType
  70             param type
  71             return this.type ? this.type.isType(type) : false
  72         m nodesOfType
  73             param type
  74             param gotten
  75             if this.graph
  76                 if !gotten
  77                     set gotten = []
  78                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  79                     return gotten
  80                 else
  81                     _ this.graph.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
  82             elif this.isType(type)
  83                 if !gotten
  84                     return [this]
  85                 else
  86                     _ gotten.push(this.__wizzi)
  87             else
  88                 if !gotten
  89                     return []
  90     e jsonld : nodeObject
  91         is-root
  92         # Can be a `document` or a container of many `documents`.
  93         # As a `document` can be a top `node` element or the container of
  94         # an array of top `node` elements.
  95         m wzInitialize
  96             var isArrayOfDocuments = true
  97             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
  98                 if item.wzElement !== 'document'
  99                     set isArrayOfDocuments = false
 100             if isArrayOfDocuments
 101                 set this.__jsonld
 102                     [
 103                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 104                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 105                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 106                 set this.__jsonProps
 107                     {
 108                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 109             else
 110                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 111             return
 112     e document : nodeObject
 113         tag ld-doc
 114         # Can be a top `node` element or the container of
 115         # an array of top `node` elements.
 116         # Must be child of the `jsonld` element.
 117         # Allows multiple documents in a single ittf source document
 118         m wzInitialize
 119             var isArrayOfNodes = true
 120             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 121                 if item.wzElement !== 'nodeObject'
 122                     set isArrayOfNodes = false
 123             if isArrayOfNodes
 124                 set this.__jsonld
 125                     [
 126                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 127                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 128                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 129                 set this.__jsonProps
 130                     {
 131                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 132             else
 133                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 134             return
 135     e term : jsonlditem
 136         tag @
 137         # The `@` tag has nothing to do with the JSON-LD reserved word prefix.
 138         # Core wizzi schemas often use tha `@` tag symbol to indicate object properties (key-values).
 139         # A `term` element is a key-value pair (property) in a `nodeObject` or `context` element.
 140         # The key is a short-hand string that expands to an IRI or a blank node identifier.
 141         # If the `term` element has children elements the `wzName` is the key and
 142         # the child or children are the value. If it has no children the `wzName` is
 143         # splitted in a key and a value pair separated by the first blank char.
 144         # In a `context` element keys define the term,
 145         # and values are the IRIs associated with the term.
 146         # In a `nodeObject` keys may expand to an absolute IRI using the active context,
 147         # and values must be one of the following elements:
 148         # `valueItem`, or
 149         # `nodeObject`, or
 150         # `valueObject`, or
 151         # list or set `array`, or
 152         # an array of zero or more of the possibilities above, or
 153         # `languageMap`, or
 154         # `indexMap`
 155         a id
 156             # The `JSON-LD @id` property.
 157             # When the parent is a `nodeObject` the 'id' attribute
 158             # means: 'This value is an identifier that is an IRI'
 159         a reverse
 160             # The `JSON-LD @reverse` property.
 161         a language
 162             # The `JSON-LD @language` property.
 163         a container
 164             # The `JSON-LD @container` property.
 165         m wzInitialize
 166             var nv = verify.parseNameValue(this.wzName)
 167             # log 'nv.name(), nv.value()', nv.name(), '/', nv.value()
 168             if this.jsonlditems.length === 0
 169                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 170                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.id)
 171                     set this.__jsonld
 172                         {
 173                             @ ['@id'] this.id
 174                 else
 175                     set this.__jsonld = nv.value()
 176                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 177                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 178                         set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 179                     else
 180                         set this.__jsonld
 181                             {
 182                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 183                                 @ ['@language'] this.language
 184                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 185                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 186                         set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 187                     else
 188                         set this.__jsonld
 189                             {
 190                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 191                                 @ ['@reverse'] this.reverse
 192                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 193                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 194                         set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 195                     else
 196                         set this.__jsonld
 197                             {
 198                                 @ ['@id'] this.__jsonld
 199                                 @ ['@container'] this.container
 200             else
 201                 set this.__key = nv.name()
 202                 set this.__jsonld = {}
 203                 if verify.isNotEmpty(nv.value())
 204                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = nv.value()
 205                 else
 206                     set this.__jsonld['@id'] = this.id
 207                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 208                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 209                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.reverse)
 210                     set this.__jsonld['@reverse'] = this.reverse
 211                 if verify.isNotEmpty(this.container)
 212                     set this.__jsonld['@container'] = this.container
 213                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 214                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 215                     if item.wzElement === 'type'
 216                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
 217                         set this.__type = item.__localName
 218                         set this.__type_ns = item.__prefix
 219                         # TODO
 220                         # set this.__type_ns = item.__ns
 221                     elif item.wzElement === 'valueObject'
 222                         set this.__jsonld['@value'] = item.__jsonld
 223                     elif item.wzElement === 'context'
 224                         set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 225                     elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 226                         if !item.__key
 227                             _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 228                         else
 229                             set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 230                     elif item.wzElement === 'array'
 231                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 232                     elif item.wzElement === 'list'
 233                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 234                     elif item.wzElement === 'set'
 235                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 236                     elif item.wzElement === 'nodeObject'
 237                         if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 238                             _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 239                         else
 240                             set this.__jsonld
 241                                 [
 242                                     @ item.__jsonld
 243                     else
 244                         _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `term` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 245             set this.__jsonProps
 246                 {
 247                     @ __key this.__key
 248                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 249     e context : jsonlditem
 250         # Defines a local context in a node object.
 251         # The `wzName` can be null, an absolute IRI or a relative IRI.
 252         # If the `wzName` is null it contains a context definition.
 253         # Its parent must either be a `nodeObject` or a `document` element or
 254         # the `jsonld` element root.
 255         # Its keys must either be terms, compact IRIs, absolute IRIs,
 256         # or the attributes `language`, `base`, and `vocab`.
 257         # `nodeObject` elements contained in a `context` element must be
 258         # either an expanded term node with allowed attributes: id (the wzName), reverse, type, language, container
 259         a language
 260             # must have the lexical form described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 261         a base
 262             # must be an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null
 263         a vocab
 264             # must be a absolute IRI, a compact IRI, a blank node identifier, a term, or null
 265         m wzInitialize
 266             set this.__jsonld
 267                 {
 268             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 269                 set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 270             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.base)
 271                 set this.__jsonld['@base'] = this.base
 272             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.vocab)
 273                 set this.__jsonld['@vocab'] = this.vocab
 274             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 275                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 276                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
 277                     if !item.__key
 278                         _ ctx.addError('The `term` element has no key', item)
 279                     else
 280                         set this.__jsonld[item.__key] = item.__jsonld
 281                 else
 282                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `context` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 283             # log 'this.__jsonld', this.__jsonld
 284             set this.__jsonProps
 285                 {
 286                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 287     e graph : nodeObject
 288         # Must be either a node object or an array of zero or more node objects.
 289         m wzInitialize
 290             var isArrayOfNodes = true
 291             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 292                 # log 'graph.item.wzElement', item.wzElement
 293                 if item.wzElement !== 'nodeObject'
 294                     set isArrayOfNodes = false
 295             if isArrayOfNodes
 296                 set this.__jsonld
 297                     [
 298                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 299                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 300                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__jsonld)
 301                 set this.__jsonProps
 302                     {
 303                         @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 304             else
 305                 _ _md.nodeObject.prototype.wzInitialize.call(this, ctx);
 306             return
 307         m nodesOfType
 308             param type
 309             param gotten
 310             if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 311                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 312                     if item.wzElement === 'nodeObject'
 313                         _ item.nodesOfType(type, gotten)
 314             elif this['@type'] === type
 315                 _ gotten.push(this.__jsonld)
 316     e type : jsonlditem
 317         # Must be either an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, a compact IRI (including blank node identifiers),
 318         # a term defined in the active context expanding into an absolute IRI, or an array of any of these
 319         m wzInitialize
 320             if this.jsonlditems.length > 0
 321                 set this.__jsonld = []
 322                 foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 323                     _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 324                     if item.wzElement === 'array'
 325                         set this.__jsonld = item.__jsonld
 326                     else
 327                         _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `type` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 328             else
 329                 set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 330                 var ss = this.wzName.split(':')
 331                 if ss.length > 1
 332                     set this.__prefix = ss[0]
 333                     set this.__localName = ss[1]
 334                     # TODO
 335                     # set this.__ns = ...
 336                 else
 337                     set this.__localName = this.wzName
 338         m isType
 339             param type
 340             if verify.isArray(this.__jsonld)
 341                 foreach value in this.__jsonld
 342                     if value === type
 343                         return true
 344             else
 345                 return this.__jsonld === type
 346     e valueObject : jsonlditem
 347         tag value
 348         # Is used to explicitly associate a type or a language with a value
 349         # to create a typed value or a language-tagged string.
 350         # May contain a `type`, a `language` or an `index` attribute, or a `context` element
 351         # but must not contain both a `type` and a `language` key at the same time.
 352         # A value object must not contain any other keys that expand to an absolute IRI or keyword.
 353         # The `wzName` contains the `@value` content. It must be either a string, a number,
 354         # true, false or null.
 355         # The value associated with the `type` element/attribute must be a term, a compact IRI,
 356         # an absolute IRI, a relative IRI, or null.
 357         # The value associated with the `language` attribute must have the lexical form
 358         # described in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null
 359         a language
 360             # The `JSON-LD @language key`
 361             # The value must have the lexical form described
 362             # in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47] or be null.
 363         a index
 364             # The `JSON-LD @index key`
 365             # The value associated with the `index` attribute must be a string.
 366         m wzInitialize
 367             set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 368             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.language)
 369                 if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 370                     set this.__jsonld['@language'] = this.language
 371                 else
 372                     set this.__jsonld
 373                         {
 374                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 375                             @ ['@language'] this.language
 376             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.index)
 377                 if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 378                     set this.__jsonld['@index'] = this.index
 379                 else
 380                     set this.__jsonld
 381                         {
 382                             @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 383                             @ ['@index'] this.index
 384             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 385                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 386                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 387                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 388                         set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 389                     else
 390                         set this.__jsonld
 391                             {
 392                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 393                                 @ ['@context'] item.__jsonld
 394                 elif item.wzElement === 'type'
 395                     if verify.isObject(this.__jsonld)
 396                         set this.__jsonld['@type'] = item.__jsonld
 397                     else
 398                         set this.__jsonld
 399                             {
 400                                 @ ['@value'] this.__jsonld
 401                                 @ ['@type'] item.__jsonld
 402                 else
 403                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `valueObject` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 404             set this.__jsonProps
 405                 {
 406                     @ __jsonld this.__jsonld
 407     e set : jsonlditem
 408         # Can can contain the `context` element and an array of
 409         # zero or more of `nodeObject`, `valueObject` and `valueItem` elements.
 410         m wzInitialize
 411             set this.__jsonld = {}
 412             var items = []
 413             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 414                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 415                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 416                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 417                 elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 418                     _ items.push(item.__key)
 419                 else
 420                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `set` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 421             set this.__jsonld['@set'] = items
 422     e list : jsonlditem
 423         # Can contain the `index` attribute, the `context` element and an array of
 424         # zero or more of `nodeObject`, `valueObject` and `valueItem` elements.
 425         a index
 426             # The `JSON-LD @index key`
 427             # The value associated with the `index` attribute must be a string.
 428         m wzInitialize
 429             set this.__jsonld = {}
 430             if verify.isNotEmpty(this.index)
 431                 set this.__jsonld['@index'] = this.index
 432             var items = []
 433             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 434                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 435                 if item.wzElement === 'context'
 436                     set this.__jsonld['@context'] = item.__jsonld
 437                 elif item.wzElement === 'term'
 438                     _ items.push(item.__key)
 439                 else
 440                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `list` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 441             set this.__jsonld['@list'] = items
 442     e array : jsonlditem
 443         tag [
 444         # Can contains an array of `property` values.
 445         m wzInitialize
 446             set this.__jsonld = []
 447             foreach item in this.jsonlditems
 448                 _ item.wzInitialize(ctx)
 449                 if item.wzElement === 'term'
 450                     _ this.__jsonld.push(item.__key)
 451                 else
 452                     _ ctx.addError('Unknow child of `term` element : ' + item.wzElement, item)
 453     e valueItem : jsonlditem
 454         is-abstract
 455     e string : valueItem
 456         # The `wzName` contains the string (unquoted).
 457         m wzInitialize
 458             set this.__jsonld = this.wzName
 459     e number : valueItem
 460         # The `wzName` contains the number.
 461         m wzInitialize
 462             set this.__jsonld = Number(this.wzName)
 463     e true : valueItem
 464         # No `wzName`.
 465         m wzInitialize
 466             set this.__jsonld = true
 467     e false : valueItem
 468         # No `wzName`.
 469         m wzInitialize
 470             set this.__jsonld = false
 471     e null : valueItem
 472         # No `wzName`.
 473         m wzInitialize
 474             set this.__jsonld = null

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/artifact-generation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve an ArtifactGenerator by its name
   4         # Generators are searched in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getArtifactGenerator
   7         string generationName
   8         +
   9         var generator = this.artifactGenerators[generationName] || null
  10         if generator == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set generator = require('./lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getArtifactGenerator'
  23                             @ 'Error loading artifact generator: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.artifactGenerators[generationName] = generator
  25         return generator

  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g.js'

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/source/ittf__copy/root/t/schema-definition.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziSchema definition in JSON format
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getSchemaDefinition
   7         string schemaName
   8         var definition = this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] || null
   9         if definition == null
  10             var schemaJsonUri
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-schema.g.json'
  14             if this.file.exists(schemaJsonUri)
  15                 try
  16                     set definition = this.file.readJSON(schemaJsonUri)
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getSchemaDefinition'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi schema definition: ' + schemaJsonUri + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] = definition
  24         return definition

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/jsonld/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var build = require('./source/generate')
   4     var examples = require('./examples')
   5     function exec
   6         param request
   7         param callback
   8         if request === 'build'
   9             return
  10                 _ build
  11                     @ callback
  12         elif request === 'examples'
  13             return
  14                 _ examples
  15                     @ callback
  16         else
  17             var msg = 'Invalid request: ' + request + ', should be `build` or `examples`'
  18             log msg
  19             if callback
  20                 _ callback
  21                     @ msg
  22     set module.exports
  23         function
  24             param request
  25             param callback
  26             if typeof callback === 'undefined'
  27                 set callback = request
  28                 set request = 'build'
  29             _ exec(request, callback)
  30     if require.main === module
  31         var request = process.argv.length > 2 ? process.argv[2] : 'build'
  32         _ exec
  33             @ request

  15             _ this.toRegExp(sb)

  38             default gi

  43             if root.executables[this.wzName]
  44                 throw new Error('Duplicated executableRegExp: ' + this.wzName)
  45             set root.executables[this.wzName] = this
  46         m exec
  47             param string
  48             var re = this.toRegExp()
  49             # var result = string.match(re)
  50             var result = re.exec(string)
  51             return result
  52         m execTests
  53             var results = []
  54             foreach t in this.tests
  55                 # log 'execTests.executableRegExp', t.wzName
  56                 var r = this.exec(t.wzName)
  57                 _ results.push
  58                     {
  59                         @ name this.wzName
  60                         @ regexp this.__regexp
  61                         @ string t.wzName
  62                         @ result
  63                             iif this.named
  64                                 then r.captures
  65                                 else r
  66                         @ expected t.expected
  67                         @ isExpected

  70                                     then r.captures
  71                                     else r

  73         m toRegExp
  74             if !this.__regexp

  77                     _ item.toRegExp(sb)
  78                 set this.__regexp = sb.join('')

  85                     _ verify.namedRegExp
  86                         new RegExp(this.__regexp, this.flags)

  90                         new RegExp(this.__regexp, this.flags)
  91     e_tag( regexpElement,  e,  node )
  92         # composable element of a regexp
  93         m wzInitialize
  94             var root = this.wzRoot()
  95             if root.elements[this.wzName]
  96                 throw new Error('Duplicated regexpElement: ' + this.wzName)
  97             set root.elements[this.wzName] = this
  98     e test : node
  99         m wzInitialize
 100             set this.expected = null
 101             if this.nodes.length === 1 && this.nodes[0].wzElement === 'expected'
 102                 set this.expected = this.nodes[0].toValue()
 103         m isExpected
 104             param results
 105             if this.expected == null
 106                 return null
 107             if !results
 108                 if this.expected === 'null'
 109                     return true
 110                 else
 111                     return false
 112             if verify.isArray(this.expected)
 113                 if results.length != this.expected.length
 114                     return false
 115                 for var i=0; i<results.length; i++
 116                     if results[i] !== this.expected[i]
 117                         return false
 118                 return true
 119             else
 120                 log 'res', JSON.stringify(results)
 121                 log 'exp', JSON.stringify(this.expected)
 122                 return JSON.stringify(results) === JSON.stringify(this.expected)
 123     e expected : node
 124         a separator
 125             default ,
 126         m toValue
 127             log 'expected', this
 128             if verify.isEmpty(this.wzName)
 129                 if this.nodes.length === 0
 130                     return null
 131                 else
 132                     log 'expected is object'
 133                     return this.nodes[0].toValue().value
 134             else
 135                 if this.wzName === 'null'
 136                     return this.wzName
 137                 return this.wzName.trim().split(this.separator)
 138     e_tag( bracket,  [,  node )
 139         # one required group of juxtaposed components
 140         # juxtaposed: separated by whitespaces
 141         m toRegExp
 142             param sb

 144                 if i > 0
 145                     _ sb.push(' ')
 146                 _ item.toRegExp(sb)

 151                     @ value []

 155                     @ v.name + ( v.value ? ' ' + v.value : '' )
 156             return ret
 157     e_tag( bracketQuestionMark,  [?,  node )
 158         # one optional group of juxtaposed components
 159         # juxtaposed: separated by whitespaces
 160     e_tag( bracketPlus,  [+,  node )
 161         # at least one or many groups of juxtaposed components
 162         # juxtaposed: separated by whitespaces
 163     e_tag( bracketHashmark,  [#,  node )
 164         # zero or many groups of comma separated juxtaposed components

 166     e_tag( ampersand,  &,  node )

 225     e_tag( doubleBar,  ||,  node )
 226     e_tag( doubleAmpersand,  &&,  node )
 227     e_tag( paren,  (,  node )
 228         # (x) - Matches x and remembers the match. These are called capturing groups.
 229         m toRegExp

 232             if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 233                 _ sb.push('(' + s + ')')
 234             else

 236                 if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 237                     _ sb.push('(' + s + ')')
 238     e_tag( graph,  {,  node )
 239         # Quantifier
 240         # x{n}   - Where n is a positive integer. Matches exactly n occurrences of the preceding item x.
 241         # x{n,}     - Where n is a positive integer. Matches at least n occurrences of the preceding item x.
 242         # x{n,m} - Where n and m are positive integers. Matches at least n and at most m occurrences of the preceding item x.
 243         m toRegExp
 244             param sb
 245             var s = getReFromChildren(this)
 246             if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 247                 _ sb.push(s)
 248             _ sb.push('{' + this.wzName + '}')
 249         m toValue
 250             var ret
 251                 {
 252                     @ name this.wzName
 253                     @ value {}
 254             foreach item in this.nodes
 255                 var v = item.toValue()
 256                 set ret.value[v.name] = v.value
 257             log 'graph.toValue.ret', ret
 258             return ret
 259     e_tag( parenQuestionMarkEqual,  (?=,  node )
 260         # Assertion
 261         # x(?=y) Matches x only if x is followed by y.
 262         m toRegExp
 263             param sb
 264             _ nodeToRegExp
 265                 @ this
 266                 @ sb
 267                 @ '(?='
 268     e_tag( parenQuestionMarkExlamationPoint,  (?!,  node )
 269         # Assertion
 270         # x(?!y) Matches x only if x is not followed by y.
 271         m toRegExp

 275                 @ sb

 277     e_tag( parenColon,  (:,  node )

 279         # x(?!y) Matches x only if x is not followed by y.
 280         m toRegExp
 281             param sb

 283             _ sb.push
 284                 @ '(:' + '<' + this.wzName + '>' + s + ')'
 285     e_tag( bracketCap,  [^,  node )
 286         # A negated or complemented character set
 287         m toRegExp
 288             param sb
 289             _ sb.push('[^')
 290             if verify.isEmpty(this.wzName) === false
 291                 _ sb.push(this.wzName)
 292             else
 293                 foreach item in this.nodes
 294                     _ item.toRegExp(sb)
 295             _ sb.push(']')
 296     e_tag( capDollar,  ^$,  node )

 299             _ sb.push('^')

 301             if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 302                 _ sb.push(s)
 303             else
 304                 foreach item in this.nodes
 305                     _ item.toRegExp(sb)
 306             _ sb.push('$')
 307     e blank : node
 308         m toRegExp
 309             param sb
 310             var num = verify.isNumber(this.wzName) ? verify.convert(this.wzName, 'integer') : 1
 311             _ sb.push(new Array(num + 1).join(' '))
 312     declare
 313         var builtInElements
 314             {
 315                 @ space '\\s'
 316                 @ 'not-space' '\\S'
 317                 @ word '\\w'
 318                 @ 'not-word' '\\W'
 319                 @ digit '\\d'
 320                 @ 'not-digit' '\\D'
 321                 @ 'word-boundary' '\\b'
 322                 @ 'not-word-boundary' '\\B'
 323                 @ tab '\\t'
 324                 @ crlf '\\r\\f'
 325                 @ 'carriage-return' '\\r'
 326                 @ 'form-feed' '\\f'
 327     m escape
 328         param text
 329         return verify.escapeRegExp(text)
 330     m getElement
 331         param root
 332         param wzName
 333         if verify.isEmpty(wzName)
 334             return null
 335         var re = /\<(\w+\-?\w+)\>/g;
 336         var match = re.exec(wzName);
 337         # log 'match', re, wzName, match
 338         if match != null
 339             var elName = match[1]
 340             if builtInElements[elName]
 341                 return
 342                     [
 343                         @ match[0]
 344                         @ builtInElements[elName]
 345                         @ 'builtIn'
 346             var el = root.elements[elName]
 347             # log 'getElement', elName, el.wzTag, el.wzName
 348             return
 349                 [
 350                     @ match[0]
 351                     @ el
 352         else
 353             # log 'getElement not found: ' + wzName
 354             return null
 355     m getReFromName
 356         param node
 357         var s = node.wzName
 358         if verify.isEmpty(s)
 359             return null
 360         if s.indexOf('<') < 0 && s.indexOf('-') > -1 && s.length === 3
 361             return '[' + escape(s) + ']'
 362         else
 363             var el = getElement(node.wzRoot(), s)
 364             if el === null
 365                 return escape(s)
 366             else
 367                 if el.length > 2 && el[2] === 'builtIn'
 368                     return
 369                         _ verify.replaceAll
 370                             @ s
 371                             @ el[0]
 372                             @ el[1]
 373                 else
 374                     var sb = []
 375                     _ el[1].toRegExp(sb)
 376                     return
 377                         _ verify.replaceAll
 378                             @ s
 379                             @ el[0]
 380                             _ sb.join('')
 381     m getReFromChildren
 382         param node
 383         var sb = []
 384         foreach item in node.nodes
 385             _ item.toRegExp(sb)
 386         return sb.join('')
 387     m nodeToRegExp
 388         param node
 389         param sb
 390         param tag
 391         var s = getReFromName(node)
 392         if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 393             if tag[0] === '('
 394                 _ sb.push(tag + s + ')')
 395             else
 396                 _ sb.push(enclose(s) + tag)
 397         else
 398             set s = getReFromChildren(node)
 399             if verify.isNotEmpty(s)
 400                 if tag[0] === '('
 401                     _ sb.push(tag + s + ')')
 402                 else
 403                     _ sb.push(enclose(s) + tag)
 404     m enclose
 405         param s
 406         if numchars(s) < 2 || (s[0] === '(' && s.substr(-1) === ')') || (s[0] === '[' && s.substr(-1) === ']') || (s[0] === '^' && s.substr(-1) === '$')
 407             return s
 408         else
 409             if s.indexOf('[') > -1 && s.indexOf(']') > -1
 410                 return '(?:' + s + ')'
 411             else
 412                 return '[' + s + ']'
 413     m numchars
 414         param s
 415         if verify.isEmpty(s)
 416             return 0
 417         var count = 0
 418         for var i=0; i<s.length; i++
 419             if s[i] != '\\'
 420                 set count++
 421         return count

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/ittf__copy/root/t/artifact-generation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve an ArtifactGenerator by its name
   4         # Generators are searched in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getArtifactGenerator
   7         string generationName
   8         +
   9         var generator = this.artifactGenerators[generationName] || null
  10         if generator == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set generator = require('./lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getArtifactGenerator'
  23                             @ 'Error loading artifact generator: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.artifactGenerators[generationName] = generator
  25         return generator

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/ittf__copy/root/t/model-factory.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziModelFactory by its wizzischema name
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getModelFactory
   7         string schemaName
   8         var factory = this.modelFactories[schemaName] || null
   9         if factory == null
  10             var modulePath
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g.js'
  14             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  15                 try
  16                     set factory = require('./lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g')
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getModelFactory'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi model factory: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.modelFactories[schemaName] = factory
  24         return factory

   1 $group
   2     #

   8         +
   9         var transformer = this.modelTransformers[transformerName] || null
  10         if transformer == null

  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set transformer = require('./lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getModelTransformer'

  24                 set this.modelTransformers[transformerName] = transformer
  25         return transformer

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/ittf__copy/root/t/schema-definition.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziSchema definition in JSON format
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getSchemaDefinition
   7         string schemaName
   8         var definition = this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] || null
   9         if definition == null
  10             var schemaJsonUri
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-schema.g.json'
  14             if this.file.exists(schemaJsonUri)
  15                 try
  16                     set definition = this.file.readJSON(schemaJsonUri)
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getSchemaDefinition'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi schema definition: ' + schemaJsonUri + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] = definition
  24         return definition

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/ittf__copy/root/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     +
   4     var util = require('util')
   5     var path = require('path')
   6     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   7     +
   8     var md = module.exports = {}
   9     set md.name = 'local'
  10     +
  11     #
  12         # FactoryPlugin class
  13     class FactoryPlugin
  14         ctor
  15             { wizziPackage
  16                 { file
  17             { provides
  18             set this.file = wizziPackage.file
  19             set this.provides = provides
  20             set this.modelFactories = {}
  21             set this.modelTransformers = {}
  22             set this.artifactGenerators = {}
  23             set this.schemaDefinitions = {}
  24         m initialize
  25             { options
  26             callback
  27             # TODO
  28             return
  29                 _ callback(null)
  30         m getName
  31             return 'local'
  32         m getFilename
  33             return __filename
  34         m getProvides
  35             return this.provides
  36         $include model-factory
  37         $include model-transformation
  38         $include artifact-generation
  39         $include schema-definition
  40     +
  41     set module.exports
  42         {
  43             { provides
  44                 [ schemas
  45                     @ 'regexp'
  46                 [ artifactGenerators
  47                 [ modelTransformers
  48             @ createFactoryPlugin
  49                 function createFactoryPlugin
  50                     { wizziPackage
  51                     { options
  52                     callback
  53                     var plugin
  54                         new FactoryPlugin
  55                             @ wizziPackage
  56                             @ this.provides
  57                     _ plugin.initialize
  58                         @ options
  59                         f_cb()
  60                             return
  61                                 _ callback
  62                                     @ null
  63                                     @ plugin
  64     +

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/ittf__copy/generate.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob demo-plugin
   2     $
   3         console.log( '__dirname',  __dirname);)
   4         var ittf_root             = path.join(__dirname, 'root');
   5         var ittf_lib              = path.join(__dirname, 'lib');
   6         var dest_folder           = path.resolve(__dirname, '..', '..', 'local');
   7     line ittf-root
   8         cwd-folder ${ittf_root}
   9         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  10         wfjob/any_js()
  11             ignore ${ittf_root}/**/*__copy.*/**/*.js.ittf
  12         $include wfjob/any_json
  13     line ittf-lib
  14         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib}
  15         dest-folder ${dest_folder}/lib
  16         wfjob/any_js()
  17             ignore ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.js.ittf
  18         artifact any_ittf_inside___copy
  19             src ${ittf_lib}/**/*__copy/**/*.ittf
  20             extension ittf
  21     production
  22         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  23         line-ref ittf-root
  24         line-ref ittf-lib

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/source/generate.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var path = require('path')
   4     var async = require('async')
   5     var wizzi = require('wizzi')
   6     function exec
   7         param gen_callback
   8         # begin params
   9         var $name = 'wizzi-demo - regexp plugin generation'
  10         var $schemaNames
  11             [
  12                 @ 'regexp'
  13         var $destFolder
  14             _ path.resolve
  15                 @ __dirname
  16                 @ '..'
  17                 @ 'local'
  18         # end params
  19         _ wizzi.executeWizziJob
  20             {
  21                 @ user 'stefi'
  22                 @ role 'admin'
  23                 @ storeKind 'filesystem'
  24                 { config
  25                     @ wfBaseFolder __dirname
  26                     [ plugins
  27                         @ 'wizzi-core'
  28                         @ 'wizzi-js'
  29                         @ 'wizzi-web'
  30                 { job
  31                     @ name $name
  32                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  33                         _ path.join
  34                             @ __dirname
  35                             @ 'ittf'
  36                             @ 'generate.wfjob.ittf'
  37                     @ productionOptions
  38                         _ wizzi.productionOptions
  39                             {
  40                                 @ indentSpaces 4
  41                                 @ basedir __dirname
  42                                 @ verbose 2
  43                     { globalContext
  44             f_cb_no_err( result)
  45                 if err
  46                     if gen_callback
  47                         return
  48                             _ gen_callback
  49                                 _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  50                     else
  51                         return
  52                             _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  53                 _ async.map
  54                     @ $schemaNames
  55                     function async_item
  56                         param schemaName
  57                         param callback
  58                         log 'Generating schema ' + schemaName
  59                         _ wizzi.generateWizziModelTypes
  60                             {
  61                                 { configOptions
  62                                 { wfschema
  63                                     @ name schemaName
  64                                     @ ittfDocumentUri
  65                                         _ path.join
  66                                             @ __dirname
  67                                             @ 'ittf'
  68                                             @ 'lib'
  69                                             @ 'wizzi'
  70                                             @ 'schemas'
  71                                             @ schemaName + '.wfschema.ittf'
  72                                     @ outputPackageFolder $destFolder
  73                             function
  74                                 param err
  75                                 param result
  76                                 if err
  77                                     return
  78                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  79                                 _ callback(result)
  80                     f_cb_no_err( result)
  81                         if err
  82                             if gen_callback
  83                                 return
  84                                     _ gen_callback
  85                                         _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  86                             else
  87                                 return
  88                                     _ wizzi.printWizziJobError($name, err)
  89                         else
  90                             if gen_callback
  91                                 return
  92                                     _ gen_callback
  93                                         @ null
  94                                         @ result
  95     set module.exports
  96         function
  97             param callback
  98             _ exec(callback)
  99     if require.main === module
 100         _ exec

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/regexp/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     var build = require('./source/generate')
   4     var examples = require('./examples')
   5     function exec
   6         param request
   7         param callback
   8         if request === 'build'
   9             return
  10                 _ build
  11                     @ callback
  12         elif request === 'examples'
  13             return
  14                 _ examples
  15                     @ callback
  16         else
  17             var msg = 'Invalid request: ' + request + ', should be `build` or `examples`'
  18             log msg
  19             if callback
  20                 _ callback
  21                     @ msg
  22     set module.exports
  23         function
  24             param request
  25             param callback
  26             if typeof callback === 'undefined'
  27                 set callback = request
  28                 set request = 'build'
  29             _ exec(request, callback)
  30     if require.main === module
  31         var request = process.argv.length > 2 ? process.argv[2] : 'build'
  32         _ exec
  33             @ request

src/ittf/examples/advanced/plugins/readme.md.ittf
