src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/plugin/artifact-generation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve an ArtifactGenerator by its name
   4         # Generators are searched in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getArtifactGenerator
   7         string generationName
   8         +
   9         var generator = this.artifactGenerators[generationName] || null
  10         if generator == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set generator = require('./lib/artifacts/' + generationName + '/gen/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getArtifactGenerator'
  23                             @ 'Error loading artifact generator: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.artifactGenerators[generationName] = generator
  25         return generator

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/plugin/model-factory.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziModelFactory by its wizzischema name
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getModelFactory
   7         string schemaName
   8         var factory = this.modelFactories[schemaName] || null
   9         if factory == null
  10             var modulePath
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g.js'
  14             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  15                 try
  16                     set factory = require('./lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-factory.g')
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getModelFactory'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi model factory: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.modelFactories[schemaName] = factory
  24         return factory

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/plugin/model-transformation.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # retrieve a ModelTransformer by its name
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getModelTransformer
   7         string transformerName
   8         +
   9         var transformer = this.modelTransformers[transformerName] || null
  10         if transformer == null
  11             var modulePath
  12                 _ path.resolve
  13                     @ __dirname
  14                     @ './lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main.js'
  15             if this.file.exists(modulePath)
  16                 try
  17                     set transformer = require('./lib/artifacts/' + transformerName + '/trans/main')
  18                 catch ex
  19                     return
  20                         _ error
  21                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  22                             @ 'getModelTransformer'
  23                             @ 'Error loading wizzi model transformer: ' + modulePath + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  24                 set this.modelTransformers[transformerName] = transformer
  25         return transformer

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/plugin/schema-definition.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     #
   3         # Retrieve a WizziSchema definition in JSON format
   4         # searching the loader in this WizziPackage.
   5         # No search up in "node_modules" folders.
   6     m getSchemaDefinition
   7         string schemaName
   8         var definition = this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] || null
   9         if definition == null
  10             var schemaJsonUri
  11                 _ path.resolve
  12                     @ __dirname
  13                     @ './lib/wizzi/models/' + schemaName + '-schema.g.json'
  14             if this.file.exists(schemaJsonUri)
  15                 try
  16                     set definition = this.file.readJSON(schemaJsonUri)
  17                 catch ex
  18                     return
  19                         _ error
  20                             @ 'WizziPluginError'
  21                             @ 'getSchemaDefinition'
  22                             @ 'Error loading wizzi schema definition: ' + schemaJsonUri + ', in plugin: ' + this.getFilename() + ', err: ' + ex.message + ', stack: ' + ex.stack
  23                 set this.schemaDefinitions[schemaName] = definition
  24         return definition

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/demo_module.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     $params name, level|0, step|1
   3     kind jsfile
   4     $$ imports available to every examples
   5     import path
   6     import util
   7     import async
   8     import wizzi
   9     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
  10     var inspect = require('object-inspect')
  11     var wzutils = require('wizzi-utils')
  12     var verify = require('wizzi-utils').verify
  13     var vfile = require('wizzi-utils').vfile
  14     var fsfile = vfile()
  15     $$ Let the mixer append other imports
  16     $hook imports
  17     $$ Declare vars that the mixer can set or not,
  18     $$ so that in any case the API methods can use them
  19     $$ avoiding a variable not declared exception.
  20     var mTreeBuildupContext = {}
  21     var artifactContext = {}
  22     var globalContext = {}
  23     var ${name}
  24         function
  25             param step_callback
  26             _ heading1
  27                 @ 'Advanced-example starting'
  28             $$ The mixer content will be appended here
  29             $hook
  30     set ${name}.__name = 'Level ${level} - ${name}'
  31     demo_prints( ${name},  ${level},  ${step} )
  32     set module.exports = ${name}
  33     if typeof require != 'undefined' && require.main === module
  34         _ ${name}

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/demo_prints.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params name, level|0, step|1
   3     function heading1
   4         param text
   5         log ''
   6         log '*'.repeat(120)
   7         log '** level ${level} - step ${step} - ${name} - ' + text
   8         log '*'.repeat(120)
   9         log ''
  10     function heading2
  11         param text
  12         log ''
  13         log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  14         log '   ','-- ${name} - ' + text
  15         log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  16         log ''
  17     function printArray
  18         param name
  19         param arr
  20         param fields
  21         param format
  22         if format === 'dashes'
  23             log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  24         log '   ', '* array ' + name + ' : '
  25         foreach item in arr
  26             log '    {', i
  27             var keys = fields || Object.keys(item)
  28             foreach k in keys
  29                 _ printValue
  30                     @ k
  31                     @ item[k]
  32     function printValue
  33         param key
  34         param value
  35         param format
  36         param p1
  37         if format === 'dashes' || format === 'meter'
  38             log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  39         if format === 'json'
  40             set value
  41                 _ stringify
  42                     @ value
  43                     @ null
  44                     @ 4
  45         if verify.isNotEmpty(value)
  46             var lines
  47                 _ verify.splitLines
  48                     @ value
  49                     {
  50                         @ numbered true
  51             if lines.length === 1
  52                 log '   ', key, ':', lines[0].text
  53             else
  54                 for var i=0; i<lines.length; i++
  55                     if i === 0
  56                         log '   ', key, ':', lines[0].numFmt, lines[0].text
  57                     else
  58                         log '   ', spaces(key.length+1), ' ', lines[i].numFmt, lines[i].text
  59         elif verify.isObject(value)
  60             log '   ', key, ':', inspect(value)
  61         else
  62             log '   ', key, ':', value
  63         if format === 'meter'
  64             _ meterLine(p1, '     ' + new Array(1 + key.length).join(' '))
  65     function spaces
  66         param len
  67         return new Array(len).join(' ')
  68     function meterLine
  69         param len
  70         param indent
  71         var sb = []
  72         var numW = len < 10 ? 1 : ( len < 100 ? 2 : 3 )
  73         var x
  74         for var i=0; i<numW; i++
  75             for var j=0; j<len; j++
  76                 set x = formatNum(j, numW)
  77                 _ sb.push(x.substr(i,1))
  78             log indent, sb.join('')
  79             set sb = []
  80     function formatNum
  81         param num
  82         param len
  83         var x = num.toString()
  84         return new Array(1 + len-x.length).join(' ') + x

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/jsonLoadModelAndGenerateArtifact.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, schema, artifact, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var save = false;
   5         var printArtifact = false;
   6         var printDashes = false;
   7         if (commandLine !== null) {
   8             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
   9             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  10                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  11                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  12                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  13                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  14                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  15                             if (actions[j] === 'artifact') {
  16                                 printArtifact = true;
  17                             }
  18                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  19                                 printDashes = true;
  20                             }
  21                         }
  22                     }
  23                 }
  24                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  25                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  26                         save = true;
  27                     }
  28                 }
  29             }
  30         }
  31     function execute
  32         param jsonFsData
  33         # Create a json factory without access control
  34         _ wizzi.jsonnoaclFactory
  35             {
  36                 @ plugins
  37                     {
  38                         @ items
  39                             [
  40                                 @ 'wizzi-core'
  41                                 @ 'wizzi-js'
  42                                 @ 'wizzi-web'
  43                 @ jsonFsData jsonFsData
  44                 @ globalContext globalContext
  45             f_cb_throw( wf )
  46                 _ wf.loadModelAndGenerateArtifact
  47                     _ path.join
  48                         @ __dirname
  49                         @ 'step_${step}'
  50                         @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  51                     {
  52                         @ modelRequestContext {}
  53                         @ artifactRequestContext {}
  54                     @ '${schema}/${artifact}'
  55                     f_cb_throw( artifactText )
  56                         $if save == true
  57                             # Save the artifact
  58                             # to the ./outputs folder
  59                             var dest
  60                                 _ path.join
  61                                     @ __dirname
  62                                     @ 'step_${step}'
  63                                     @ 'outputs'
  64                                     _ verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}')
  65                             _ wizzi.file.write
  66                                 @ dest
  67                                 @ artifactText
  68                             log verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}') + ' saved to ' + dest
  69                         $if printArtifact == true
  70                             _ printValue
  71                                 @ 'artifactText'
  72                                 @ artifactText
  73                                 $if printDashes === true
  74                                     @ 'dashes'
  75                         $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/loadModel_from_config.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var saveJson = false;
   5         var printJson = false;
   6         var printModel = false;
   7         var printDashes = false;
   8         if (commandLine !== null) {
   9             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
  10             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  11                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  12                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  13                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  14                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  15                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  16                             if (actions[j] === 'json') {
  17                                 printJson = true;
  18                             }
  19                             if (actions[j] === 'model') {
  20                                 printModel = true;
  21                             }
  22                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  23                                 printDashes = true;
  24                             }
  25                         }
  26                     }
  27                 }
  28                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  29                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  30                         saveJson = true;
  31                     }
  32                 }
  33             }
  34         }
  35     if typeof wizziFactoryConfig.globalContext === 'undefined'
  36         set wizziFactoryConfig.globalContext = globalContext
  37     # Create a filesystem factory without access control
  38     _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
  39         @ wizziFactoryConfig
  40         f_cb_throw( wf )
  41             # Now we can load the model
  42             _ wf.loadModelFromConfig
  43                 @ wizziModelConfig
  44                 @ globalContext
  45                 f_cb_throw( wizziModel )
  46                     $if saveJson == true
  47                         # And save the model in json format
  48                         # to the ./outputs folder
  49                         var dest
  50                             _ path.join
  51                                 @ __dirname
  52                                 @ 'step_${step}'
  53                                 @ 'outputs'
  54                                 @ '${ittfDocumentName}.json'
  55                         _ wf.fileService.write
  56                             @ dest
  57                             _ wizziModel.toJson()
  58                         log '   ', 'The json representation of ${ittfDocumentName}.json was saved to ' + dest
  59                     $if printJson == true
  60                         _ printValue
  61                             @ 'wizziModel.toJson()'
  62                             @ wizziModel.toJson()
  63                             $if printDashes === true
  64                                 @ 'dashes'
  65                     $if printModel == true
  66                         _ printValue
  67                             @ 'wizziModel'
  68                             @ wizziModel
  69                             $if printDashes === true
  70                                 @ 'dashes'
  71                     $hook

   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, commandLine|@@null

   4         var saveJson = false;
   5         var printJson = false;

   8         if (commandLine !== null) {
   9             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
  10             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  11                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  12                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  13                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {

  17                                 printJson = true;
  18                             }

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/loadModel.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var saveJson = false;
   5         var printJson = false;
   6         var printModel = false;
   7         var printDashes = false;
   8         if (commandLine !== null) {
   9             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
  10             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  11                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  12                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  13                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  14                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  15                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  16                             if (actions[j] === 'json') {
  17                                 printJson = true;
  18                             }
  19                             if (actions[j] === 'model') {
  20                                 printModel = true;
  21                             }
  22                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  23                                 printDashes = true;
  24                             }
  25                         }
  26                     }
  27                 }
  28                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  29                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  30                         saveJson = true;
  31                     }
  32                 }
  33             }
  34         }
  35     # Create a filesystem factory without access control
  36     _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
  37         {
  38             @ plugins
  39                 {
  40                     @ items
  41                         [
  42                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  43                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  44                             @ 'wizzi-web'
  45             @ globalContext globalContext
  46         f_cb_throw( wf )
  47             # Now we can load the model
  48             _ wf.loadModel
  49                 _ path.join
  50                     @ __dirname
  51                     @ 'step_${step}'
  52                     @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  53                 {
  54                 f_cb_throw( wizziModel )
  55                     $if saveJson == true
  56                         # And save the model in json format
  57                         # to the ./outputs folder
  58                         var dest
  59                             _ path.join
  60                                 @ __dirname
  61                                 @ 'step_${step}'
  62                                 @ 'outputs'
  63                                 @ '${ittfDocumentName}'.json
  64                         _ wf.fileService.write
  65                             @ dest
  66                             _ wizziModel.toJson()
  67                         log '   ', 'The json representation of ${ittfDocumentName}.json was saved to ' + dest
  68                     $if printJson == true
  69                         _ printValue
  70                             @ 'wizziModel.toJson()'
  71                             @ wizziModel.toJson()

  73                                 @ 'dashes'
  74                     $if printModel == true
  75                         _ printValue
  76                             @ 'wizziModel'
  77                             @ wizziModel
  78                             $if printDashes === true
  79                                 @ 'dashes'
  80                     $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/loadModelAndGenerateArtifact.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, schema, artifact, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var save = false;
   5         var printArtifact = false;
   6         var printDashes = false;
   7         if (commandLine !== null) {
   8             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
   9             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  10                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  11                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  12                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  13                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  14                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  15                             if (actions[j] === 'artifact') {
  16                                 printArtifact = true;
  17                             }
  18                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  19                                 printDashes = true;
  20                             }
  21                         }
  22                     }
  23                 }
  24                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  25                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  26                         save = true;
  27                     }
  28                 }
  29             }
  30         }
  31     # Create a filesystem factory without access control
  32     _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
  33         {
  34             @ plugins
  35                 {
  36                     @ items
  37                         [
  38                             @ 'wizzi-core'
  39                             @ 'wizzi-js'
  40                             @ 'wizzi-html'
  41                             @ 'wizzi-docs'
  42             @ globalContext globalContext
  43         f_cb_throw( wf )
  44             _ wf.loadModelAndGenerateArtifact
  45                 _ path.join
  46                     @ __dirname
  47                     @ 'step_${step}'
  48                     @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  49                 {
  50                     @ modelRequestContext {}
  51                     @ artifactRequestContext {}
  52                 @ '${schema}/${artifact}'
  53                 f_cb_throw( artifactText )
  54                     $if save == true
  55                         # Save the artifact
  56                         # to the ./outputs folder
  57                         var dest
  58                             _ path.join
  59                                 @ __dirname
  60                                 @ 'step_${step}'
  61                                 @ 'outputs'
  62                                 _ verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}')
  63                         _ wizzi.file.write
  64                             @ dest
  65                             @ artifactText
  66                         log verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}') + ' saved to ' + dest
  67                     $if printArtifact == true
  68                         _ printValue
  69                             @ 'artifactText'
  70                             @ artifactText
  71                             $if printDashes === true
  72                                 @ 'dashes'
  73                     $hook

src/ittf/examples/advanced/t/loadMTree.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var saveMTree = false;
   5         var raw = false;
   6         var printMTreeBrick = false;
   7         var printMTreeDump = false;
   8         var printMTreeToIttf = false;
   9         var printDashes = false;
  10         if (commandLine !== null) {
  11             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
  12             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  13                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  14                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  15                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  16                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  17                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  18                             if (actions[j] === 'mtree') {
  19                                 printMTreeBrick = true;
  20                             }
  21                             if (actions[j] === 'dump') {
  22                                 printMTreeDump = true;
  23                             }
  24                             if (actions[j] === 'ittf') {
  25                                 printMTreeToIttf = true;
  26                             }
  27                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  28                                 printDashes = true;
  29                             }
  30                         }
  31                     }
  32                 }
  33                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  34                     if (tokens[0] === 'raw') {
  35                         raw = true;
  36                     }
  37                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  38                         saveMTree = true;
  39                     }
  40                 }
  41             }
  42         }
  43     # Create a filesystem factory without access control.
  44     # For mTrees we require the dump of the mTree
  45     # buildup jsWizzi script. Just to take a look.
  46     _ wizzi.fsnoaclFactory
  47         {
  48             @ globalContext globalContext
  49             @ test
  50                 {
  51                     @ dumps
  52                         {
  53                             @ dumpsBaseFolder
  54                                 _ path.join
  55                                     @ __dirname
  56                                     @ 'step_${step}'
  57                                     @ 'dumps'
  58                             @ mTreeBuildupJsWizziScript
  59                                 {
  60                                     @ dump true
  61         f_cb_throw( wf )
  62             function load
  63                 param callback
  64                 $if raw === true
  65                     _ wf.loadMTreeRaw
  66                         _ path.join
  67                             @ __dirname
  68                             @ 'step_${step}'
  69                             @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  70                         @ callback
  71                 $else
  72                     _ wf.loadMTree
  73                         _ path.join
  74                             @ __dirname
  75                             @ 'step_${step}'
  76                             @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  77                         {
  78                         @ callback
  79             # Now we can load the document
  80             _ load
  81                 f_cb_throw( mTreeModel )
  82                     $if saveMTree == true
  83                         # And save the mTree model object
  84                         # to the ./outputs folder
  85                         var dest
  86                             _ path.join
  87                                 @ __dirname
  88                                 @ 'step_${step}'
  89                                 @ 'outputs'
  90                                 @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  91                         _ wf.fileService.write
  92                             @ dest
  93                             _ mTreeModel.toIttf()
  94                         log '   ', 'The ${ittfDocumentName} mTree was saved to ' + dest
  95                     $if raw === true
  96                         _ heading2( '${ittfDocumentName} - raw ittf document' )
  97                     $else
  98                         _ heading2( '${ittfDocumentName} - loaded mTree' )
  99                     $if printMTreeBrick == true
 100                         _ printValue
 101                             @ mTreeModel
 102                             @ mTreeModel
 103                             $if printDashes === true
 104                                 @ 'dashes'
 105                     $if printMTreeDump == true
 106                         _ printValue
 107                             @ 'mTreeModel.dump(true)'
 108                             @ mTreeModel.dump(true)
 109                             $if printDashes === true
 110                                 @ 'dashes'
 111                     $if printMTreeToIttf == true
 112                         _ printValue
 113                             @ 'mTreeModel.toIttf()'
 114                             @ mTreeModel.toIttf()
 115                             $if printDashes === true
 116                                 @ 'dashes'
 117                     $hook

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jobs/ittf__copy/jobs/step_1.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob step_1
   2     # Generates a javascript module
   3     # from a single ittf document of schema `js`
   4     $
   5         console.log( 'Destination folder name: ' + options.destFolder)
   6         var ittf_lib_folder  = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'lib');
   7         var dest_folder      = path.join(__dirname, options.destFolder);
   8     line lib
   9         cwd-folder ${ittf_lib_folder}
  10         # Generates a single javascript module
  11         artifact step_1_javascript_module
  12             src step_1.js.ittf
  13             schema js
  14             generator js/module
  15             extension js
  16     production
  17         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  18         line-ref lib

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jobs/index.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( jobs)

   3         _ path.join
   4             @ __dirname
   5             @ 'ittf'
   6             @ 'jobs'
   7     # Execute a wizzi job
   8     _ wizzi.job
   9         _ path.join
  10             @ jobsPath
  11             @ 'step_1.wfjob.ittf'
  12         {
  13             @ friends friendsArray
  14         {
  15             @ name 'step_1'
  16             { jobContext
  17                 { options
  18                     @ destFolder 'output'
  19             { globalContext
  20                 { options
  21                     @ destFolder 'output'
  22         f_cb_test( jobResults)
  23             log 'results of job step_1\n', stringify(jobResults, null, 2)
  24             return
  25                 _ step_callback
  26                     @ null
  27                     @ 'jobs example executed'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/assignments.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Assignment operators
   3     $
   4         var atests = [];
   5         function at(label, result) {
   6             atests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
   7         }
   8         var a = 0;
   9         at( 'var a = 0; a += 2' ,  a += 2 );)
  10         var a = 0;
  11         at( 'var a = 0; a -= 2' ,  a -= 2 );)
  12         var a = 3;
  13         at( 'var a = 3; a *= 2' ,  a *= 2 );)
  14         var a = 3;
  15         at( 'var a = 3; a /= 2' ,  a /= 2 );)
  16         var a = 3;
  17         at( 'var a = 3; a %= 2' ,  a %= 2 );)
  18         var a = 3;
  19         at( 'var a = 3; a <<= 2' ,  a <<= 2 );)
  20         var a = 3;
  21         at( 'var a = 3; a >>= 2' ,  a >>= 2 );)
  22         var a = 3;
  23         at( 'var a = 3; a >>>= 2' ,  a >>>= 2 );)
  24         var a = 3;
  25         at( 'var a = 3; a &= 2' ,  a &= 2 );)
  26         var a = 3;
  27         at( 'var a = 3; a |= 2' ,  a |= 2 );)
  28         var a = 3;
  29         at( 'var a = 3; a ^= 2' ,  a ^= 2 );)
  30     $foreach test in atests
  31         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  32     br
  33     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/builtins.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Builtin functions
   3     $
   4         var btests = [];
   5         function bt(label, result) {
   6             btests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
   7         }
   8         bt( 'parseInt(\'43.5\')' ,  parseInt(43.5) );)
   9         bt( 'parseFloat(\'43.5\')' ,  parseFloat(43.5) );)
  10         bt( 'isFinite(Infinity)',  isFinite(Infinity) );)
  11         bt( 'isFinite(NaN)',  isFinite(NaN) );)
  12         bt( 'isFinite(null)',  isFinite(null) );)
  13         bt( 'isFinite(0)',  isFinite(0) );)
  14         bt( 'Number.isFinite(null)',  Number.isFinite(null) );)
  15         bt( 'Number.isFinite(0)',  Number.isFinite(0) );)
  16         bt( 'isNaN(NaN)',  isNaN(NaN) );)
  17         bt( 'isNaN(undefined)',  isNaN(undefined) );)
  18         bt( 'isNaN({})',  isNaN({}));)
  19         bt( 'isNaN(true)',  isNaN(true) );)
  20         bt( 'isNaN(null)',  isNaN(null) );)
  21         bt( 'isNaN(37)',  isNaN(37) );)
  22         bt( 'isNaN(\'37\')',  isNaN('37') );)
  23         bt( 'isNaN(\'37.37\')',  isNaN('37.37') );)
  24         bt( 'isNaN(\'123ABC\')',  isNaN('123ABC') );)
  25         bt( 'parseInt(\'123ABC\')',  parseInt('123ABC') );)
  26         bt( 'Number(\'123ABC\')',  Number('123ABC') );)
  27         bt( 'isNaN(\'\')',  isNaN('') );)
  28         bt( 'Number(\'\')',  Number('') );)
  29         bt( 'isNaN(\' \')',  isNaN(' ') );)
  30         bt( 'Number(\' \')',  Number(' ') );)
  31         bt( 'isNaN(new Date())',  isNaN(new Date()) );)
  32         bt( 'isNaN(new Date().toString())',  isNaN(new Date().toString()) );)
  33         bt( 'isNaN(\'blabla\')',  isNaN('blabla') );)
  34         bt( 'Number(\'blabla\')',  Number('blabla') );)
  35         bt( 'parseFloat(3.14)',  parseFloat(3.14) );)
  36         bt( 'parseFloat(\'3.14\')',  parseFloat('3.14') );)
  37         bt( 'parseFloat(\'314e-2\')',  parseFloat('314e-2') );)
  38         bt( 'parseFloat(\'0.0314E+2\')',  parseFloat('0.0314E+2') );)
  39         bt( 'parseFloat(\'3.14more non-digit characters\')', parseFloat('3.14more non-digit characters') );)
  40         bt( 'parseInt(\' 0xF\',  16)',  parseInt(' 0xF',  16) );)
  41         bt( 'parseInt(\' F\',  16)',  parseInt(' F',  16) );)
  42         bt( 'parseInt(\'17\',  8)',  parseInt('17',  8) );)
  43         // not allowed in strict mode bt( 'parseInt(021, 8)', parseInt(021, 8) );
  44         bt( 'parseInt(\'015\',  10)',  parseInt('015',  10) );)
  45         bt( 'parseInt(15.99,  10)',  parseInt(15.99,  10) );)
  46         bt( 'parseInt(\'15, 123\',  10)',  parseInt('15, 123',  10) );)
  47         bt( 'parseInt(\'FXX123\',  16)',  parseInt('FXX123',  16) );)
  48         bt( 'parseInt(\'1111\',  2)',  parseInt('1111',  2) );)
  49         bt( 'parseInt(\'15 * 3\',  10)',  parseInt('15 * 3',  10) );)
  50         bt( 'parseInt(\'15e2\',  10)',  parseInt('15e2',  10) );)
  51         bt( 'parseInt(\'15px\',  10)',  parseInt('15px',  10) );)
  52         bt( 'parseInt(\'12\',  13)',  parseInt('12',  13) );)
  53         var set1 = ";,/?:@&=+$";
  54         var set2 = "-_.!~*'()";
  55         var set3 = "#";
  56         var set4 = "ABC abc 123";
  57         bt( 'set1 // Reserved Characters',  set1 );)
  58         bt( 'set2 // Unescaped Characters',  set2 );)
  59         bt( 'set3 // Number Sign',  set3 );)
  60         bt( 'set4 // Alphanumeric Characters + Space',  set4 );)
  61         bt( 'encodeURI(set1)',  encodeURI(set1) );)
  62         bt( 'encodeURI(set2)',  encodeURI(set2) );)
  63         bt( 'encodeURI(set3)',  encodeURI(set3) );)
  64         bt( 'encodeURI(set4)',  encodeURI(set4) );)
  65         bt( 'encodeURIComponent(set1)',  encodeURIComponent(set1) );)
  66         bt( 'encodeURIComponent(set2)',  encodeURIComponent(set2) );)
  67         bt( 'encodeURIComponent(set3)',  encodeURIComponent(set3) );)
  68         bt( 'encodeURIComponent(set4)',  encodeURIComponent(set4) );)
  69     $foreach test in btests
  70         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  71     br
  72     br
  73     h3 Builtin Date object
  74     p
  75         a
  76             href https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date
  77     $
  78         var otests = [];
  79         function ot(label, result) {
  80             otests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
  81         }
  82         ot( 'new Date() (today)',  new Date() );)
  83         ot( 'new Date(\'December 17,  1995 03:24:00\')',  new Date('December 17,  1995 03:24:00') );)
  84         ot( 'new Date(\'1995-12-17T03:24:00\')',  new Date('1995-12-17T03:24:00') );)
  85         ot( 'new Date(1995,  11,  17)',  new Date(1995,  11,  17) );)
  86         ot( 'new Date(1995,  11,  17,  3,  24,  0)',  new Date(1995,  11,  17,  3,  24,  0) );)
  87     $foreach test in otests
  88         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  89     br
  90     br
  91     h3 Builtin Number object
  92     p
  93         a
  94             href https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number
  95     $
  96         var otests = [];
  97         function ot(label, result) {
  98             otests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
  99         }
 100         ot( 'Number.MAX_VALUE',  Number.MAX_VALUE );)
 101         ot( 'Number.MIN_VALUE',  Number.MIN_VALUE );)
 102         ot( 'Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY',  Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY );)
 103         ot( 'Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY',  Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY );)
 104         ot( 'Number.NaN',  Number.NaN );)
 105         ot( 'Number(\'123\')',  Number('123') );)
 106         ot( 'Number(\'12.3\')',  Number('12.3') );)
 107         ot( 'Number(\'\')',  Number('') );)
 108         ot( 'Number(\'0x11\')',  Number('0x11') );)
 109         ot( 'Number(\'0b11\')',  Number('0b11') );)
 110         ot( 'Number(\'0o11\')',  Number('0o11') );)
 111         ot( 'Number(\'foo\')',  Number('foo') );)
 112         ot( 'Number(\'100a\')',  Number('100a') );)
 113     $foreach test in otests
 114         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
 115     br
 116     br
 117     h3 Builtin RegExp object
 118     p
 119         a
 120             href https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp
 121     $
 122         var otests = [];
 123         function ot(label, result) {
 124             otests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
 125         }
 126         ot( 'new RegExp(\'\\w+\')',  new RegExp('\\w+') );)
 127         var str = 'John Smith';
 128         var reValue = '(\\w+)\\s(\\w+)';
 129         var re = new RegExp(reValue);
 130         ot( '\'John Smith\'.replace(new RegExp(\'' + reValue + '\'),  \'$2,  $1\')',  str.replace(re,  '$2,  $1') );)
 131     $foreach test in otests
 132         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
 133     br
 134     br
 135     h3 Builtin Array object
 136     p
 137         a
 138             href https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array
 139     $
 140         var otests = [];
 141         function ot(label, result) {
 142             otests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
 143         }
 144         ot( 'new Array(4)',  new Array(4) );)
 145     $foreach test in otests
 146         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
 147     br
 148     br
 149     h3 Builtin Object object
 150     p
 151         a
 152             href https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object
 153     $
 154         var otests = [];
 155         function ot(label, result) {
 156             otests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
 157         }
 158         ot( 'new Object(true)',  new Object(true).toString() );)
 159     $foreach test in otests
 160         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
 161     br
 162     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/conditional.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Conditional operator
   3     $
   4         var ctests = [];
   5         function ct(label, result) {
   6             ctests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
   7         }
   8         ct( '3 == 3 ? 1 : 0',  3 == 3 ? 1 : 0 );)
   9         ct( 'true ? 5 : 2',  true ? 5 : 2 );)
  10     $foreach test in ctests
  11         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  12     br
  13     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/declarations.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Variable declarations
   3     $
   4         var name = 'Ribot';
   5         var runDowns = 16, runWon = 16;
   6         var placements = [1, 1, 1, 1, 1];
   7         var pedigree = {
   8             mother: 'Romanella',
   9             father: 'Tenerani',
  10             paternalGrandfather: 'Bellini',
  11             maternalGrandfather: 'El greco'
  12         };
  13     p ${name} was undefeated. Won ${runWon} out of ${runDowns} races.
  14     p His father was ${pedigree.father} and his mother ${pedigree.mother}.
  15     p His placements are boring: ${placements}, ...
  16     br
  17     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/expressions.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Unary expressions
   3     $
   4         var utests = [];
   5         function ut(label, result) {
   6             utests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
   7         }
   8         ut( '+2' ,  +2 );)
   9         ut( '-2' ,  -2 );)
  10         ut( '!(2 == 2)' ,  !(2 == 2) );)
  11         ut( '~2' ,  ~2 );)
  12         var a = 0;
  13         ut ('a', 0)
  14         ut( '++a' ,  ++a );)
  15         ut( '--a' ,  --a );)
  16         ut( 'typeof 3' ,  typeof 3 );)
  17         var b = { id: 1 };
  18         //TODO ut( 'delete b.id' , delete b.id );
  19     $foreach test in utests
  20         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  21     br
  22     h4 Not implemented
  23     p void operator
  24     p void operator
  25     br
  26     br
  27     h3 Binary expressions
  28     $
  29         var tests = [];
  30         function t(label, result) {
  31             tests.push( { label: label,  result: result });)
  32         }
  33         t( '2 + 2' ,  2 + 2 );)
  34         t( '5 - 2' ,  5 - 2 );)
  35         t( '3 * 3' ,  3 * 3 );)
  36         t( '6 / 2' ,  6 / 2 );)
  37         t( '5 % 2' ,  5 % 2 );)
  38         t( '5 == 2' ,  5 == 2 );)
  39         t( '5 != 2' ,  5 != 2 );)
  40         t( '5 > 2' ,  5 > 2 );)
  41         t( '5 >= 5' ,  5 >= 5 );)
  42         t( '5 < 2' ,  5 < 2 );)
  43         t( '5 <= 5' ,  5 <= 5 );)
  44         t( '"a" in { a: 1}' ,  "a" in { a: 1} );)
  45         //TODO t( '5 instanceof String' , 5 instanceof String );
  46         t( 'String(5)' ,  String(5) );)
  47         t( 'Number(\'5.5\')' ,  Number('5.5') );)
  48         t( 'Date(2013, 6, 12)' ,  Date(2013, 6, 12) );)
  49         t( 'String(5) instanceof String' ,  String(5) instanceof String );)
  50         t( 'Number(\'5.5\') instanceof Number' ,  Number('5.5') instanceof Number );)
  51         t( 'Date(2013, 6, 12) instanceof Date' ,  Date(2013, 6, 12) instanceof Date );)
  52         t( '5 << 5' ,  5 << 5 );)
  53         t( '5 >> 5' ,  5 >> 5 );)
  54         t( '5 >>> 5' ,  5 >>> 5 );)
  55         t( '5 | 5' ,  5 | 5 );)
  56         t( '5 & 5' ,  5 & 5 );)
  57         t( '5 ^ 5' ,  5 ^ 5 );)
  58     $foreach test in tests
  59         p ${test.label} = ${test.result}
  60     br
  61     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/functions.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Functions
   3     $
   4         function sayHello(name) {
   5             return 'Hii I am ' + name;
   6         }
   7         //TODO var ax = sayHello;
   8     p If Varenne could have talked he would have said: ${sayHello('Varenne')}.
   9     p If Ribot could have talked he would have said: $TODO {ax('Ribot')}.
  10     br
  11     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/loops.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 For loop
   3     $
   4         var sletters = 'a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h';
   5         var aletters = sletters.split(',');
   6         var letter, label='';
   7         for (var i=0; i<aletters.length; i++) {
   8             letter = aletters[i];
   9             label += i % 2 == 0 ? letter : letter.toUpperCase();
  10         }
  11     p The resulting label has the even letters upper cased: ${label}.
  12     br
  13     br
  14     h3 While loop
  15     $
  16         var x = 1, odds = '1';
  17         while ( x < 10 ) {
  18             x += 2;
  19             odds += ', ' + x
  20         }
  21     p First odd numbers: ${odds}.
  22     br
  23     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/statements.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h3 Statements
   3     $
   4         var name = 'Derby', winner = null;
   5         if (name == 'Ascot') {
   6             winner = 'Ribot';
   7         } else if (name == 'Arc de triomphe') {
   8             winner = 'Varenne';
   9         } else if (name == 'Derby') {
  10             winner = 'Ribot';
  11         } else {
  12             winner = 'Varenne';
  13         }
  14     p If the race was ${name} the winner was ${winner}.
  15     br
  16     br

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/ittf__copy/level_0/step_1__copy/t/string.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params commandParam
   3     h3 String functions
   4     $
   5         var commands = [];
   6         var actions = commandParam.split(';')
   7         for (var i=0; i<actions.length; i++) {
   8             var tokens = actions[i].trim().split(' ');
   9             var command = { name: tokens[0] };
  10             commands.push( command);)
  11         }
  12         _.log( commands);)
  13     div Let us inspect the 'commands' variable content.
  14     pre
  15         + Commands: ${ _.inspect(commands) }
  16     h4 Commands passed as mixin parameter
  17     p We perform a crazy operation, a template macro statement with
  18         + a multistatement jswizzi expression. We intersperse  command names
  19         + with dashes.
  20     $foreach command in commands
  21         div ${ command.name.toUpperCase()[0] + ' - ' + command.name }
  22         div This is quite crazy. But it works! -> ${ var len = command.name.length, output = ''; for (var i=0; i<len; i++) { output += command.name[i]; if (i < len -1) { output += ' - '}; _.log(output) } return output; }
  23     p That is why mTree stays for "magical tree".
  24     p See in wizzi-mtree/loader/ittfinterpolate.js how this works.
  25     br
  26     br

   1 html
   2     body
   3         declarations()

   6         conditional()
   7         assignments()
   8         statements()
   9         loops()
  10         string( alba chiara; diamante verde; luna rossa )
  11         builtins()

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/index.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( jswizzi)
   2     var sourcePath
   3         _ path.join
   4             @ __dirname
   5             @ 'ittf'
   6             @ 'level_0'
   7             @ 'step_1'
   8             @ 'sample.html.ittf'
   9     _ heading1
  10         @ 'sample.html.ittf'
  11     # Load a magical tree from an ittf document and a context object.
  12     _ wizzi.mtree
  13         @ sourcePath
  14         {
  15         f_cb_test( mTreeModel)
  16             _ printValue
  17                 @ 'sample.html.ittf - mTree'
  18                 @ mTreeModel.toIttf()
  19                 @ 'dashes'
  20             return
  21                 _ step_callback
  22                     @ null
  23                     @ 'jswizzi example executed'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/jswizzi/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     h1 JsWizzi examples
   3     p JsWizzi is the script language that you can use to transform an ittf document into a template.
   4     p
   5         a Documentation
   6             href https://wizzifactory.github.io/docs/jswizzi.html
   7     h3 Demo samples level-0
   8     table
   9         demo_step( 1)
  10             p This step uses an `html` ittf document to show samples of jswizzi statements.
  11             p The `html` artifact is not generated.
  12             p We simply build the mTree, just to take a look at the created nodes.

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/common.css.ittf



   1 $group
   2     < body
   3         margin 0
   4         padding 20px
   5         color #333
   6         background-color #efefef
   7         font 87.5%/1.4 HelveticaNeue, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
   8     < img
   9         max-width 100%
  10         display block
  11         height auto
  12     < figure
  13         margin 0
  14         padding 0
  15     < figcaption
  16         font-family "Georgia","Times New Roman",serif
  17         text-align center
  18         padding 0.5em 0 1em 0
  19     < h1
  20         + h2
  21         + h3
  22         + h4
  23         + h5
  24         + h6
  25         font-family "Georgia","Times New Roman",serif
  26         font-weight normal
  27         padding 0
  28         margin 0
  29     < h1
  30         font-size 328.571%
  31         margin-bottom 0.2em
  32     < h1.title
  33         text-align center
  34     < h2
  35         font-size 250%
  36         margin-bottom 0.2em
  37     < h3
  38         font-size 150%
  39         margin-bottom 0.2em
  40     < p
  41         margin 0
  42         padding 0 0 1em 0
  43     . wrapper
  44         background-color #fff
  45         color #444
  46         padding 1em 3% 1em 3%
  47         margin 0 auto 1em auto
  48     . mainnav ul
  49         margin 0
  50         padding 0
  51         list-style none
  52         font-size 120%
  53     . mainnav a:link
  54         + .mainnav a:visited
  55         text-decoration none
  56         color #444
  57     . quote
  58         font 150%/1.4 "Georgia","Times New Roman",serif
  59         padding 0
  60         margin 0

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/flexBox.css.ittf



   1 $group
   2     - thanks to https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/
   3     $
   4     - display: flex | inline-flex
   5     - flex-direction: row | row-reverse | column | column-reverse;
   6     - flex-wrap: nowrap | wrap | wrap-reverse
   7     - justify-content: flex-start | flex-end | center | space-between | space-around | space-evenly
   8     . fb-container
   9         display flex
  10         flex-direction row
  11         flex-wrap wrap
  12         justify-content flex-start

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/grid-rowcol.css.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params rStart, rEnd, cStart, cEnd
   3     grid-row-start ${rStart}
   4     grid-row-end ${rEnd}
   5     grid-column-start ${cStart}
   6     grid-column-end ${cEnd}

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/gridSystem_float.css.ittf



   1 $group
   2     - thanks to http://j4n.co/blog/Creating-your-own-css-grid-system
   3     $
   4         var columns = 6
   5         var percWidth = 100
   6         var maxWidth = 1200
   7         var gutter = 12
   8     - The basic grid contains just a few elements
   9     - . container
  10     - . rows
  11     - . columns
  12     - . gutters (the space between columns)
  13     - The width of the container is generally 100%,
  14     - but you might want to set a max-width for larger displays.
  15     . gsf-grid-container
  16         width ${percWidth}%
  17         max-width ${maxWidth}px
  18     - Using the 'border-box' model, we can create gutters with ease.
  19     - setting border box on all elements inside the grid
  20     . gsf-grid-container *
  21         box-sizing border-box
  22     - cleafix hack -  to make sure everything inside
  23     - the row stays inside the row.
  24     . gsf-row:before
  25         + .gsf-row:after
  26         content ""
  27         display table
  28         clear both
  29     - To prevent that empty columns will stack on top of each other
  30     - we'll give our columns a min-height of 1px as well as float them.
  31     < [class*='gsf-col-']
  32         float left
  33         min-height 1px
  34         - our gutter
  35         padding ${gutter}px
  36     - To find the width of one column, all we have to do is divide
  37     - the total number of columns by the width of the container.
  38     - In our case, the width of the container is ${percWidth}%,
  39     - and we want ${columns} columns, so ${percWidth}/${columns} = ${percWidth/columns}%.
  40     < [class*='gsf-col-']
  41         width ${percWidth/columns}%
  42     $for var i=1; i<columns+1; i++
  43         . gsf-col-${i}
  44             width ${(percWidth/columns)*i}%
  45     $for var i=0; i<columns; i++
  46         . gsf-sm-${i}
  47             margin-left ${(percWidth/columns)*i}%
  48             $if i > 0
  49                 @ *margin-left ${(percWidth/columns)*i-0.005}%
  50     . gsf-outline
  51         + .gsf-outline *
  52         outline 1px solid #F6A1A1
  53     - some extra column content styling
  54     < [class*='gsf-col-'] > p
  55         background-color #FFC2C2
  56         padding 0
  57         margin 0
  58         text-align center
  59         color white

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/gridSystem_float.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h1 Grid system float (old manner)
   3     p thanks to 
   4         a http://j4n.co/blog/Creating-your-own-css-grid-system
   5             href http://j4n.co/blog/Creating-your-own-css-grid-system
   6     . gsf-grid-container gsf-outline
   7         . gsf-row
   8             . gsf-col-1
   9                 p col-1
  10             . gsf-col-1
  11                 p col-1
  12             . gsf-col-1
  13                 p col-1
  14             . gsf-col-1
  15                 p col-1
  16             . gsf-col-1
  17                 p col-1
  18             . gsf-col-1
  19                 p col-1
  20         . gsf-row
  21             . gsf-col-2
  22                 p col-2
  23             . gsf-col-2
  24                 p col-2
  25             . gsf-col-2
  26                 p col-2
  27         . gsf-row
  28             . gsf-col-3
  29                 p col-3
  30             . gsf-col-3
  31                 p col-3
  32     hr
  33     . gsf-grid-container gsf-outline
  34         . gsf-row
  35             . gsf-sm-0
  36                 p sm-0
  37         . gsf-row
  38             . gsf-sm-1
  39                 p sm-1
  40         . gsf-row
  41             . gsf-sm-2
  42                 p sm-2
  43         . gsf-row
  44             . gsf-sm-3
  45                 p sm-3
  46         . gsf-row
  47             . gsf-sm-4
  48                 p sm-4
  49         . gsf-row
  50             . gsf-sm-2
  51                 p sm-2

   9         };

  15         };

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/gridSystem.css.ittf



   1 $group
   2     - thanks to https://gridbyexample.com/examples/page-layout/
   3     - example 1
   4     . gs-1-wrapper
   5         width 960px
   6         padding 1em 3% 1em 3%
   7         margin 0 auto 1em auto
   8         display grid
   9         grid-template-columns 200px 40px auto 40px 200px
  10         grid-template-rows auto
  11     . gs-1-content
  12         grid-rowcol( 2, 3, 3, 4)
  13         background-color #FFC242
  14     . gs-1-mainnav
  15         grid-rowcol( 2, 3, 1, 2)
  16         background-color #FFC282
  17     . gs-1-subhead
  18         grid-rowcol( 1, 2, 3, 4)
  19         background-color #FFC2C2
  20     . gs-1-quote
  21         background-color #FFC202
  22         grid-rowcol( 2, 3, 5, 6)
  23     - example 2
  24     . gs-2-sidebar
  25         grid-area sidebar
  26     . gs-2-sidebar2
  27         grid-area sidebar2
  28     . gs-2-content
  29         grid-area content
  30     . gs-2-header
  31         grid-area header
  32     . gs-2-footer
  33         grid-area footer
  34     . gs-2-wrapper
  35         background-color #fff
  36         color #444
  37     . gs-2-wrapper
  38         display grid
  39         grid-gap 1em
  40         grid-template-areas
  41             @ header
  42             @ sidebar
  43             @ content
  44             @ sidebar2
  45             @ footer
  46     media only screen and (min-width: 500px)
  47         . gs-2-wrapper
  48             grid-template-columns 20% auto
  49             grid-template-areas
  50                 @ header   header
  51                 @ sidebar  content
  52                 @ sidebar2 sidebar2
  53                 @ footer   footer
  54     media only screen and (min-width: 600px)
  55         . gs-2-wrapper
  56             grid-gap 20px
  57             grid-template-columns 120px auto 120px
  58             grid-template-areas
  59                 @ header  header  header
  60                 @ sidebar content sidebar2
  61                 @ footer  footer  footer
  62             max-width 600px
  63     . gs-2-box

  65         color #fff
  66         border-radius 5px
  67         padding 10px
  68         font-size 150%
  69     . gs-2-header

  72     . gs-2-sidebar2

  74         color #444

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/level_0/step_1__copy/t/gridSystem.html.ittf



   1 $group
   2     h1 Grid system
   3     p thanks to 
   4         a https://gridbyexample.com/examples/page-layout/
   5             href https://gridbyexample.com/examples/page-layout/
   6     h3 Example 1
   7     article
   8         class gs-1-wrapper
   9         nav
  10             class gs-1-mainnav
  11             ul
  12                 li
  13                     a Introductory
  14                         href
  15                 li
  16                     a The First Cat Show
  17                         href
  18                 li
  19                     a Habits
  20                         href
  21                 li
  22                     a Trained Cats
  23                         href
  24                 li
  25                     a Usefulness of Cats
  26                         href
  27         h2 Usefulness of cats
  28             class gs-1-subhead
  29         . gs-1-content
  30             p In our urban and suburban houses what should we do without cats? In our sitting or bedrooms, our libraries, in our kitchens and storerooms, our farms, barns, and rickyards, in our docks, our granaries, our ships, and our wharves, in our corn markets, meat markets, and other places too numerous to mention, how useful they are! In our ships, however, the rats oft set them at defiance; still they are of great service.
  31             p How wonderfully patient is the cat when watching for rats or mice, awaiting their egress from their place of refuge or that which is their home! How well Shakespeare in Pericles, Act iii., describes this keen attention of the cat to its natural pursuit!
  32             blockquote
  33                 p The cat, with eyne of burning coal, Now crouches from (before) the mouse's hole.
  34         blockquote
  35             class gs-1-quote
  36             p Let any one have a plague of rats and mice, as I once had, and let them be delivered therefrom by cats, as I was, and they will have a lasting and kind regard for them.
  37     h3 Example 2 (responsive)
  38     . gs-2-wrapper
  39         div Header
  40             class gs-2-box gs-2-header
  41         div Sidebar
  42             class gs-2-box gs-2-sidebar
  43         div Sidebar 2
  44             class gs-2-box gs-2-sidebar2
  45         div Content
  46             class gs-2-box gs-2-content
  47             br
  48             + More content than we had before so this column is now quite tall.
  49         div Footer
  50             class gs-2-box gs-2-footer

   6         $for var i=0; i<numitems; i++
   7             li item ${i}
   8                 class ${liclass}

   6         loadModelAndGenerateArtifact( 1,  basic.html.ittf,  html,  document,  save;print:artifact dash )
   7             _ step_callback(null)
