src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/css/index.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( css.languageschema)
   2     $
   3         var name = 'css.languageschema';
   4         var levels = ['0'];
   5     _ heading1
   6         @ 'loaded'
   7     var samples
   8         [
   9             $foreach level in levels
  10                 @ require('./level_${level}')
  11     _ async.series
  12         @ samples
  13         f_cb_throw()
  14             var msg = '${name} - samples - done.'
  15             log msg
  16             if step_callback
  17                 return
  18                     _ step_callback
  19                         @ null
  20                         @ msg

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/classes.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # CLASSES
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # A class example
   9         # In module.kind es5, three common functions are generated
  10         # once at the beginning of
  11         # the module and used by all the declared classes:
  12         # _inherits(subClass, superClass)
  13         # _classCallCheck(instance, Constructor)
  14         # _get
  15     class Horse
  16         super Animal
  17         ctor
  18             string name
  19             { options
  20                 boolean canSpeakLikeAHuman
  21                     optional
  22             set this.name = name
  23             set this.options = options
  24         m sayHello
  25             if this.options.canSpeakLikeAHuman
  26                 log 'Hello i am ' + this.name
  27             else
  28                 log 'Hii i am ' + this.name
  29         m create
  30             static
  31             string name
  32             { options
  33                 boolean canSpeakLikeAHuman
  34                     optional
  35             return
  36                 new Horse
  37                     @ name
  38                     @ options
  39     #
  40         # Creating a class instance
  41     var instance1
  42         new Horse
  43             @ name
  44             {
  45                 @ canSpeakLikeAHuman false

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/conditionals.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # CONDITIONALS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # The if, else if, else conditional statement
   9     if oper === 'sum'
  10         log 'sum', a + b
  11     elif oper === 'times'
  12         log 'times', a * b
  13     elif oper === 'sub'
  14         log 'subtract', a - b
  15     else
  16         log 'divide', a / b
  17     #
  18         # The switch conditional statement
  19     switch letter
  20         case 'a'
  21             log 'alfa'
  22         case 'b'
  23             log 'beta'
  24         default
  25             log 'gamma'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/debug.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # DEBUG
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # Elements supporting debug statements
   9     log 'obj', obj, 'name', obj.name
  10     log? obj
  11     log? 'myobject', obj
  12     warn 'obj', obj, 'name', obj.name
  13     error 'obj', obj, 'name', obj.name
  14     chalk green 'obj', red obj.name

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/declarations.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # DECLARATIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # Examples of variable declarations
   9     # Without init value
  10     var alfa
  11     # With simple init value
  12     var beta = 'beta'
  13     # With init value returned by a function call
  14     var gamma
  15         _ getGamma
  16             @ alfa
  17             @ beta
  18     # With init value returned by a constructor
  19     var newError
  20         new Error
  21             @ 'Something went wrong'
  22     # With a function or object as init value
  23     var mySum
  24         function
  25             param alfa
  26             param beta
  27             return alfa + beta + (alfa + beta) / 3
  28     # With an object as init value
  29     var user
  30         {
  31             @ id 'bepi'
  32             [ roles
  33                 @ 'admin'
  34     # Multiple declarations
  35     var
  36         decl i
  37         decl k = 10
  38         decl name
  39             _ getUserById
  40                 @ 'bepi'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/exceptions.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # EXCEPTIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # Try/catch
   9     var result = null
  10     try
  11         set result = 100
  12         var rnd = (int)(Math.random() * 99)
  13         if rnd % 2 == 0
  14             set result /= 0
  15         else
  16             set result /= 2
  17         _ sendResult
  18             @ result
  19     catch ex
  20         log ex.message
  21     finally
  22         set result = null
  23     #
  24         # Throw an exception
  25     function divide
  26         param a
  27         param b
  28         if b == 0
  29             throw
  30                 new Error
  31                     @ 'You are about to divide by 0'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/expressions.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # EXPRESSIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # The iif conditional statement
   9     var name
  10         iif sex === 'M'
  11             then 'stefi'
  12             else 'annie'
  13     #
  14         # Member access
  15     var name
  16         _ getCurrentUser
  17             . name
  18     #
  19         # Member access computed
  20     var randomArrayItem
  21         _ getItems
  22             .[
  23                 _ Math.floor
  24                     times
  25                         _ Math.random()
  26                         _ getItems
  27                             . length
  28     #
  29         # Building templates, various binary expressions can be
  30         # easer to code when written in indented form.
  31         #
  32     var r1
  33         ||
  34             + seen_one
  35             _ getNext
  36                 @ item
  37                 &&
  38                     + is_ok
  39                     _ checkName
  40                         @ name
  41     var r2
  42         &&
  43             + seen_one
  44             + seen_two
  45     #
  46         # Work in this way
  47         # or : ||
  48         # and : &&
  49         # equal strict : ===
  50         # notequal strict : !==
  51         # equal : ==
  52         # not equal : !=
  53         # minus : minus
  54         # plus : plus
  55         # times : times
  56         # divide : divide
  57         # power : power
  58         # mod : mod
  59         # xor : xor
  60         # xand : xand
  61         # gt : gt
  62         # ge : >=
  63         # lt : lt
  64         # le : <=

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/functions.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # FUNCTIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # This constraints a param to be a boolean
   9     function submit
  10         boolean ok
  11         number maxValue
  12     #
  13         # This constraints a param to be an object with a required array property.
  14         # So the object itself is required.
  15     function initialize
  16         { plugins
  17             [ items
  18             string baseFolder
  19         func reset
  20             optional
  21     #
  22         # The 'callback' element means the parameter is required and must be a function.
  23     function readFile
  24         string filePath
  25         callback
  26             string fileContent
  27     #
  28         # An immediately invoked function expression
  29     iife
  30         unary-prefix ;
  31         string x
  32         number y
  33         return alpha = x + ': ' + y
  34         ()
  35             @ key
  36             @ id

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/iterations.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # ITERATIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # The foreach iteration
   9     foreach item in arr5
  10         log 'item ', i, item
  11     #
  12         # The backeach iteration (foreach backwards)
  13     backeach item in arr5
  14         log 'item ', i, item
  15     #
  16         # Nested foreach
  17         # Until 6 nesting are allowed
  18         # The letters used for iterations are, in order:
  19         # i, j, k, l, m, n
  20     foreach item5 in arr5
  21         log 'item5', i, item5
  22         foreach item4 in arr4
  23             log 'item4', j, item4
  24     #
  25         # Nested backeach
  26         # Until 6 nesting are allowed
  27         # The letters used for iterations are in order:
  28         # i, j, k, l, m, n
  29     backeach item5 in arr5
  30         log 'item5', i, item5
  31         backeach item4 in arr4
  32             log 'item4', j, item4
  33     #
  34         # Foreach's and backeach's
  35         # can be mixed
  36     backeach item5 in arr5
  37         log 'item5', i, item5
  38         foreach item4 in arr4
  39             log 'item4', j, item4
  40     #
  41         # For loops
  42     for var k in object3
  43         log k, object3[k]
  44     #
  45         # While loops
  46     var parent = node.parent
  47     while typeof(parent) !== 'undefined'
  48         log parent.id
  49         set parent = parent.parent
  50     #
  51         # Inside iterations you can use break and continue nodes
  52     for var k in object3
  53         if k === 'go'
  54             break
  55         if k === 'skip'
  56             continue
  57         log k, object3[k]

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/objects.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # OBJECTS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # How to declare an empty object
   9     var object1
  10         {
  11     var object1_b = {}
  12     #
  13         # How to declare an object structure
  14     var object2
  15         {
  16             @ name 'stefi'
  17             @ friends
  18                 [
  19                     {
  20                         @ name 'arthur'
  21                     {
  22                         @ name 'marilu'
  23     #
  24         # How to declare an object structure, new compact format
  25     var object3
  26         {
  27             @ name 'stefi'
  28             { address
  29                 @ city 'Reggio nell'Emilia'
  30             [ friends
  31                 {
  32                     @ name 'arthur'
  33                 {
  34                     @ name 'marilu'
  35     #
  36         # How to declare an empty array
  37     var arr1
  38         [
  39     var arr1_b = []
  40     #
  41         # How to declare simple arrays
  42     var arr2
  43         [ 'stefi'
  44     var arr2_b = [ 'stefi' ]
  45     var arr3
  46         [ 'stefi', 'annie'
  47     var arr3_b = [ 'stefi', 'annie' ]
  48     #
  49         # How to declare an array structure
  50     var arr4
  51         [
  52             @ 'stefi'
  53             @ 'annie'
  54     var arr5
  55         [
  56             {
  57                 @ id 1
  58             {
  59                 @ id 2
  60     #
  61         # Object and array properties can be functions
  62         # or results of functions call.
  63         # Note: properties may be written both escaped or not.
  64     var object4
  65         {
  66             @ name
  67                 _ 'stefi'.toUpperCase()
  68             { address
  69                 @ city 'Reggio nell\'Emilia'
  70             { address2
  71                 @ city 'Reggio nell'Emilia'
  72             @ getInfo
  73                 function
  74                     return this.name + ', city: ' + this.address.city

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/t/test.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # TEST
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # Elements supporting the Mocha test framework
   9     describe my synchronous component
  10         before
  11         before-each
  12         after
  13         after-each
  14         it should do a great work quickly
  15     describe my asynchronous component
  16         before-async
  17             _ done
  18         after-async
  19             _ done
  20         it-async should do a great work in a reasonable time
  21             _ done

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_1__copy/basic.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     $
   4         /* required by examples */
   5         var isUpperCaseRequired = false;
   6     #
   7         # Rationale
   8         #
   9         # Ittf documents are, at the same time, templates and lego brick pieces.
  10         # Every node of an ittf document is computable and composable.
  11         # It may contain, be the result of, be the starting point of, a computation
  12         # or a composition.
  13         # To 'alberize', render in indented tree format, a javascript
  14         # source code greatly simplifies the brick composition of a module,
  15         # at the cost of a little weird coding style that is easy to get
  16         # acquainted of.
  17         # The biggest cost, at the moment, is the lack of syntax highlighting and
  18         # code completion, but Wizzi studio is under way and it will
  19         # make up for that.
  20         #
  21     #
  22         # In many cases you can choose how much to 'alberize' a statement.
  23     # This statement ...
  24     var myLetters
  25         _ 'a, b, c'.split
  26             @ '.'
  27             ._ trim
  28                 ._ toUpperCase
  29     # ... can be written without indentation
  30     var myLetters = 'a, b, c'.split('.').trim().toUpperCase()
  31     # Sometimes it is a matter of style and personal preference.
  32     # Other times an indentation is required when templating. Imagine that upper case
  33     # be a design choice in differentent scenarios.
  34     # You could write ...
  35     var myLetters
  36         _ 'a, b, c'.split
  37             @ '.'
  38             ._ trim
  39                 $if isUpperCaseRequired
  40                     ._ toUpperCase
  41     # A deep indentation allow a template decision on every node
  42     # of the AST.
  43     $include declarations
  44     $include objects
  45     $include expressions
  46     $include conditionals
  47     $include iterations
  48     $include exceptions
  49     $include functions
  50     $include classes
  51     $include debug
  52     $include test

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_2__copy/t/classes.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # CLASSES
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # A class example
   9     class Horse
  10         super Animal
  11         ctor
  12             string name
  13             { options
  14                 boolean canSpeakLikeAHuman
  15             set this.name = name
  16             set this.options = options
  17         m sayHello
  18             if this.options.canSpeakLikeAHuman
  19                 log 'Hello i am ' + this.name
  20             else
  21                 log 'Hii i am ' + this.name
  22         m create
  23             static
  24             string name
  25             { options
  26                 boolean canSpeakLikeAHuman
  27             return
  28                 new Horse
  29                     @ name
  30                     @ options
  31     #
  32         # Creating a class instance
  33     var instance1
  34         new Horse
  35             @ name
  36             {
  37                 @ canSpeakLikeAHuman false

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_2__copy/t/functions.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # ES6 FUNCTIONS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # An arrow function example
   9     var mySum
  10         =>
  11             param a
  12             param b
  13             return a + b

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_2__copy/t/statements.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     +
   3     # ========================================
   4     # STATEMENTS
   5     # ========================================
   6     +
   7     #
   8         # The 'export' element can export default and named functions (and objects).
   9     export var foo = Math.sqrt(2)
  10     export
  11         var foo = Math.sqrt(2)
  12     export
  13         var foo
  14             {
  15                 @ name 'stefi'
  16     export
  17         function Hello
  18             string name
  19     export default
  20         var foo = Math.sqrt(2)
  21     export default
  22         {
  23             @ name 'stefi'
  24     export default
  25         function
  26             { options
  27                 string name
  28             callback

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_2__copy/es6_1.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind es6
   3     #
   4         # module kind es6 (ECMA script 6)
   5         #
   6         # This module kind supports the new javascript synthax.
   7         # The generated source must be transpiled using Babel.
   8         #
   9     $include classes
  10     $include functions
  11     $include statements

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_3__copy/t/component.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     react Button
   3         state
   4             @ pressed false
   5         prop caption
   6             string
   7             required
   8         will-mount
   9         did-mount
  10         will-unmount
  11         should-update
  12         did-update
  13         will-update
  14         will-receive-props
  15         => handleClick
  16             _ this.setState
  17                 {
  18                     @ ...this.state
  19                     @ pressed !this.state.pressed
  20         render
  21             prop caption
  22             return
  23                 div
  24                     button {caption}
  25                         @ onClick { this.handleClick }

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_3__copy/t/container.js.ittf



   1 $group

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_3__copy/react_1.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind react
   3     #
   4         # React module kind
   5         #
   6         # The wizzi factory is language and framework agnostic.
   7         # It is a manipulator, transformer and composer of text documents,
   8         # to whose semantics it is indifferent.
   9         # The plugins are those that target specific domains.
  10         #
  11         # To came to life, and became an application, the wizzi factory
  12         # has chosen a few target domains, first of all: nodejs, javascript, html,
  13         # style sheets, and has implemented some core plugins, that are
  14         # the starters of the factory.
  15         #
  16         # A fundamental component of the wizzi factory application, which development
  17         # is under way, is the Wizzi studio web application. For the UI of
  18         # Wizzi studio the React framework has been chosen.
  19         #
  20         # The 'js' wizzi schema, implemented by the wizzi-js plugin, contains elements
  21         # taylored for the React framework.
  22         #
  23         #
  24         # This module kind supports the new javascript synthax and React jsx.
  25         # The generated source must be transpiled using Babel.
  26         #
  27     $include component
  28     $include container

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/languageschemas/js/level_0/step_4__copy/module_1.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     #
   4         # Javascrpt module elements
   5         #
   6         # This are experimental elements supporting
   7         # commonjs modularity.
   8         #
   9     wz-var gamma = 1
  10     wz-const tau = 2
  11     wz-function beta
  12         param a
  13         param b
  14     wz-class Alfa
  15         ctor
  16             param options
  17         m goHome

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/models/level_0/step_0_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( models)
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: how to load an IttfDocument into an `html` wizzi model,
   4         # passing a context object to the mTree loader.
   5         #
   6         # API   wizzi.model(sourcePathOrModelInfo, context?, options?)
   7     var htmlFriendsPath
   8         _ path.join
   9             @ __dirname
  10             @ 'step_0'
  11             @ 'friends.html.ittf'
  12     # Load an html model.
  13         # The html schema is detected from the path.
  14     _ wizzi.model
  15         @ htmlFriendsPath
  16         {
  17             @ friends friendsArray
  18         f_cb_test( wizziModel)
  19             _ printValue
  20                 @ 'wizziModel'
  21                 _ stringify
  22                     @ wizziModel
  23                     @ null
  24                     @ 4
  25                 @ 'dashes'
  26             return
  27                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/models/level_0/step_1_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( wizzimodel,  0,  1 )
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: how to load an IttfDocument into an `html` wizzi model,
   4         # passing a context object to the mTree loader.
   5         #
   6         # API   wizzi.model(sourcePathOrModelInfo, context?, options?)
   7     +
   8     _ wizzi.model
   9         _ path.join
  10             @ __dirname
  11             @ 'step_1'
  12             @ 'basic.html.ittf'
  13         {
  14             @ wf
  15                 {
  16                     [ packages
  17                         {
  18                             @ name 'wizzi-utils'
  19                             @ title 'Wizzi factory utility library'
  20                         {
  21                             @ name 'wizzi-mTree'
  22                             @ title 'mTree loader'
  23         f_cb_throw( wizziModel )
  24             # And print the wizzi model object
  25             _ printValue
  26                 @ 'wizziModel'
  27                 _ stringify
  28                     @ wizziModel
  29                     @ null
  30                     @ 4
  31                 @ 'dashes'
  32             return
  33                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/models/level_0/step_2_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( wizzimodel,  0,  2 )
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: how to load an IttfDocument into an `html` wizzi model,
   4         # passing a context object to the mTree loader and
   5         # passing a value to the globalContext using the options parameter.
   6         #
   7         # API   wizzi.model(sourcePathOrModelInfo, context?, options?)
   8     +
   9     _ wizzi.model
  10         _ path.join
  11             @ __dirname
  12             @ 'step_2'
  13             @ 'basic.html.ittf'
  14         {
  15             @ wf
  16                 {
  17                     [ packages
  18                         {
  19                             @ name 'wizzi-utils'
  20                             @ title 'Wizzi factory utility library'
  21                         {
  22                             @ name 'wizzi-mTree'
  23                             @ title 'mTree loader'
  24         {
  25             @ globalContext
  26                 {
  27                     @ infoLine 'If you can see me the global context worked fine.'
  28         f_cb_throw( wizziModel )
  29             _ printValue
  30                 @ 'wizziModel'
  31                 _ stringify
  32                     @ wizziModel
  33                     @ null
  34                     @ 4
  35                 @ 'dashes'
  36             return
  37                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/models/level_0/step_3_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( wizzimodel,  0,  3 )
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: how to load an IttfDocument into an `html` wizzi model,
   4         # passing a modelInfo object to the sourcePathOrModelInfo parameter.
   5         #
   6         # The model has a context model described in the modelInfo object.
   7         #
   8         # API   wizzi.model(sourcePathOrModelInfo, context?, options?)
   9     +
  10     var modelsComplexPath
  11         _ path.join
  12             @ __dirname
  13             @ 'step_0'
  14             @ 'complex'
  15     +
  16     _ wizzi.model
  17         {
  18             @ src
  19                 _ path.join
  20                     @ modelsComplexPath
  21                     @ 'forms.html.ittf'
  22             @ schema 'html'
  23             [ contexts
  24                 {
  25                     @ src
  26                         _ path.join
  27                             @ modelsComplexPath
  28                             @ 'formsData.json.ittf'
  29                     @ schema 'json'
  30                     @ exportName 'data'
  31         f_cb_test( wizziModel)
  32             log 'wizziModel.wzElement', wizziModel.wzElement
  33             _ wizzi.gen
  34                 @ wizziModel
  35                 f_cb_test( artifactText)
  36                     log 'artifactText complex forms\n', artifactText
  37             return
  38                 _ step_callback
  39                     @ null
  40                     @ 'models example executed'

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_0/step_1__copy/basic.demo.ittf



   1 hello
   2     I am
   3         a sample ittf document.
   4     mTree load is not typed
   5         by a schema
   6     so i may contain
   7         any node.
   8     But i must respect
   9         indentation
  10         and cannot have more than one root node.

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_0/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     $
   4         var name = 'mtrees';
   5         var level = '0';
   6         var steps = ['1', '2', '3'];
   7     import async
   8     var samples
   9         [
  10             $foreach step in steps
  11                 @ require('./step_${step}_go')
  12     function execute
  13         param callback
  14         _ async.series
  15             @ samples
  16             f_cb_throw()
  17                 var msg = '${name} - Level ${level} samples - done.'
  18                 log msg
  19                 if callback
  20                     return
  21                         _ callback
  22                             @ null
  23                             @ msg
  24     set module.exports = execute
  25     if typeof require != 'undefined' && require.main==module
  26         _ execute

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_0/step_1_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( mtree_simple,  0,  1 )
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: How to load a simple ittf document into an mTree.
   4         #
   5         # This is a simple document with no template or composition commands.
   6     +
   7     loadMTree( 1,  basic.demo.ittf,  print:mtree dump dashes )
   8         _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_0/step_2_go.js.ittf

   2     #
   3         # DEMO: How to load a composed ittf document into an mTree.
   4         #
   5         # We use an `html` ittf document to show an example of
   6         # composition, calling mixins.
   7         #
   8         # The `html` artifact here is not generated.
   9         # We build the mTree only, just to take a look to node transformations.
  10     +
  11     log '    The primary ittf document `composed_1.html.ittf` mixes the `lia.html.ittf` mixin'
  12     log 'You can se the raw ittf documents and the builded mTree'
  13     +
  14     loadMTree( 2,  composed_1.html.ittf,  raw;print:dump )
  15         loadMTree( 2,  t/lia.html.ittf,  raw;print:dump )
  16             loadMTree( 2,  composed_1.html.ittf,  print:dump )
  17                 _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_0/step_3_go.js.ittf



   1 example-essentials( mtree_contained,  0,  3 )
   2     #
   3         # DEMO: How to load into an mTree a ittf document
   4         # which root is a mixin call to its container.
   5         #
   6         # We use an `html` ittf document to show an example of
   7         # composition, calling mixins.
   8         #
   9         # The `html` artifact here is not generated.
  10         # We build the mTree only, just to take a look to node transformations.
  11     +
  12     log '    The primary ittf document `contained_1.html.ittf` mixes its container `layout.html.ittf` '
  13     log '    and the `lia.html.ittf` mixin'
  14     log '    You can se the raw ittf documents and the builded mTree'
  15     +
  16     loadMTree( 3,  contained_1.html.ittf,  raw;print:dump )
  17         loadMTree( 3,  t/layout.html.ittf,  raw;print:dump )
  18             loadMTree( 3,  t/lia.html.ittf,  raw;print:dump )
  19                 loadMTree( 3,  contained_1.html.ittf,  print:dump )
  20                     _ step_callback(null)

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_1/step_1__copy/lia.html.ittf



   1 li
   2     $params text, href
   3     a ${text}
   4         href ${href}

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/mtrees/level_1/step_1__copy/treeview_1.html.ittf



   1 html
   2     body
   3     $
   4         function buildNode(parent, childCount, deep) {
   5             parent.childs = [];
   6             if (deep > 3) { return; }
   7             parent.childs = [];
   8             for (var i = 0; i < childCount; i++) {
   9                 var child = { id: parent.id + '-' + i};
  10                 buildNode( child,  childCount,  deep + 1);)
  11                 parent.childs.push( child);)
  12             }
  13         }
  14         var tree = { id: 0 };
  15         buildNode( tree,  2,  0);)
  16     div Let us inspect the 'tree' variable we built.
  17     pre
  18         + tree: ${ _.inspect(tree) }
  19     # a brute force tree view rendering
  20     # working until 3 levels deep.
  21     ul
  22         $foreach node in tree.childs
  23             lia( node${node.id},  /node${node.id} )
  24                 $if node.childs.length > 0
  25                     ul
  26                         $foreach node2 in node.childs
  27                             lia( node${node2.id},  /node${node2.id} )
  28                                 $if node2.childs.length > 0
  29                                     ul
  30                                         $foreach node3 in node2.childs
  31                                             lia( node${node3.id},  /node${node3.id} )
  32     # beautifull tree view rendering
  33     # without depth limits
  34     $function nodeView
  35         $param parent
  36         div node${parent.id}
  37             $foreach nodeChild in parent.childs
  38                 $_ nodeView
  39                     $@ nodeChild
  40     $_ nodeView
  41         $@ tree

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/schemas/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     h1 Wizzi schema examples
   3     p A wizzi schema is a specific wizzi model, of type `wfschema`, that can be used to describe and generate the javascript modules that implement a wizzi model.

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/t/demo_prints.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params name, level|0, step|1
   3     function heading1
   4         param text
   5         log ''
   6         log '*'.repeat(120)
   7         log '** level ${level} - step ${step} - ${name} - ' + text
   8         log '*'.repeat(120)
   9         log ''
  10     function heading2
  11         param text
  12         log ''
  13         log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  14         log '   ','-- ${name} - ' + text
  15         log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  16         log ''
  17     function printArray
  18         param name
  19         param arr
  20         param fields
  21         param format
  22         if format === 'dashes'
  23             log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  24         log '   ', '* array ' + name + ' : '
  25         foreach item in arr
  26             log '    {', i
  27             var keys = fields || Object.keys(item)
  28             foreach k in keys
  29                 _ printValue
  30                     @ k
  31                     @ item[k]
  32     function printValue
  33         param k
  34         param v
  35         param format
  36         param p1
  37         if format === 'dashes' || format === 'meter'
  38             log '   ', '-'.repeat(100)
  39         if format === 'json'
  40             set v
  41                 _ stringify
  42                     @ v
  43                     @ null
  44                     @ 4
  45         if verify.isNotEmpty(v)
  46             var lines
  47                 _ verify.splitLines
  48                     @ v
  49                     {
  50                         @ numbered true
  51             if lines.length === 1
  52                 log '   ', k, ':', lines[0].text
  53             else
  54                 for var i=0; i<lines.length; i++
  55                     if i === 0
  56                         log '   ', k, ':', lines[0].numFmt, lines[0].text
  57                     else
  58                         log '   ', spaces(k.length+1), ' ', lines[i].numFmt, lines[i].text
  59         elif verify.isObject(v)
  60             log '   ', k, ':', inspect(v)
  61         else
  62             log '   ', k, ':', v
  63         if format === 'meter'
  64             _ meterLine(p1, '     ' + new Array(1 + k.length).join(' '))
  65     function spaces
  66         param len
  67         return new Array(len).join(' ')
  68     function meterLine
  69         param len
  70         param indent
  71         var sb = []
  72         var numW = len < 10 ? 1 : ( len < 100 ? 2 : 3 )
  73         var x
  74         for var i=0; i<numW; i++
  75             for var j=0; j<len; j++
  76                 set x = formatNum(j, numW)
  77                 _ sb.push(x.substr(i,1))
  78             log indent, sb.join('')
  79             set sb = []
  80     function formatNum
  81         param num
  82         param len
  83         var x = num.toString()
  84         return new Array(1 + len-x.length).join(' ') + x

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/t/example-essentials.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     $params name, level|0, step|1
   3     kind jsfile
   4     import path
   5     import util
   6     import async
   7     var stringify = require('json-stringify-safe')
   8     var inspect = require('object-inspect')
   9     var wizzi = require('wizzi')
  10     var file = require('wizzi-utils').file
  11     var verify = require('wizzi-utils').verify
  12     var friendsArray
  13         [
  14             @ 'arthur'
  15             @ 'mary'
  16     demo_prints( ${name},  ${level},  ${step} )
  17     set module.exports
  18         function exec
  19             param step_callback
  20             _ heading1
  21                 @ 'example-essentials starting'
  22             $hook

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/t/loadModelAndGenerateArtifact.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, schema, artifact, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var save = false;
   5         var printArtifact = false;
   6         var printDashes = false;
   7         if (commandLine !== null) {
   8             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
   9             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  10                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  11                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  12                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  13                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  14                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  15                             if (actions[j] === 'artifact') {
  16                                 printArtifact = true;
  17                             }
  18                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  19                                 printDashes = true;
  20                             }
  21                         }
  22                     }
  23                 }
  24                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  25                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  26                         save = true;
  27                     }
  28                 }
  29             }
  30         }
  31     _ heading1
  32         @ 'starting step ${step} ${ittfDocumentName}'
  33     _ wizzi.gen
  34         _ path.join
  35             @ __dirname
  36             @ 'step_${step}'
  37             @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  38         {
  39             @ modelRequestContext {}
  40             @ artifactRequestContext {}
  41         @ '${schema}/${artifact}'
  42         f_cb_throw( artifactText )
  43             $if save == true
  44                 # Save the artifact
  45                 # to the ./outputs folder
  46                 var dest
  47                     _ path.join
  48                         @ __dirname
  49                         @ 'step_${step}'
  50                         @ 'outputs'
  51                         _ verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}')
  52                 _ wizzi.file.write
  53                     @ dest
  54                     @ artifactText
  55                 log verify.stripExtension('${ittfDocumentName}') + ' saved to ' + dest
  56             $if printArtifact == true
  57                 _ printValue
  58                     @ 'artifactText'
  59                     @ artifactText
  60                     $if printDashes === true
  61                         @ 'dashes'
  62             $hook

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/t/loadMTree.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params step, ittfDocumentName, commandLine|@@null
   3     $
   4         var saveMTree = false;
   5         var raw = false;
   6         var printMTreeBrick = false;
   7         var printMTreeDump = false;
   8         var printMTreeToIttf = false;
   9         var printDashes = false;
  10         if (commandLine !== null) {
  11             var commands = commandLine.split(';')
  12             for (var i=0; i<commands.length; i++) {
  13                 var tokens = commands[i].trim().split(':');
  14                 if (tokens.length == 2) {
  15                     if (tokens[0] == 'print') {
  16                         var actions = tokens[1].trim().split(' ');
  17                         for (var j=0; j<actions.length; j++) {
  18                             if (actions[j] === 'mtree') {
  19                                 printMTreeBrick = true;
  20                             }
  21                             if (actions[j] === 'dump') {
  22                                 printMTreeDump = true;
  23                             }
  24                             if (actions[j] === 'ittf') {
  25                                 printMTreeToIttf = true;
  26                             }
  27                             if (actions[j] === 'dashes') {
  28                                 printDashes = true;
  29                             }
  30                         }
  31                     }
  32                 }
  33                 if (tokens.length == 1) {
  34                     if (tokens[0] === 'raw') {
  35                         raw = true;
  36                     }
  37                     if (tokens[0] === 'save') {
  38                         saveMTree = true;
  39                     }
  40                 }
  41             }
  42         }
  43     function load
  44         param callback
  45         $if raw === true
  46             _ wizzi.mtree
  47                 _ path.join
  48                     @ __dirname
  49                     @ 'step_${step}'
  50                     @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  51                 {
  52                 {
  53                     @ raw true
  54                 @ callback
  55         $else
  56             _ wizzi.mtree
  57                 _ path.join
  58                     @ __dirname
  59                     @ 'step_${step}'
  60                     @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  61                 {
  62                 @ callback
  63     # Now we can load the document
  64     _ load
  65         f_cb_throw( mTreeModel )
  66             $if saveMTree == true
  67                 # And save the mTree model object
  68                 # to the ./outputs folder
  69                 var dest
  70                     _ path.join
  71                         @ __dirname
  72                         @ 'step_${step}'
  73                         @ 'outputs'
  74                         @ '${ittfDocumentName}'
  75                 _ wf.fileService.write
  76                     @ dest
  77                     _ mTreeModel.toIttf()
  78                 log '   ', 'The ${ittfDocumentName} mTree was saved to ' + dest
  79             $if raw === true
  80                 _ heading2( '${ittfDocumentName} - raw ittf document' )
  81             $else
  82                 _ heading2( '${ittfDocumentName} - loaded mTree' )
  83             $if printMTreeBrick == true
  84                 _ printValue
  85                     @ mTreeModel
  86                     @ mTreeModel
  87                     $if printDashes === true
  88                         @ 'dashes'
  89             $if printMTreeDump == true
  90                 _ printValue
  91                     @ 'mTreeModel.dump(true)'
  92                     @ mTreeModel.dump(true)
  93                     $if printDashes === true
  94                         @ 'dashes'
  95             $if printMTreeToIttf == true
  96                 _ printValue
  97                     @ 'mTreeModel.toIttf()'
  98                     @ mTreeModel.toIttf()
  99                     $if printDashes === true
 100                         @ 'dashes'
 101             $hook

src/ittf/examples/starter/essentials/index.js.ittf



   1 module
   2     kind jsfile
   3     import async
   4     var examples
   5         [
   6             _ require('./languageschemas')
   7             $*
   8             _ require('./jswizzi')
   9             _ require('./mtrees')
  10             _ require('./models')
  11             _ require('./languageschemas')
  12             _ require('./jobs')
  13             _ require('./schemas')
  14             *$
  15     function exec
  16         param callback
  17         _ async.mapSeries
  18             @ examples
  19             function
  20                 param example
  21                 param callback
  22                 _ example(callback)
  23             f_cb_test( results)
  24                 log 'Starter-essentials examples results\n', results
  25                 if callback
  26                     _ callback
  27                         @ null
  28                         @ 'Starter-essentials examples executed'
  29     set module.exports
  30         function
  31             param callback
  32             _ exec(callback)
  33     if require.main === module
  34         _ exec

   6     var advanced_plugins = require('./examples/advanced/plugins')
   7     var request = process.argv.length > 2 ? process.argv[2] : 'all'
   8     var p1 = process.argv.length > 3 ? process.argv[3] : null
   9     if request == 'se' || request == 'all'
  10         _ starter_essentials(p1)
  11     if request == 'sa' || request == 'all'
  12         _ starter_apps(p1)
  13     if request == 'ae' || request == 'all'
  14         _ advanced_essentials(p1)
  15     if request == 'ap' || request == 'all'
  16         _ advanced_plugins(p1)

src/ittf/root/readme.md.ittf



   1 md
   2     p
   3         @ align center
   4         a
   5             href https://wizzifactory.github.io
   6             @ rel noopener
   7             @ target _blank
   8             img
   9                 @ width 450
  10                 @ src https://wizzifactory.github.io/images/logo.svg
  11                 @ alt Wizzi
  12     h1 Wizzi demo
  13     p The official examples to get started with the wizzi factory.
  14     h2 Installation
  15     p The wizzi demo is available as an [npm package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/wizzi-demo).
  16     sh
  17         + npm install wizzi-demo
  18     p A setup script must be run.
  19     sh
  20         + npm run setup
  21     h2 Usage
  22     sh
  23         + node index all|se|sa|ae|ap
  24         + # se = starter-essentials
  25         + # sa = starter-apps
  26         + # ae = advanced-essentials
  27         + # ap = advanced-plugins
  28     h2 Starter
  29     p These examples use the default factory for a quick start.
  30     p The default factory is an internally configured factory, that uses a `filesystem` store and has three pre-loaded plugins: `wizzi-core`, `wizzi-js` and `wizzi-web`. It is a starter factory to play with, that targets common web technologies.
  31     h3 Essentials
  32     p Contains [examples](https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-demo/tree/master/starter/essentials) of essential methods of the wizzi factory API.
  33     h3 Apps
  34     p Contains [examples](https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-demo/tree/master/starter/apps) of using the default factory to build react/redux single page apps.
  35     h2 Advanced
  36     h3 Essentials
  37     p [This section](https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-demo/tree/master/advanced/essentials) shows how to configure a wizzi factory instance with plugins and document stores of your choice, to accomplish essential tasks.
  38     p You will use the `filesystem`, `mongodb` and `jsonfs` document stores.
  39     h4 Plugins
  40     p Explains how to create new [plugins](https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-demo/tree/master/advanced/plugins).

   6             log 'Advanced.essentials.filesystem.plugins generated'

src/ittf/t/exec_examples.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $*
   3         require
   4         $
   5             var name = 'xxx';
   6             var exampleFolders = ['folder_a', 'folder_b', ...];
   7     *$
   8     import async
   9     var examples
  10         [
  11             $foreach folder in exampleFolders
  12                 _ require('${folder}')
  13     function exec
  14         param callback
  15         _ async.mapSeries
  16             @ examples
  17             function
  18                 param example
  19                 param callback
  20                 _ example(callback)
  21             f_cb_test( results)
  22                 log '${name} examples results\n', results
  23                 if callback
  24                     _ callback
  25                         @ null
  26                         @ '${name} examples executed'
  27     set module.exports
  28         function
  29             param callback
  30             _ exec(callback)
  31     if require.main === module
  32         _ exec

src/ittf/t/exec_levels.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $*
   3     require
   4         $
   5             var name = 'xxx';
   6             var levels = ['a', 'b', ...];
   7     *$
   8     import async
   9     var samples
  10         [
  11             $foreach level in levels
  12                 @ require('./level_${level}')
  13     _ async.series
  14         @ samples
  15         f_cb_throw()
  16             var msg = '${name} - samples - done.'
  17             log msg
  18             if step_callback
  19                 return
  20                     _ step_callback
  21                         @ null
  22                         @ msg

src/ittf/t/exec_steps.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $*
   3     require
   4         $
   5             var name = 'xxx';
   6             var level = 'y';
   7             var steps = ['a', 'b', ...];
   8     *$
   9     import async
  10     var samples
  11         [
  12             $foreach step in steps
  13                 @ require('./step_${step}_go')
  14     function execute
  15         param callback
  16         _ async.series
  17             @ samples
  18             f_cb_throw()
  19                 var msg = '${name} - Level ${level} samples - done.'
  20                 log msg
  21                 if callback
  22                     return
  23                         _ callback
  24                             @ null
  25                             @ msg
  26     set module.exports = execute
  27     if typeof require != 'undefined' && require.main==module
  28         _ execute

src/ittf/t/f_cb_no_err.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params result|notUsed
   3     function
   4         param err
   5         param ${result}
   6         $hook

src/ittf/t/f_cb_test.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params result|notUsed
   3     function
   4         param err
   5         param ${result}
   6         if err
   7             throw
   8                 new Error
   9                     _ JSON.stringify
  10                         @ err
  11                         @ null
  12                         @ 2
  13         $hook

src/ittf/t/f_cb_throw.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params result|notUsed
   3     function
   4         param err
   5         param ${result}
   6         if err
   7             throw
   8                 new Error
   9                     _ JSON.stringify
  10                         @ err
  11                         @ null
  12                         @ 2
  13         $hook

src/ittf/t/f_cb.js.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $params result|notUsed
   3     function
   4         param err
   5         param ${result}
   6         if err
   7             return
   8                 _ callback
   9                     @ err
  10         $hook

src/ittf/t/readme_vars.md.ittf



   1 $group
   2     $
   3         var urldoc = 'https://wizzifactory.github.io';
   4         var url_concepts = 'https://wizzifactory.github.io/concepts.html';
   5         var url_docs = 'https://wizzifactory.github.io/docs';
   6         var url_api = 'https://wizzifactory.github.io/api.html';
   7         var url_demo_ittf_source = 'https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi/tree/master/packages/ittf-sources/v5/apps/wizzi-demo/src/ittf/examples';
   8         var url_demo_js_source = 'https://github.com/wizzifactory/wizzi-demo/tree/master/dist';

src/generate.wfjob.ittf



   1 wfjob demo
   2     $
   3         var ittf_meta_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'meta');
   4         var ittf_root_folder      = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'root');
   5         var ittf_examples         = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'examples');
   6         var ittf_scripts          = path.join(__dirname, 'ittf', 'scripts');
   7         var dest_folder           = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'dist');
   8     model meta
   9         schema json
  10         src ${ittf_meta_folder}/index.json.ittf
  11     $include wfjob/root
  12     line ittf-examples
  13         cwd-folder ${ittf_examples}
  14         dest-folder ${dest_folder}/examples
  15         wfjob/any_js()
  16             ignore ${ittf_examples}/**/*__copy/**/*.js.ittf
  17         artifact any_ittf_inside___copy
  18             src ${ittf_examples}/**/*__copy/**/*.ittf
  19             extension ittf
  20         $include wfjob/any_md
  21     line ittf-scripts
  22         cwd-folder ${ittf_scripts}
  23         dest-folder ${dest_folder}/scripts
  24         wfjob/any_js()
  25             ignore ${ittf_scripts}/**/*__copy/**/*.js.ittf
  26         artifact any_ittf_inside___copy
  27             src ${ittf_scripts}/**/*__copy/**/*.ittf
  28             extension ittf
  29         $include wfjob/any_md
  30     production
  31         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
  32         line-ref ittf-root
  33         line-ref ittf-examples
  34         line-ref ittf-scripts

../t/common/proj_gitignore.text.ittf



   1 text
   2     .DS_Store
   3     .nodemonignore
   4     .sass-cache/
   5     npm-debug.log
   6     node_modules/
   7     public/lib
   8     app/tests/coverage/
   9     .bower-*/
  10     .idea/
  11     .bin/
  12     .obj/
  13     obj/
  14     bin/
  15     Properties/
  16     private/

   1 text
   2     $params copy
   3     MIT License
   4     br
   5     Copyright (c) ${copy}
   6     br
   7     Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
   8     of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
   9     in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
  10     to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
  11     copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
  12     furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
  13     br
  14     The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in
  15     all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
  16     br
  17     THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
  18     IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
  19     FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
  20     AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
  21     LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
  22     OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN
  23     THE SOFTWARE.

../t/wfjob/root.wfjob.ittf



   1 $group
   2     line ittf-root
   3         cwd-folder ${ittf_root_folder}
   4         dest-folder ${dest_folder}
   5         any_js()
   6             ignore ${ittf_root_folder}/**/*__copy.*/**/*.js.ittf
   7         any_json()
   8             model-ref meta
   9                 export-name wfpackage
  10         any_md()
  11             model-ref meta
  12                 export-name wfpackage
  13         any_text()
  14             model-ref meta
  15                 export-name wfpackage
  16         artifact .gitignore
  17             src .gitignore.text.ittf
  18             schema text
  19             generator text/document
  20             dest-path .gitignore
  21             extension gitignore

../t/wfjob/any_js.wfjob.ittf



   1 $group
   2     artifact any_js
   3         src ./**/*.js.ittf
   4         schema js
   5         generator js/module
   6         extension js
   7         $hook

../t/wfjob/any_json.wfjob.ittf



   1 $group
   2     artifact any_json
   3         src ./**/*.json.ittf
   4         schema json
   5         generator json/document
   6         extension json
   7         $hook

../t/wfjob/any_md.wfjob.ittf



   1 $group
   2     artifact any_md
   3         src ./**/*.md.ittf
   4         schema md
   5         generator md/document
   6         extension md
   7         $hook

../t/wfjob/any_text.wfjob.ittf



   1 $group
   2     artifact any_text
   3         src ./**/*.text.ittf
   4         schema text
   5         generator text/document
   6         extension txt
   7         $hook
